author: {'steamid': '76561197960414332', 'num_games_owned': 884, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 3241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1316, 'last_played': 1674368566}
review:
This is essentially an Enhanced edition of Eador: Genesis. It took the old game, moved it to a 3d engine for modern systems, changed the UI, and revamped the campaign to have more variety and less filler. As of the final patch, outside of a couple matters of preference - some people enjoy the simpler graphics of the older one and its UI is stronger in places but weaker in others - it is flatly superior to the original version, especially when it comes to the campaign, which moves quicker and has more variety in maps.

Stability, however, is touch and go, and I doubt I could recommend this game in its vanilla form. However, the "Fixers of the Broken World" fan patch has dramatically improved the situation, enough to recommend the game if the patch is installed and special care is taken while playing. You may still see an occasional random crash because the memory management in this engine is unfortunately fundamentally flawed, but most reproducible crashes have been resolved (or are quickly resolved when reported with a savegame and log).

"Special care" entails being careful not to constantly reload saved games. With the memory management being flawed, unloading and loading a game almost always causes some memory to leak as the manager fails to release the now-unused memory from the first save state. Unfortunately this isn't something that can be easily fixed as the engine Eador uses is now defunct and unsupported. 

Anecdotally, Auto-Saves seem to cause a leak, or at least instability, as well - though if you aren't a diligent manual saver, consider leaving them on but configured to a higher number (every 5 or 10 turns) just to protect yourself in case of a random crash.

Obviously there are hoops to jump through for this one, and if you somehow missed real classics like Heroes 3 Complete or the Age of Wonders series it's absolutely worth skipping this and checking out those first. But if you've already played those and want more, Eador is worth the hoop-jumping.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008208124', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1629501985}
review:
The game has a special beauty, calling you to play but has a very boring and grindy side too, so I have mixed feelings against the game. As this Masters of the Broken World (MotB) is better than all other Eador titles, I rate this positive. But I will mention negative parts mainly here.  

And I will tell you the most important part here at the beginning.

If you buy the game you will notice that, very small fraction of the players finished the game (6% like that), and only 13.3% of players finished the First Shard in Campaign (Shard: map, episode, mission, campaign turn, whatever you call it). You can find the same data by simply checking Steam Achievements of the game, which "The Wise Old Man" achievement (by having a dialogue with first rival faction mage: Oinor) appears just after beating the first shard (after tutorial) and it is the beginning of the game!

So between 6-13.3% of players played Eador campaign properly! 
This is terrible news. it means most of the players didn't make progress in Campaign at all, but they stopped playing in early episodes (after all the grindy, boring progress). 

On the other hand, this is definitely best in Eador series over Eador Imperium and Eador Genesis. Eador MotB doesn't have slow turn paces like Imperium (Eador series are already very slow paced games) and obviously has better graphics than Genesis and has other improvements over it. 
Also Imperium looks almost similar like MotB already and MotB is better and more fun to play for that reason. 

However all Eador games suffer same slow economy and slow progression which eat MANY hours to progress in a single Tiny or Small map. Sorry, you can't rush to conquer enemy, when all hexes between you and enemy are full of monsters in challenging difficulties too, so in order to beat them, you need to progress and it will take HOURS with grindy battles. 

And the need to repeat all those battles in EVERY SINGLE shard is simply boring (has reasons). Especially, when most of the battles have same patterns with same limited battle-map size does not give you a liking to battles much (you can't flank enemy with horse archers or flank enemy ranged units with your cavalry, because map is too narrow to maneuver. You are either supposed to defend or charge at the enemy directly which your only tactical options are terrain features and different abilities of the characters). 
Further, you cannot transfer your progress to next shard easily too, you have to pay very expensive amount of energy and you will find yourself dismissing the hero completely at the end of the shard/mission or only transferring the hero and had to remove all items and soldiers from your army which is a very tedious task.  
As a result, you have to train a new hero in many of the shards you play and develop him up to 15-20 levels everytime with grindy battles in order to have power to beat the enemy in the shard. There are wrong gameplay designs sadly. 

Bugs: I encountered bugs in early Campaign which persuades you to not progress further, however after the first shard (the shard after tutorial), the game becomes playable. Thanksfully you don't encounter same bugs at same points, by repeating a game "load" you have an opportunity to pass the bug. The bugs are generally errors happening in the background (inner workings of the game) and it makes the game unplayable by freezing or requiring you to crash the game manually. Sometimes there is no problem at all and sometimes you are in a loop of bugs. Bugs happened especially in Tutorial and next Campaign episode, now on 2nd and 3rd shards I didn't encounter any bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960447880', 'num_games_owned': 2306, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 34348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34988, 'last_played': 1625293547}
review:
First of all, after sinking over 580 hours into Eador Masters of the Broken World i did not encounter a single bug crash or anything described by some of the reviewers, the game ran smoothly.

For a turn based fantasy strategy game, Eador has the longest Campaign i have ever played and you seriously need to hang on to it if you ever want to defeat or even reach the last Master.
The game is not the most accomplished or attractive strategy game out there but it did gave me some good time, excitements, joy, annoyance, sleepless nights, hair pulling, desk banging and frustrations. Then i know after all this that the game was worth playing.
it would be a mistake to compare Eador with the other fantasy strategy game out there because the game stands on it own.

Eador has nice graphics, the fantasy atmosphere is well reproduce and a story line could have been better, the music isn't too bad however best to turn it off.
Eador has almost everything you can expect from a fantasy turn based strategy game, building you Fortress and improving it, you can hire your Heroes and build many units with their own strength and weakness, mythical units like manticore, hydra, dragon, pegasus, trolls, gobblins and many more are all present in the game, build your armies and conquer the world of Eador.

Positives: 
                         - Fantasy strategy game with nice graphics.
                         - Unbelievably long Campaign.
                         - Great choice of heroes and units
                         - Heroes and Army Unit can level up by earning XP, you can pay for one Hero and his army to progress to 
                           the next shard to continue your conquest.
                         - Many items and equipment can be obtained or bought to improve your Heroes.
                         - Random events will occur in your Cities and you'll have to make decisions with possible consequences.
                         - Magic is also available if you choose that path depending on the class of your Heroes and magical building  
                           can be constructed.
                         - You can find Eggs from Mythical creatures and hatch them so they can be added to your army (Basilik, 
                            Manticore, Hydra, Spider, dragon....).
                         - Alliance with local species can be made to help you conquer your shard.

Negatives:
                         - Combats can be random,boring and repetitive, they are not always balanced however you will have the
                           opportunity to measure up the strength of your army against the enemy before deciding to ether engage 
                           or retreat before the actual confrontation takes place.
                         - The number of items you can carry over to the next stage of your conquest is ridiculous and specially
                            considering the amount of them you can find.
                         - You can only construct 1 building per turn, with an upgrade you'll then have the possibility to construct 2 
                            per turn and per city, It's an unbelievably stupid system considering how many buildings you can 
                            construct and  how many cities you will manage. It makes improvement process so damn painfully slow.
                         - The Masters you are facing maybe different visually but their strategy during shard conquest is all but the 
                            same.

Overall i found Eador to be a good and entertaining  fantasy turn based strategy game, most elements are there and also  some unique elements like hatching eggs, mini quests to obtain an alliance with local species, explorations...). If you can get over a long campaign which can be very boring and repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103764528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10176, 'last_played': 1620594529}
review:
Один из тех многих тысяч игроков, которым лень писать длинные обзоры. Точнее писать вообще обзоры. 
Вот лайк поставить за качественное описание - всегда пожалуйста, или купить доп контент, чтобы поддержать разработчиков, особенно если это инди-проекты. 
Но как же нужно довести пользователя такого типа как я, чтобы он сел и начал укладывать в словесный ряд одно простое предложение: разработчики - безрукие у*****ки, ибо это 10 из 10, когда ты втянулся в игру и  тут на очередном осколке тебе подряд, чтобы ты не делал - ошибка №......, out of memory и т.д. 
И за что платил деньги, спрашивается, чтобы потом вот так сидеть и вместо удовольствия от игры получать унылое го**но.
И это не вопрос механики или нравится - не нравится сюжет или жанр, это тупо, убогие кривые руки тех, кто берет деньги за незаконченные продукт. 
Отдельное пожелание разработчикам: чтобы вам хирург также операцию как-ниб. сделал, на половине которой просто его руки выдали out of memory. 
В общем не рекомендую к покупке и использованию.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004433268', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1609579246}
review:
2/10

I gave Eador a try for a few hours, working through games in my backlog.  While the game is undeniably pretty, it is a mess of systems that are cumbersome and poorly explained, it progresses very slowly, and combat feels random and punishing, even in the game's introductory tutorial scenario.  Looking at the game's combat system, I was hoping for something reminiscent of Heroes of Might & Magic III, which I would've been pretty into, even if it wasn't as good as the old class.  I gave Eador two sessions of a couple hours a piece to try to give it a decent shot, but nothing that happened in those 3-4 hours gave me any inclination to come back.  The hope that it would be a worthwhile riff off HOMM3 was left unfulfilled and I was pretty disappointed by it.  If you're also hoping for a game to scratch that same itch, don't waste your time and go elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068074539', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 856, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1558955640}
{'steamid': '76561198122215038', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 185800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3052, 'playtime_at_review': 77498, 'last_played': 1710887977}
review:
Excelente juego.

pros
* Batallas tacticas, Magia, Manejo de reino
* Construir heroes, customizando los level ups. Clases de heroe y subclases y especializaciones
* Batallas tacticas tienen sentido, visualmente buenas
* Manejo de recursos es dificil y estrategico, si se sube la dificultad sobre todo
* Montones de criaturas de variados poderes, montones de items desde los basicos a los legendarios

cons
* a algunos jugadores les puede parecer dificil el juego
*Algunos bugs ocasionales.
(el de los barbaros que quedan en cero de vida se salva con f10 y terminar batalla rapido)
* la ia tiene diplomacia medio basica
* posiblemente el balance esta mal en algunos detalles, no mucho.

review:

Железо позволяет, средства есть, но печально, когда наиграл много времени писать об этом.  Российский продукт доведите до ума, я ваш поклонник, удачи!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064838002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 17282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17282, 'last_played': 1611358387}
review:
Eador:MotBW is a solid turn-based grand strategy, where you take control of a mage, who fights with other mages over the islands in the Astral. You grow units, skills, forge alliances with various creatures and develop your provinces. While also try to figure out who you are and to stop (or aid) Chaos.

It is based on a Russian indie game, Eador: Creation (Эадор Сотворение), which was made by one man back in a day. Eador:MotBW, you can rate as a "remaster", with beter graphics...and thats pretty much it. In other aspects, from heroes variety to character building, from balance to AI - it is actually a major downgrade - hence the negative reviews - these guys made a remaster that turned out to be worse than the original, lol. 

However, if you did not play Eador:Creation (it is still not available in English afaik), and love turn-based grand strategies (closest examples - HoMM series, King's Bounty, etc), then Eador: MotBW is great even by itself. Very good for relaxing with a cup of cacao in the evening while building your empire on another shard :)

Overall: 7/10 Not quite the the remaster it should have been, but still a very solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068669954', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5035, 'last_played': 1611537229}
review:
Lo cierto es que este juego me encanta. La combinación de estrategia y rol me parece fantástica, si bien es cierto que en ocasiones en varios aspectos se queda corta. 

No he probado Eador Imperium, pero estoy seguro de que habrán mejorado muchas de las funcionalidades y detalles del juego. 

La gran pega de este juego, es que está plagado de bugs que te tiran de la partida. No suele ser un problema que te anule el juego, porque hay saves casi constantemente; pero sí que resulta muy tedioso. En ocasiones, he tenido que repetir el mismo combate hasta 3 veces. Lo he probado en varios ordenadores y he llegado a tener también la versión de FX. En STEAM, desde luego, es dónde mejor funciona con diferencia. 

Ya lo digo, si tuviera que decir si lo recomiendo, la respuesta es sí. Pero si confirman que Eador: Imperium se crashea menos de 1/3 de las veces de las que lo hace este, no me pensaba en adquirirlo. 

7/10

review:

review:
онлайн оставляет надежду на то что эти 2 играющих человека встретятся тебе раз в 3-4 дня,играя между собой,они дают понять что иди ка ты парниш в компанию или ещё куда,и ты идёшь,казуалишь развлекаешься и всё такое,получаешь классный опыт от игры и стабильно раз в пол года настальгируешь и смотришь на этих двух играющих челиков которые хер знает вообще что делают
  игра по всей видимости одиночная,онлайн до конца не доделан,радует что он вообще есть,при игре более чем в 2 лица будут недоработки,но это уже другая история

author: {'steamid': '76561198253409229', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7252, 'last_played': 1679908121}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134281837', 'num_games_owned': 969, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 13778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13778, 'last_played': 1606565345}
review:
Wenn du heile heile Welt spielen willst, dann bist du hier richtig falsch. Nichts braucht Eador mehr als jemanden, der den Scherbenhaufen zusammenfügt ohne sich dabei an der ganzen Arbeit aufzureiben die das bedeutet. Ohne davon zu sprechen, dass es dir deine Untertanen, andere Meister und die unzähligen anderen Probleme nicht schwer genug machen können. Und wenn man von den paar crashes hier und da, dem schönen aber dennoch schlicht gehaltenen Design und dem schnell anwachsenden Schwierigkeitsgrad absieht, dann ist es ein super Spiel.
Am Anfang gibt es kaum was zu tun. Zuerst musst du die Möglichkeiten entdecken, die es alles gibt. Da gibt es Gebietserkundung, Truppen ausheben, Gebäude errichten usw. Hört sich nicht problematisch an. Die ersten paar Scherben gehts noch, dann wirds langsam schwieriger, als das die Gegner(sowohl auf der Scherbe als die anderen Meister) immer mächtiger werden und du schnell gefangen bist in den ersten paar Provinzen, da die anderen schlichtweg zu mächtig sind um ohne gute Armee zu siegen. Wirst du der erhoffte Retter dieser(s) Scherbenwelt(haufen) sein? Oder auch zu den gescheiterten Meistern zählen?

author: {'steamid': '76561198135511139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6973, 'last_played': 1667571072}

author: {'steamid': '76561198090288225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1673122067}
review:
Инди-проект который стал культовым в 2009-м силами одного энтузиаста и нескольких помощников на свет появилась пошаговая стратегия которая тут же приглянулась любителям жанра, атмосферный проект с подробно проработанным миром привлек внимание, немного допиленная графика и шедевр готов.

Сел на час очнулся в 40 лет.... 24 часа из 10

---[Сюжет]---
☑ Наш герой представляет собой бессмертного Владыку — сущность, характеристики которой затрудняется перечислить даже прислуживающий нам гремлин, чей незатейливый, но очень естественный юмор вносит в игру особую «живинку».Пришла нам как-то в голову блажь — создать собственный мир из дрейфующих в астрале осколков, укрепив тем самым порядок в противовес хаосу, готовому поглотить все живое — и нас в том числе.

---[Графон]---
☑ Обновленная графика, с одной стороны, выглядит вполне современно, а с другой — максимально приближена к оригиналу в духе старушки Heroes of Might and Magic 3,что и придает «Эадору» некий шарм.


---[Геймплей]---
☑ Простой геймплей, интуитивно понятен и прост. Пошаговая стратегия ничего не обычного (надо запомнить все что хотел сделать за ход).

---[Аудио]---
☑ Прекрасная музыка которая не дает вам понять как вы уже провели в игре 5+ часов, ее можно слушать без конечно.

---[Динамика]---
☑ Спокойно


---[Сложность]---
☑ Press "X" to win


---[Требования к ПК]---
☑ Первый компьютер пойдет


---[Время игры]---
☑ Бесконечность не предел!


---[Цена]---
☑ Цена оправдывает ожидания


---[Баги]---
☑ Иногда попадаются


---[Кооп]---
☑  Отсутствует

author: {'steamid': '76561198041562238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 34734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30548, 'last_played': 1668612924}
review: Kevés olyan stratégiai játék van amelyet hónapokra félre lehet tenni és utána úgy tudod folytatni, hogy nem kell előről kezdeni az egészet. Ebben a játékban kvázi szigeteket kell elfoglalni egymás után - te választod ki több közül, hogy melyiket támadnád meg - és mindegyik elfoglalt földdarab újabb képességeket, egységeket, épitményeket ad hozzá a repertoárodhoz. Egyszerü de élvezetes szintlépések a hősöknek és az egységeknek is. A harc egy erőforrásért zajlik, amiből ha sok van egy hőst, némi felszereléssel és egységeket a következő támadáshoz is igénybe tudsz venni. Kellőképpen változatos és az összes szerepjátékos elemet felvonultató kis stratégia, könnyen játszható és extrém hosszú időre is leköt (hónapok múlva folytatni fogod)! Ajánlom mindenkinek!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102323721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1604000200}
review:
21 heures de jeu, 13/56 succès, c'est assez peu pour rédiger l'évaluation d'un jeu aussi... vaste. Il y a des années, un ami m'avait vanté les qualités de HOMM auquel je n'ai pas réussi à accrocher. J'arrête Eador pour les mêmes raisons que voici :
- le jeu privilégie les mécanismes aux visuels et j’ai beaucoup de mal avec ça. Ce n’est pas moche mais ça me paraît daté et frigide, un peu comme un bouquin de SF sans style ni émotion ;
- j’espère que c’est moi qui manque de disponibilité lorsque je joue mais je trouve ce jeu peu accessible parce que, sauf si on fréquente assidûment les forums, le wiki, les discussions Steam, etc. rien ne vient nous aider au-delà des principes de base explicités dans le tutoriel (qui est très long et très bien fait), ce qui rend la pratique fastidieuse, voire besogneuse (l’inverse d’un jeu) ;
- le plus gros problème, à mon sens, vient de l’aspect extrêmement répétitif des phases de jeu. Il faut jouer quasiment de façon comptable en étant rigoureux sur l’enchaînement des actions de jeu sous peine d’être pénalisé pour la suite et les répéter à chaque tour de jeu (qui sont fréquents) ;
- le point précédent n’est même pas compensé par les combats tactiques qui, eux aussi, se ressemblent tous et sont nombreux.
Tout ça fait que ça ne fonctionne plus avec moi, j’ai fait joujou une vingtaine d’heures et je ne pense pas que le jeu puisse me surprendre.
Pourtant, pourtant…
L’idée de départ m’est apparue très intéressante // le tutoriel est très bien amené, véritable introduction au jeu jusqu’à la « révélation » qui est le véritable départ de l’épopée // les mécanismes ont l’air bien huilés, fouillés et restent très nombreux // les ambiances musicales sont nombreuses aussi et très bien foutues même si pas souvent en adéquation avec le rythme du jeu
Mais, mais…
Je ne peux pas me satisfaire d’un jeu qui manque à ce point de… vie. J’ai l’impression de jouer avec une calculatrice scientifique. C’est un jeu mais je ne rêve pas, je ne m’amuse pas.
Je le recommande aux amateurs de HOMM et tout jeu similaire, pour moi c’est un HOMM bis.

review: Quite simply, the game is utterly broken on any platform above windows 7. There has been a long standing problem with it related to memory access violations that the developers never solved, so the game crashes every few turns. The violation manifests differently for different players (sometimes it's related to save files, sometimes after battle, sometimes while building things), but no conclusive solution exists and the devs have washed their hands of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089175054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 194937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149514, 'last_played': 1704746071}
review:
I'm really not sure whether I can recommend this game. I'm kind of on the fence about it. I'm still not sure whether I'm going to click 'thumbs up' or 'thumbs down' when I finish writing this review...

The thing is, for what the game is and tries to do, it's probably my favorite game of all-time. I've spent THOUSANDS of hours playing this over the years. Things that I love:
- the tactical combat, complete with diverse battlefields, terrain, spells, balance of stats and abilities
- the wide assortment of diverse fantasy units and items
- the random events!
- the karma system: your dialog choices, units, spells, and buildings all influence how good or evil you are, which impacts gameplay quite a bit 
- the art - while it may seem dated to some, I find it beautiful and colorful, and the animations are perfect to me
- the excitement of discovering something new through exploration, whether it's a special location where you can recruit fairies, a new source of magic gems, or the last piece of that awesome armor set you've been collecting!
- honestly, I think the UI is fine; I know a lot of people complain about it after playing Genesis, but IMO I think it works well and makes sense... maybe just because I've gotten used to it over my 2000+ hours
- great map generation, with random provinces of different terrain types, hidden locations, and race populations

What I don't like about the gameplay:
- I'm not really into the campaign; I just like to play random shards (below I'll explain why)
- The content of the game itself doesn't really fit the campaign. There is so much to discover on each shard that you CAN'T possibly even begin to delve into it all. So you could spend time on it... level your hero(es) and units, find treasure, build up a killer economy, etc... But the goal is to wipe out your opponent as quickly as possible. If you meet your goal, you're missing out on 90% of the games content... However, playing on a random shard is lots of fun for me.
- Diplomacy, which is generally weak in 4X games anyway, is very weak in this game. It's maybe slightly better than in Warlock. Any diplomacy is basically just a delay of war, because there is only one way to win a shard - through conquest. I do wish there were alternatives, because I'm not much of a warmonger :)
- The cycle of choose your action for all heroes, and then end your turn and wait for all player's turns to execute. In theory it's a nice idea. Until you're conquering enemy provinces and they're conquering yours at the same time. For some reason it seems that the AI can hire a guard immediately on capturing a province, whereas you have to wait until you take your next turn. I feel that this part could have been done better.
- The heroes (if you even get more than 1 per shard) are pretty much dictated to you by necessity. At first you need a scout, because he doesn't need fancy armor (which you don't have) and has a strong ranged attack. If you go warrior first, he can only get lousy armor and weapons at the beginning, which means he's nearly as weak as your other units, and it's easy to get him killed. With a commander, you'll need lots of good troops to keep him alive, but you don't have access to them at the beginning and couldn't afford them anyway. And a wizard needs gems to cast spells, or a good wand to use for ranged attack; but at the beginning, you'll have no gems, no spells, and no wand. Spending your few gems to keep casting spells to keep fighting early on will mean that you don't save up gems for other things, such as erecting buildings to boost your gem income.
- There are other minor annoyances in gameplay, but these are not the reason I have trouble recommending this game, which is due to...

CRASHES!!! Eador MOTBW (and Imperium) is notorious for crashing with an 'Access Violation' error at random, unpredictable times. The game seems to like some computers, and not others. On some, you can play it without crashing for several hours; on others, you can't get even a few minutes into the game before it crashes. Now, the way I like to play, as I mentioned, is on a big random shard (not campaign mode). I like to take my time, build my economy, explore, look for treasures, build my armies, have fun, da-ta-da... It works for awhile. And then the crashes start. Maybe about turn 100-200 it will crash for the first time. No problem; I'll just reload and continue. But then... there are more... they come more frequently... Eventually I get to the point where the game crashes EVERY OTHER turn or even EVERY turn!!!! It's impossible to continue... It's at this time that I uninstall the game - again - and try to find something else to play. Fallen Enchantress or Warlock or *something* that will at least not crash EVERY DAMN TURN!

I love this game... But it's like a love/hate relationship. It's so fun to play, but it frustrates the F#^%@ out of me to the point that I don't think I can even recommend it to others. But I know the devs do lament their shortcomings with this game, and they would like to make a better Eador in the future, and I would be glad to support that effort. Because Eador itself is a gem among games.

In the end, I have decided to give the game a 'thumbs up', only for the reason that I hope others fall in love with Eador and hope for it's brighter future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377719569', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 9355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2948, 'last_played': 1653621451}
review:
É um jogo bem complexo, você precisa realmente pensar bem antes de agir (Exceto se tu tiver um guerreiro lv 20-30, famoso exército de um homem só.)

Além disso o jogo te dá muitas opções, você pode ser um pacifista gente fina que domina província fazendo aliança ou sair tacando o terror matando geral, até mesmo os outros "MESTRES", tem uns que da prazer de matar até.

Porém o jogo tem 2 grandes pontos fracos, o primeiro é que o jogo não está em português, jogar rpg em inglês é bem mee em pleno 2021, e segundo que tem um pouco de jogo nesse bug, os jogos da ubisoft parecem brincadeira de criança perto desse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026753377', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2532, 'last_played': 1599778871}
review:
Это не игра, а выблевок игровой индустрии, где все сделано через задницу.
Ни нормальной статистики по провинциям, из-за чего не понятно, совокупность каких факторов взбесила население так, что они устраивают бунты каждые пять ходов.
Ни адекватной сложности. В кампании на сложности "начинающий" первые два осколка захватываются так, как будто кроме вас там никого и нет, и можно по всякому валять дурака. А потом вас отымеют во все щели "опытные" противники просто потому что. Так же это относится и к подсчету шансов на победу при захвате провинции или атаке на особые места: пишут "обойдемся без потерь", а там какие-нибудь тролли или дракон, а  у тебя в отряде 2 юнита, считая вместе с героем. 
Неудобные меню почти всего, подсказки, всплывающие когда не надо и перекрывающие кнопки. 
Если в отряде противника много юнитов и это не какие-нибудь пукли с 5 плюс/минус 1 HP, то каждый ход противника бесконечно долог, даже с ускорением. Из-за этого бои просто задалбывают, а автобою я не доверяю.
Короче, только зря время потерял.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248560676', 'num_games_owned': 1320, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1599477063}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024210181', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5507, 'last_played': 1634493611}
review:
I always find myself coming back to this game from time and time again because it's just so good. Same kind of game as Heroes of M&M but with really great campaign mechanic.

There are some bad aspects though. Some of the maps are just super long and tedious but if you can spare campaign resource for those maps they won't be so grindy. The unit balance is also a bit off because one of the early game units is just way above anything else.

EDIT: Refreshed my memory a bit and noticed that the game has way too many bugs and crashes to be enjoyable. You have to avoid certain maps which crash at turn 1 in order to continue campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006995158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 5713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5205, 'last_played': 1623080486}
review:
Это прекрасная пошаговая стратегия в которой есть осколки мира, в котором есть провинции, в которых есть особые места в которых можно торговать, брать задания и зачищать(основное) от злобных жителей с отъемом честно нажитого имущества. Тут есть достаточно большое количество случайных событий с принятием решений и некоторым исходом по результатам этих решений, так же тут есть разные способы присоединения территорий и решений диалогов в зависимости от навыков раскачки героев и иных параметров. Борьба за экономику с ворьем. Регулярно недовольные неблагодарные смертные жители. Наём и прокачка отдельных простых юнитов и героев, покупка и выдача шмота героям, ветвистость классов героев, много видов юнитов.
Черти из тихого омута, когда-нибудь я притащу к вам все же паладина и вырежу, а не пройду мимо!
Игра жрет дофигищу времени, если пытаться зачистить карту.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007903820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3840, 'last_played': 1595522929}
review: I recommend this game to anyone who is seeking a challenge. The battles can be fun when you're on about the same strength. If you're not...well then may the gods of Eador bless your soul. As a player you are severely punished for making mistakes. For example, I once decided to not choose a scout as my first hero and instead chose a mage. I may have just been unlucky but this choice immediately led to several defeats as well as the loss of my capital. Still, as someone who enjoys a challenge I continued on which has led to some satisfying wins. The empire building portion of the game is different then your standard turn based strategy game like civilization which I feel adds to the games overall appeal. In summary if you're interested in a dark souls level of challenge in strategy turn based form then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128762746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8978, 'last_played': 1694294670}
review:
I have many different feelings about this game. I played it a lot before I got it on Steam, so many more hours on the counter than it shows here. Yet I never completed it for a bunch of reasons. 
Good things:
- The overall storyline is great - quite complex with many paths to be achieved
- I love the philosophic part and how masters personalities are built
- Grinding feels rewarding most of the time (gets addictive sometimes, but also feels tedious at some point)
- Karma system is a nice touch
- Map construction and locations give You this feeling of endless adventure, which is nice :)
- Creatures are many and well designed making combats fun and demanding

Bad things:
- Game length - shard take long, campaingn is many shards, so extra long
- sooo much grinding - both shard and campaign wise
- beginnings of shard are usually sooo hard if You try to focus on good path, whatever difficulty
- Alliance addon would be fun, but in reality made beginning even harder, because benefiting from it can be achieved usually much later than hard fights occur (goblin alhemists, halflings etc..)
- already some abusable tactis (like armored warrior or evil zombie wizard), that feel like cheating sometimes, yet without them You are doomed to extra long play..
- If You fail with few RNG checks in the beginning You loose so much game pace that You really need to force Yourself not to throw Your furniture around from frustration
- Still buggy after years. 
- Fixers of the Broken World Mod seem to be a good solution, but I haven't tried it yet

review:

⌚ Czas gry:

☐ Przygoda na weekend (do 24 godzin)
✅ Zadowalający (powyżej 24h)

🕮 Fabuła:

✅ Sporadyczny bug jeszcze nikomu nie zaszkodził (4 / 5)
☐ Brak bugów (5 / 5)

[h1] Kilka słów podsumowania [/h1]

Siadając do pierwszej sesji nie spodziewałem się, że gra wciągnie mnie na długie godziny. Rozgrywka jest interesująca a zawartość potrafi zaskoczyć. Postacie niezależne jak i sam świat gry - reagują na nasze decyzje a konsekwencje naszych wyborów są widoczne już po kilku turach. Gra może nie stoi fenomenalną oprawą graficzną bądź audio, jednakże zdecydowanie broni się klimatem i humorem, którego nie brakuje zwłaszcza za sprawą naszego małego pomocnika ze skłonnościami do hazardu. 
Tytuł polecam każdemu, kto lubi gry Strategiczne w klimacie Fantasy. Warto złapać na wyprzedaży, bo cena 71,99zł to zdecydowanie za dużo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085032570', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11966, 'last_played': 1649195061}
review:
Эадор - это когда в соседнем болоте растёт Чёрный Лотос, но Красное Дерево только на другом конце карты.
Эадор - это когда Воин один в поле - Воин.
Эадор - это когда ты убиваешь своего первого дракона на карте, и получаешь что-то для Полководца, которым ты не играешь.
Эадор - это когда ты оставляешь магов в башнях на потом.
Эадор - это когда ты не хочешь строить обелиск в память о погибших.
Эадор - это миры в мире, и каждый имеет свои забавные истории и грустные повести, героев и неудачников, и просто палачей в окружении монахов и законопослушных мечников. Это игра, в которую можно играть вечно, ведь история об этом мире не заканчивается на захвате замка вечноспящего лорда. Играйте в Эадор, и наслаждайтесь.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871854250', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1709720558}
review:
Игра отличная , даже не так , ЛУЧШАЯ по моему мнению тактическая стратегия , хотя у кого какие вкусы ... (Спойлер) как только заходишь сразу получаешь нож в печень от своего учителя который на самом деле оказывается маленьким гоблином , а ты оказывается какое-то подобие бога , поговорив со своим ручным гремлином ты начинаешь понимать что вообще происходит и сразу же прыгаешь на какой-нибудь остров который больше понравился с целью захватить , берешь первого бомжа (Героя) и идешь в бой , захватив пару островов (Осколков) появляется интересная личность с которой ты будешь сражаться на других осколках , фишка этой личности (Если ты конечно играешь на средней сложности) в том что если ты старался , играл часа 4 , захватывал локации , развивался ,  и дал ему развиться , то тебе либо придется потратить еще часов 5 на то что бы его одолеть или же просто начать захват по новой )))) Если вы хотите просто насладиться миром Eador то играй на легкой сложности , ну или на средней но там придется попотеть , про последнюю сложность вообще молчу.
( Перед тем как покупать лицензию , очень много играл в пиратскую версию)

author: {'steamid': '76561198068369219', 'num_games_owned': 3310, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 12598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6977, 'last_played': 1592202847}
review:
This game is one of the best RPG/TBS games out there.

It is a true sense role playing game, on the likes of Black and white, where you have hundreds of minor events and quests that influence your game play experience and the perception of the world has about you and it acts accordingly. It has nice graphics, great strategy where even with small armies you can outmaneuver and outsmart stronger (but not much stronger) enemies. However it is the kind of game where you will probably have to spend more than 150 hours to finish it. The good thing is that each fight is unique, each enemy has its strenghts and weaknesses (except dragons that are all mighty) and where you get to make choices that have no apparent consequences but later will shower you with joy or turn to be a pain in the arse. For wich i reccomend reading the respective wikia so you dont find the game much harder, later on on certain maps or risk losing one of the choices in finishing the game. I say i am about 30% with my playthought because I like exploring, even if i sinked 116 hours so far but you can rush the maps and spend only about 2-4 hours per map maximum. I spend twice or much more on each map. And speaking of maps, the Heroes skills are findamental on swamp and desert maps where mobility is a big issue for map and hexgrid movement.

The battles are similar to Heroes or Kings Bounty where the map is a medium size hexgrid and the troops move on it. Only few creatures being able to move from one side to the other in one fell swoop and hit first but once they do they will get minced to bits if they don't have special resistances or if they are alone so the damage is focused on a single unit. Ranged attacks should be used to soften the targets, melee kills should be used as much as possible to get as much as possible experience (twice as much). Map magic is crucial sometimes and only level 3+ battle magic is important with stronger enemies, everything else if quite useless against them. 

The only complaint i have are the exagerated loading times, reminding me of the days I used to play Fallout 2 on a 686 Cyryx processor (more than 20 years ago). Other than this i can't say i see a flaw in this game, i think it is brilliant and it became one of my top 5 franchises along with Fallout, HoMM, and Civ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003026615', 'num_games_owned': 1273, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1590971629}
review:
I’ve tried to play this game once again and once again it became an unsatisfactory taste in my mouth. The concept behind the game is to not lose your main shard and obtain other shards (you could look at as floating islands in space) to make a bigger shard to fight off the impending doom of chaos (evil creatures). You yourself are a deity that creates life on these shards and obtain their power to become stronger in the long run. You’ll eventually fight other ‘masters’ that you can align yourself with or become their rival. 

Even when you ‘lose’ a shard the game isn’t over which is a nice touch because you can claim another shard which will help you progress. When you do start on a shard you’ll start with nothing unless you had a hero from the first shard carry over. Each time you start on a new shard it is like you’re starting from scratch again. With that being said, unless you have enough of this energy don’t expect to be taking a hero over to the next shard. The concept is there and I like that in terms of persistency with heroes, but it was flawed. The tutorial was a joke. It doesn’t explain a lot of the concepts or the features within the game. What do these icons do? Oh, using the cursor over the icon reveals nothing!

The UI was clunky and it felt out of place. It almost felt like a puzzle trying to find the same things at times or you’d have three different ways to access your hero’s inventory of course using keybinds on some of the UI were there(e.g. hero inventory). You get to right click to build one building at a time if it isn’t your stronghold, you move to the provinces but the way the game lets you know is barely there. At times you have to click the hero or read the red texting hoping the hero is either exploring or moving to an area that you requested. Oh, and you can’t ‘unclick’ the hero. In case you left click well the hero goes there now. 

Every shard opens up an opportunity to give you an upgrade from the prior shard. I can live with that. Get more stuff the more you progress. But how come the NPCs get to take over the entire shard before you can even set yourself up? Why does the NPCs already taken half the shard when you still got slingers. Resources at the beginning are extremely slow if not almost abysmal. You got manage quickly or expect to lose a shard early on. You gather more coins and gems once you completely explore a province, you get gold/gems from buildings, quests, exploring and killing monsters, and selling the gear you get back. I mean it sounds nice, but the balance of it all is out of its mind.

The combat is similar to that of King’s Bounty and Battle Brothers, but more mediocre with King’s Bounty. The combat is hexed format so this brings in opportunity such as backstabs, flanking, and attacking from a far; it also has environmental advantages (e.g. hills, plains) and disadvantages (swamps, etc.) You can cast spells or scrolls or both depending who you are. With that being said, the enemies that spawn can be very easily taken down or broken if you are to face off against multiple dragons or medusas or golems at high level. 

I played a Scout, Wizard, and Commander. Commander just boosts your army and helps win fights like no one’s business. I mean, clearly the clean cut pick. Scout was really well picking off everyone on the map at long distances and never losing people. Mages… I have no idea. Bastard never lived long enough to do any worth, lol. Also, the local lords and Masters have their own ‘hero’ type and will also fight against your hero. 

Don’t get me wrong the exploration is a nice touch, but to endure 2%-4% to get to 100% on province turn after turn after turn (that’s base depending on hero – unless you throw in items, talents, and buildings) can become boring and quick. The building in your stronghold was a mess too. You have a dial for all your buildings and tiers, but as I said earlier it comes through the shards, but you have to build A and B to make C. Nothing bad in that concept. 

The problem why I couldn’t enjoy the game was balance issues, clunky UI, lack of description on what is going on or what icons are used for what, or popularity for cities; the limitation of what can be built to improve your morale, happiness, or the strength of your army. Heroes that felt off-putting or too strong for one category. How the combat is so repetitive that I would just auto attack and spam E (next turn keybind) to hurry up. The game almost felt like a chore instead of something fun and entertaining. It just felt like you were doing the dishes, unless you like doing the dishes. 

I personally didn’t see any bugs or crashes as other people have, but I’d say if you’re wary on a title like this buy it on a sale or play a demo or watch a YouTube video if available. I just can’t recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014578260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1589750755}
review: I've given this game many tries but even on Beginner difficulty, enemy lords have infinite resources and never run out of them, nor do they run out of soldiers, they just steam roll through the lands while I'm over here struggling to manage a few provinces which spit out nearly no money and i have nearly no time to develop my stronghold before one of them reaches me and dances easily through my lands claiming them in swaths.  The AI seems to be just turned up to expert level the entire time irregardless.  I've considered "maybe I'm just bad" so I try a few other strategies...nope...same results they steamroll without a concern meanwhile taking 3 provinces for me wipes out my armies.  This game seems to be broken.  Irony.

review: Eador MoBW has a great concern is longterm game I still have not finished it after 500+ hours. It can be repeatable, but I play 1-2 battles time to time and it is still fun. There is incredible number of content and events. Great number of challenges you may get over. You may try various strategies with your heroes, adjust it to current map environment. Only disadvantage is there are still technical problems sometimes sometimes. The game may crash, but generally it works. For me Eador is one fo the best turn based startegy and worth of price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021403893', 'num_games_owned': 2597, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 4732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4732, 'last_played': 1577310558}
review:
В данном обзоре я расскажу вам об игре Eador. Masters of the Broken World. От разработчика Snowbird Games.  Обзор не содержит плагиата и написан целиком и полностью мной, Гвардом.



Игра Eador. Masters of the Broken World является этакой реинкарнацией игры Eador с переработанной в HD графикой и некоторыми добавлениями и улучшениями. По жанру это изометрическая пошаговая стратегия с элементами РПГ и текстовых квестов.


Предыстория. Мир Эадора когда-то был раздроблен на отдельные осколки плавающие в пустоте мироздания из-за войны демиургов-богов. И теперь плавают в пространстве мироздания управляемые различными демиургами. И на всех них надвигается всепожирающая пустота уничтожающая все на своем пути. Мы играем за молодого демиурга который вознамерился собрать под свой контроль осколки и объединив их остановить пустоту.

Геймплей.
Игровая механика игры очень похожа на таковую в игре Герои Магии и Меча 3, а так же в Дисайплс. Мы так же отстраиваем свой замок возводя в нем различные сооружения как для менеджмента так и для получения доступа к более высокоуровневым бойцам. Отстраивая военные здания мы получаем возможность нанимать тех или иных бойцов, а затем прокачивать их в боях. Есть библиотека дающая нам возможность изучать заклинания разных уровней, в том числе и глобальные. В прочее время мы путешествуем по глобальной карте захватывая клетки или сражаясь.
Но первое что мы делаем это нанимаем героя, которым будем воевать.  И которого будем прокачивать.
Нам доступны:

Воин. Собственно боевой класс, во время боев он принимает активнейшее участие в боях сражаясь в первых рядах и нанося огромный урон. Очень зависим от качественного шмота и правильного вкачивания навыков. Имеет огромное количество здоровья, но никакой магией и небольшой отряд войнов.

Волшебник. Он может водить за собой самое маленькое количество войнов, но зато ему доступны самые сильные заклинания вроде призыва Драконов и нежити вроде Вампиров на поле боя. Самый читерный класс так как при правильной вкачке навыков магии призывом кучи Драконов и Нежити может выносить все что движется. Сильнейший герой минимально зависящий от экипировки. Имеет самое маленькое количество здоровья.

Разведчик. Самый неинтересный на мой взгляд герой так как таскает за собой небольшую армию, не обладает шикарным уроном и единственная его уникальность это дальний бой. Так как разведчик — лучник, очень зависит от шмота и прокачки навыков стрельбы. Обладает навыками всяческих за подлянок для врага и ловушек.

Командир. Тоже очень сильный герой так как его фишка в том что он водит за собой самую огромную армию включая нескольких существ максимального уровня. Его сила в его армии, а потому все навыки направленны на быстрое вкачивание бойцов и всякие бонусы для них.

При прохождении компании игры нам так же доступен глобальный тактический экран. На нем мы выбираем следующий осколок мира, который будем завоевывать присоединяя его к своему миру. А так же получать определенные бонусы за ману.
В зависимости от выбранного осколка мы после его завоевания получаем некоторые бонус, как например возможность строить в своём городе новые здания и новых бойцов для последующего найма.
Стоит отметить что выбирать осколки для захвата стоит с умом так как прочие после выбора будут как правило уже не доступны. Нам предложат уже новые.
Препятствуют этому другие боги-демиурги с которыми мы будем сражаться за власть или иногда заключать дипломатические союзы.
Каждый осколок по сути это кусочек мира со своим биомом, условием победы и противником демиургом (в большинстве случаев). Так же на карте существует множество поселений и городов, а так же случайных мест вроде башен или пещер, трактиров и прочего подобного. Во все такие места (а они есть даже в нашем городе — стоит только провести разведку и обнаружить их) нам желательно заходить. Часто в них нас ждут приличные награды в виде опыта, артефактов и новых существ для найма, а так же свитков магии. Обычно нужно сражаться, но бывает что такие места являются мирными или там обитает какой-нибудь колдун торгующий свитками и магическим шмотом.


Все бои в игре происходят на картах как в Героях 3 разбитых на гексы и в пошаговом режиме. Герой и существа ходят в зависимости от своей инициативы и скорости. Во время боя наш герой может либо атаковать, либо кастовать заклинания разного рода. Так же на поле боя встречаются разные препятствия влияющие на тактику боя.

Постоянно по мере игры мы принимаем те или иные решения в виде текстовых квестов и диалогов. От выбора зависит и наша репутация. Например мы можем подавлять восстания крестьян или мирно с ними договариваться. В игре очень много текстовых диалогов и всяких случайных событий. Причем все они очень интересные и порой очень неожиданные.
Двигаясь по карте мы можем захватывать провинции и на них что-то строить либо изучать их открывая тайные места. А так же на этих клетках-провинциях часто можно найти ресурсы вроде железа или коней которые очень пригодятся для постройки боевых зданий в нашей столице.

Графика в игре великолепная, все нарисовано очень красиво и качественно. Мир Эадора выглядит по настоящему живым. Локации на осколках нарисованы так красиво что порой напоминают картины художников. Несмотря на такую графику игра вполне сносно играется даже на ноутбуках.

Звуки, музыка и озвучка выполнены на высочайшем уровне. Мелодии прекрасны и не надоедают, их хочется слушать даже после выхода из игры. Локализация качественная и претензий нет.

Так же в игре реализован великолепнейший мультиплеер и сражаться можно с друзьями по интернету настраивая карты как только душе угодно от размера карты до наличия ресурсов.

На этом я заканчиваю свой обзор, для вас старался Золотой Дракон Гвард. Всем удачи!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977782318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 46628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36075, 'last_played': 1707624692}
review: The game is very fun, especially the place of RPG levelling but I've never once finished a campaign. Every single time I reach an error with memory, I've played across multiple machines. author: {'steamid': '76561198204355399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 41107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6308, 'last_played': 1605878049}
review:
consiglio questo gioco come il piu bello strategico a turni mai giocato.  se sei amante del genere a turni ti dara' tante soddisfazioni. ma ce' un pero'....armarsi di tanta pazienza e non voler arrivare subito al finale. perche ' dire che questo gioco e' longevo e' poco ( si ...non si arriva mai alla fine anche se io lo ho fatto).  bisogna prenderlo come una partita a scacchi , non a caso e' un gioco inventato d un  russo.  io lo ho giocato per 1 anno tutti i giorni almeno 4 ore e lo ho finito. potrei parlarvene per 4 ore di seguito per spiegarvi le meccaniche ma non ho la possibilita' he...he... quindi vi diro' solo la cosa che mi e' piaciuta di piu. gli EROI!
non si comincia molto forti e possiamo essere maghi , guerrieri , arcieri , generali ognuno con pregi e difetti poi con esperienza si diventa come MOSTRI INVINCIBILI in grado di stritolare un drago a mani nude! ma non finisce qui perche' dal decimo livello si perfeziona la classe con possibilita di diventare misto ( es. arcere-guerriero o mago-generale)  ognuno con bonus veramente speciali. troppo da dire.....qundi giocatelo .

author: {'steamid': '76561198164801574', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 26673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5562, 'last_played': 1658800259}
review:
Eador Masters of the Broken World is a complicated case. Please read this review from start to finish or not at all.

Eador is a game rich in history and although flawed is very fun and worth your time.

Story Pros: 
Personally I love the story. It's your typical fantasy universe, but there's a catch or two in there that really makes you want to be a part of it. I'm not gonna spoil anything I'll just say the characters in particular have a lot of potential and I wish more would come out of them.

Sound Pros:
Some of the sound effects are hilarious, but no one cares about that. The Music. The soundtrack. It's amazing, I love it. The music matches the design and the story perfectly, it makes you feel powerful.

Gameplay flaws:
In the game you take the role of some sort of deity or god and have to capture "shards" (which are basically flat planets) and the more shards you capture, the more things you unlock. You mostly unlock resources and buildings for your stronghold (The place you begin your campaign on each shard, your "capital province").

The first shards require you to play with a very limited hand when it comes to improving your "kingdom" and exploring and capturing provinces. It can get kind of boring, unless you're playing on high difficulty OR you know how to rush the earlies.

"late campaing" is a different can of worms completely, you have lots of options, you can do virtually anything but the game starts taking too long sometimes. It's not as bad as early campaign, but it's also far from perfect.

The game as it is is a 7.7/10 Worth your time, specially if you like these types of games.

Definitely play if you like:
-Fantasy Lore
-Strategy (obviously)
-God games
-Power Fantasies
-Level Completion
-Easy Achivements, but not 100%

author: {'steamid': '76561198110569056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 6405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6405, 'last_played': 1586453824}
review:
This game would be super fun!!!

The constant freeze crashes during combat are game breaking though. It completely ruins the immersion, you have to redo fights over and over again. It will regularly freeze again in the same spot. I find it upsetting that after all this time, the devs haven't bothered to fix this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081477001', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1538136575}
review:
[i]Eador. Masters of the Broken World[/i] is essentially a 3D reskin of an original [i]Eador. Genesis[/i] - with a few relatively insignificant changes.

It's a good game, because [i]Genesis[/i] was good, but I would say the original was better. Despite being 2D and not having any animations, [i]Genesis[/i] had a better pronounced visual style and - more importantly - a way better UI. Everybody should take lessons from the city screen design in [i]Genesis[/i]. Plus, with no animations, battles went way faster than here.

If you just want to play something fantasy-themed - it's very good and you should take it.
If you're here for the strategy first and foremost, you'll end up much better off playing [i]Genesis[/i] itself or [i]The New Horizons[/i] mod for [i]Genesis[/i] - it expands on the base game so well, the author himself approved of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079378241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1206, 'last_played': 1587748886}
review: Il gioco è carino, ottima difficoltà, esperienza di gioco davvero accattivante, nonché molto più ruolistica di molti giochi del genere e colonna sonora davvero bella. Perché non consigliato? In circa 20 ore, il gioco è crashato diverse volte e altrettante si è bloccato, obbligandomi a forzarne la chiusura e riavviarlo. Ma se siete disposti a convivere questi problemi tecnici, e alcuni bug sporadici come nemici che non muoiono pur avendo 0 HP, bloccando le battaglie o province che non si conquistano pur avendo vinto la battaglia, o ancora messaggi di sistema che si sovrappongono, il gioco ha davvero del potenziale e può catturarvi per molte ore, nonostante ci siano anche problemi nel multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061111', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1586208868}
review:
Game #113										6.4.2020.

Eador, Masters of the Broken World starts off really strong. It was world ruled by Gods full of power and magic. One day, the Gods thought that the world was just way too powerful to even exist so they destroyed it… huh? Anyway, the Gods destroyed their own world BUT because the world itself was so powerful, they couldn’t destroy the whole thing so it became an infinite number of sky-blocks where people still live and some more powerful individuals can travel between them. Now that you (the player) have arrived, it is up to you what you wish to do with this world.

[h1] Haven't I played something very similar to this? [/h1]

As exciting as it sounds, let’s just cut to the chase. Eador, Masters of the Broken World, as cool as the name sounds is just Heroes of Might and Magic 
https://store.steampowered.com/app/297000/Heroes_of_Might__Magic_III__HD_Edition/
 with a couple of differences. Now I’m not going to go on a deep rant and give you details about how the combat is better or worse than the game it was based on or how the building makes no sense so I’m just going to give you a really sloppy observation.

See, when you make a game that strikingly resembles another game (another popular game I might add) people are going to start to compare the two. Unfortunately, I have never been a huge fan of the Heroes of Might and Magic series. I have played the HMM 3 and 5 and liked them a lot but I don’t think I would call myself a fan of the series. Because of this, take this review with a huge grain of salt.

[h1] Same-y but differently [/h1]

Eador, Masters of the Broken World (it sounds cool to say the entire title) plays just like Heroes of Might and Magic (also cool, but the former is still cooler). You have an overview map and you have your hero who can explore the world. Each turn you usually do 2 things with your hero (heroes): move and maybe attack and you select what you are going to build in your castle. You do this until you die or until you finish your campaign mission. That’s the gist of it. 

The battle system in Eador, Masters of the Broken World is a bit different than Heroes of Might and Magic. In both games, you get a hexagonal grid where you place your hero as well as your units and move around and attack the opposition. Both games share that iconic look. However, in Heroes of Might and Magic you are able to buy a large amount of a single unit and divide it up into smaller groups or stack it all into one huge and powerful unit, in Eador, you just recruit units and fight away, no stacking.  It works. 

[h1] It doesn't offer you much more than HMM [/h1]

So after I realized how this game is really similar to Heroes of Might and Magic, I said: “OK. What else are you going to offer me game?” and then I realized that Eador, Masters of the Broken World, didn’t have that much to offer that Heroes of Might and Magic already couldn’t. 
Don’t get me wrong, the game works and is fine but it’s not much better or different than the game it was based on. 
It doesn’t offer better graphics than HMM, not a great soundtrack, the game is kind of slow to play, the combat in particular is really slow unless you click again to “hurry up” your units, when your units attack they seem so unwilling to do so and also the multiplayer is barren.

I don’t know what I was really expecting. Perhaps I was expecting the battle system to be a bit more flashy and dynamic but it isn’t.

[h1] Man, I sure wish I was playing HMM instead... [/h1]

The real reason why I’m not recommending this game is that, in the little time I spent playing it, all I could think of was how much better it would be to just play Heroes of Might and Magic. Then again, I’m really not an expert in this genera so I will leave you with this.

If you like the Heroes of Might and Magic series and need something similar, this just might be the game for you. As for me, I’m just going to stick to HMM.

Next game: Edna and Harvey: Harvey’s New Eyes
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/219910/

[h3]If you liked my review, feel free to follow my curator group. I’m trying to review every single game in my library. Seeing and interacting with fine folks, like you, keeps my motivation up. 
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198244321066', 'num_games_owned': 1897, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1585514040}
review:
I expected much less in terms of strategy complexity and gameplay, but it seems this game surpases maybe all of its 4x genre counterparts. There's a seemingly infinite amount of exploring and grinding to do and it's fun as heck.

I'm giving it a thumbs up because I think it's worth every 4x fan's attention, but I'm not gonna continue playing for three reasons:

[olist]
[*] 30 FPS on a game from 2013 and at that point it's still isn't even looking good.
[*] What happened to that hex grid? Sometimes a tile's borders are so skewed it looks like a square. Why even show the hex grid if it's gonna be such a finger in the eye the entire time?
[*] The humor and storytelling are atrocious. Inexcusably so. I cannot look past it, there's a well meaning story progression model in place, but every bit of tutorial, dialogue or story is told with the skill of a Twitch stream chat. It breaks the immersion, sucks the fun out of gameplay and just creates a very in-your-face experience of sitting at a DND table with shallow breathing neckbeards. The devs made a great manual that does the game's complexity justice, is appropriately designed, and I really just can't understand why every other line has to be a 4th wall breaking joke or told in a voice of a roleplaying middle schooler.
[/olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561199027721610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 37541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1684315442}
review:
К сожалению на данный момент в виндовс 10 и возможно в других операционных системах не меняется разрешение экрана. После запуска игры графика в связи с этим очень плохая. В пиратских версиях графика на высоте. Разрешение меняется без проблем. В виндовс 10 пиратка работает хорошо. Если рекомендовать то только пиратку на данный момент.
К виндовс 10 оригинал от разработчиков похоже не адаптировался. Как стратегия неплохая игра. Могу рекомендовать  оригинал от разработчиков только, тогда когда разработчики начнут устранять недоработки и баги.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993023804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 524, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1584285169}
review:
In my ongoing and likely futile effort to write a Steam review for every game in my library (#321 out of 612)... it's time for Eador: Masters of the Broken World.

Eador is one of many fantasy-themed Civilization-style turn based grand strategy games out there, and arguably one of the more interesting. Unfortunately it's definitely far too ambitious for its own sake: it tries to be a Civilization-style grand strategy game, a Heroes of Might and Magic-style tactical strategy game, and also a fully fleshed-out CRPG. Which ultimately means it's a very complex game with a great deal of very tedious management involved. The campaign can be especially infuriating as your progress is reset at each chapter, which is definitely something that works well within the confines of a grand strategy game, but is kind of antithetical to the well-proven progression curve of a roleplaying game.

And, as you might expect from such an ambitious game, but the UI is a bit of a mess -- you'll know your in for a bad time almost immediately upon starting up a campaign, once you notice that the button used to close a window is placed in the bottom-center rather than an upper corner as has been standard for the past quarter-century or so. The campaign map is also problematic in that there's a great deal of information that needs to be conveyed about each province that is revealed almost exclusively through nested menus--almost no useful information is visible on the map itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085759774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1584329921}
review: Judging by the fact that only 18.7% of players who own the game have earned the, "leveled up your character once" achievement I'm going to take a wild guess and say that, like myself, picked up this game on sale for like $5 years ago and proceeded to let it gather layer after layer of virtual dust.  I recently got on a Heroes of M&M/ Age of Wonders kick and was pleased to find this game is a worthy comparison and in some ways even better. It's art and music is really fantastic, feels like you're playing a storybook. It has the tried and true tactical turn based combat formula we all know and love. Stories kinda meh, but not so much it's plain bad or anything. It has a ton of high fantasy units and plenty of gear/RPG to give you some motivation throughout. So take a stroll into the dark recesses of your Steam library and break open this dusty old tome you'd forgot even existed, you might just be surprised.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129609298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 22252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15280, 'last_played': 1709223657}
review:
Did i ever tell you the definition of insanity? Insanity is... Insanity. Is. Conquering the exact, same fucking shard, over and over and over again. Expecting - shit to change. That is crazy. You know, the first time someone told me this i dunno man i thought they were bullshitting me so bam. I conquered his shard. But the thing is, okay, the thing is, that he, was, right. And then i started seeing it everywhere i looked, everywhere i looked all these fucking pricks conquering the exact same fucking shard thinking, this time it's going to be different *chuckles* no no no, this time it's going to be different! I am sorry, i don't like the way you are looking at me. What, do you think i am bullshitting you, do you think i am lying, well fuck you! Fuck you! *chuckles* It's okay hermano it's okay, i am going to chill. You see, the thing is, I conquered this shard already. And it's not like I, am fucking crazy, okay? *pause* Did i ever tell you, the definition, of insanity? *goes to conquer another shard*

Also the game is buggy as shit, repetitive grinding for literal hours and the design of the game does everything in it's power to stop you from reaching the highest level spells, weapons and soldiers which obviously are the most fun. You can only get one level 4 unit and it will always be the elephant because paladins suck ass until you level them up and so do warlocks. Units die in every single battle and you are somehow expected to keep them alive through literal dozens of fights to level them up properly so that they can stop sucking ass and get some decent spells. Mages are utterly worthless because of that which is a damn shame. Warriors are overpowered even on the rust worlds where items deteriorate 5 times quicker. A chieftain with good weapon, decent armor, round strike and all spellslots filled with astral energy can take out an entire army. Mages, not the units but the champions are utterly worthless if you don't play with reasonable amount of swamps because they can't use spells else they will run out of crystals. Generals are also worthless because in early game the costs of having an army completely kills your economy and you won't develop any buildings for dozens of turns. And don't get me started on buildings, the most expensive ones cost literally hundreds of times more than the cheapest ones, it's absolutely ridiculous, coming up with 5 thousand gold in midgame is insane. Bulding in provinces takes too much time, you have to individually click on every single building you want to build, every single turn in every single province, when you conquer 1 each turn you will easily forget what you were supposed to do. Overall the game had a really good concept but execution is very poor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018776866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5464, 'last_played': 1581262569}
review:
The game is fun and would recommend it if not for the fact that many years after release the developers have never fixed the game breaking bugs.
Don't buy this if you mind having the game randomly just break on you.
I've played plenty of this game and there is just no way to get past certain point in the game as it will inevitably crash. There is no functional fix for these crashes, and once they happen the nearest autosaves to the crash will be corrupt as well and even if you go back you will still crash soon after. 

Great idea for a game with good execution, but the developers have failed to ensure its playablitiy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037556945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1580413225}
review:
This game is vastly underrated in my opinion. I understand why one can be a little disappointed at first, when realising, that the main map is rather static and most of the action takes place in the small tactical battle screens. I remember my first reaction rather well: '...is THAT all?!'
But luckily I gave the game a bit more time and had a chance to realize the depth of the mechanics:
+ four different hero classes - each one combineable with each other
+ every unit can be leveled up and gains a number of unique abilities
+ every unit that performed admirably can be awarded with medals, that give additional boons (and increase the units upkeep)
+ lots of different buildings (ca. 100) partially excluding each other
+ 6 different schools of magic with 4 levels of spells each
+ rituals that allow a wide variety of effects (for example stir up a rebellion in an enemy province far away)
+ several different neutral races (dwarves, elves, centaurs, etc...) that one can forge an alliance with (to gain access to their special powerful units)
+ a rather nice tactical AI

Verdict:
If you are someone who likes tactical games with strong RPG-elements, and don't mind the dated graphics and slow pace, then give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083600561', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1579983999}
review:
Grindy as hell. To finish off the first shard you're on your merry road to fight 50 or so roughly the same tactical battles. If this is your thing (that is, HOMM tactical battles with very nice graphics), go ahead, you're not gonna be disappointed. If you thought its stress is 4X strategy and it's more like some kind of fantasy civ like some people make it out to be, you should look elsewhere - e.g. Warlock 2 (albeit it has its own problems).

So the graphics are fine and the UI, even though it's apparent devs put a lot of thought into it, still feels confusing. You have this neat radial menu but some features are not available through it and the reasoning behind it seems quite arbitrary. Also, there are some pretty unnerving things like (as far as I got to know) you can't check the hero's inventory when you need it the most, i.e. after looting. You have to go back to your stronghold (possibly wasting some turns) just to see again leisurely what you've got. If it's intentional, it's stupid, and if not it's a careless omission at best.

If you want HOMM with nice graphics, slightly different, more grindy mechanics and UI which will only sporadically annoy you - go ahead, this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021140669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1577931708}
review:
Check out my first impression video of Eador here, and remember to play all your steam games!
https://youtu.be/XsacdKJZO0w

Eador is as close to the experience of Dungeons and Dragons or other similar tabletop roleplaying games as videogaming has ever come. The amount of exploration and party options are staggering and the combat is incredibly similar to what one would expect of combat if you were sitting at a table playing a tabletop rpg with friends. The unrivaled depth and intricacies of this game are paralleled only by the amazing versus concept. Eador is the perfect example of what a tabletop rpg should strive to be in the digital realm.

This was game 1 on my year long journey to play all 365 games in my Steam library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040796843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 29645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27740, 'last_played': 1615809866}
review:
This is one of the best games I have ever played. I didn't realize just how many hours I had sunk into this. 462 hours on this accpimt to date and I just keep coming back. It's the kind of game you play through and then come back to an play again. The 1000+ hour campaign really helps with this. There are the occasional bugs that can get annoying at times but everything else allows you to look past these bugs with ease.

Now, I only play on the hardest difficulty (which seems almost impossible to begin with) but once you know what you are doing then it becomes manageable. This demonstrates the fact that there truly is strategy to be mastered here - and if you really want to learn there are some great YouTube tutorials out there.

Also, this game is EXCEEDINGLY well balanced, despite the fact that you may not realize it to begin with. You may begin to believe that your style of play (always starting with a commander for example) is the best and only way to play. But you truly can lay any of the commanders viably, they just have very different play styles. Some maps are also more suited to different commanders and so even the choice of commander comes down to strategy.

You can play good and evil, make your subject happy or continually suppress rebellions and kill them all. And it is all viable.

The 1000+ hour campaign, unlocks things for you in a piecemeal manner so you truly get a sense of progression throughout.

Slight con:
I won't say too much but I believe some of the out of map dialogue options ruin the strategy component a bit as things may happen that you had no idea about / couldn't plan for unless you had played through and knew what to expect. In fact, I am quite annoyed about this feature as I don't like games that you need to play, without knowing what you are doing, in order to learn the strategy. However, you will still learn whats going on - even in your first play through, albeit realising that you may have made some subpar choices previously.

IMO this game is MUCH better than their newer version which is nicer looking but offers less depth and strategy.

In other words, if you are a hardcore 4X fantasy RPG lover. You will absolutely love this game!!!
