author: {'steamid': '76561198010283078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1404792322}
review:
An empire builder with terrible pacing. The visuals are beautiful, but the gameplay suffers from the fact that you can't field a mobile army unless you have a hero. Unfortunately, recruiting a hero beyond your first is prohibitively expensive, making the early parts of the game very boring or very frustrating depending on how you're progressing. Allowing players to march out troops without a hero or even allowing two free heroes at the start would help tremendously with the opening turns' dullness.

Additionally, the game features a separate tactical map for combat. It starts promising, but it doesn't take long before units appear that completely disrespect the terrain and simply fly past your frontline troops to decimate your ranged units.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055002393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1680573238}
review:
I have so many complaints about this game, I'm not even sure where to start.  I love games like Kings Bounty, Age of Wonders, Civilization etc.  But Eador just sucks, just keep clicking in explore province over and over again get's so boring and repetitive I'll start playing games on my cell phone as well = / I've also found most of the time in the begining when your hero is underpowered, the notifications of how powerful the enemies you'll face is frustatingly inaccurate. This really took the piss, Just seeing, "this enemy is easy" and then going into battle and have all your units die in 3 turns, and then you have to wait for your hero to ressurect, and in the mean time your rival hero on the shard takes it over and you lose GG!
I also found the combat really dull and boring. I hate strategy game where the units you face aren't concerened with their own life.  As in I hate facing A.I. that's more then willing to kamakaze themselves just so you lose a unti, rahter than strategically move around the board so they don't get flanked or ambushed.  But instead they will charge in the middle of 3 units just to take out that weak archer or shaman and the enemies die next turn because they bum rushed in the middle of your army just for the sake of pissing you off. 
(Also why I hate FIre Emblem and love FF Tactics wayyy more, but anyways)
No option to rebind the keys, the options to change the graphics was bare minimum, and the U.I. is underdeveloped, just doesn't provide enough information, like before you move to a square you could maybe scout it to see what level of enemies you could expect to face.  Or maybe in the "go to a a location" menu it could state what's in those locations when you hover your cursor over them, instead you just have to waste turn after turn poking around seeing what enemies you can face while the Enemy Heros take over the shard and Game Over. 
All in all a waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007393487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1448328028}
review:
Played about 7 hours. The problem is the game repeats the same fight over and over on the shards, and you find yourself just ignoring the stupid random messages that become an annoyance rather than fun. Add in the fact that there's almost no strategy to any of the game.

Here's the strategy on how to win: Move as fast as you can to conquer sections. That's it. If you can do that, you win. It's another game that's more about rushing around than actual strategy, or building up defenses, or dealing with an economy that makes any sense. Add in the fact that the mood metrics of the game are very convoluted, and you end up with gameplay that you'll be trying to skip rather than playing.

Eventually I just got so frustrated I gave up. It's trying to be HOMM with a bigger veneer on it, but it's nowhere near as fun. Shame, because if they fleshed out the overland map part, it could be fun. But it's completely unbalanced and as such it makes no sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052500928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34947, 'last_played': 1448217246}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999321362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1448301604}
review:
Z początku podszedłem do tego tytułu, natomiast muszę przyznać, iż bardzo miło się zaskoczyłem!

   Bardzo ładny i płynny interfejs, wyśmienity system walki oraz wydarzenia losowe w całym króletstwie, w których musimy zdecydować czy pomóc biednym poddanym czy też pozostawić kmiotów samym sobie. Takie smaczki sprawiają, że gra jest naprawdę ciekawa, zapewnia wiele godzin świetnej zabawy! Możemy eksplorować własne prowincję lub podbijać kolejne ziemie, lecz wciąż musimy pamiętać o zachowanie pokoju na własnym terytorium. Ogromna różnorodność wyborów zamknięta w świecie Eador daje to, czego wielu graczy oczekuje - samodzielne decydowanie o każdym kroku. Wszystko to okraszone ładną grafiką, ciekawymi animacjami oraz niesamowitą grywalnością!

   Zachwala, zachwala... Ale co jest nie tak? Osobiście uważam, że interfejs pomimo ładnej oprawy i płynności nie jest tak bardzo czytelny, sama gra nie jest intuicyjna. Bez samouczka i początkowych wskazówek bardzo ciężko jest nam się odnaleźć w świecie gry Eador. Ograniczona ilość czarów też może okazać się kłopotliwa, dopiero po jakimś czasie zaczynamy planować rzucanie oraz dobór zaklęć. Trzeba również przynać, że panuje tutaj straszna drożyzna, za wszystko przyjdzie nam słono zapłacić.

    Według mnie to byłaby większość minusów tej, o ile możemy tak o nich powiedzieć. Mamy tutaj zupełnie inny świat, niepospolity system rozgrywki oraz budowania imperium. Mnogość wyborów oraz dróg, którymi możemy podążać wręcz przytłacza lecz zachęca jednocześnie.

Jedyne co mogę na koniec powiedzieć - gorąco polecam to każdemu fanu gier turowych i nie tylko! Pomimo, iż nie jestem zapalonym fanem oraz nie grałem we wcześniejszą odsłonę - solidne i w pełni zasłużone 9/10. Jest to jeden z tytułów, które należy zaliczyć!

author: {'steamid': '76561198063819717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33096, 'last_played': 1463298087}
review:
Про игровой процесс уже написали много обзоров.

Расскажу для кого эта игра окажется шедевром, а для кого ерундой.

Если вы любите пошаговые стратегии (Цивилизация, Кингс Баунти, Герои меча и магии и т.д.) то эта игра для вас. Но не для всех!
Игра очень требовательная к мощности компьютера. То есть какой бы ни был у вас самый мощный компьютер, игра вас будет раздражать медлительностью ходом компьютерного игрока. То-есть 3 гигагерцевого процессора ей мало. Моих 4.1 гигагерца мало. Думаю даже если вы мегаоверклокер и разогнали свой процессор до 5 гигагерц, то игре и этого будет не достаточно! :)

Нет, сама игра не тормозит, интерфейс, графика и прочее идут нормально. Но, на больших картах, с несколькими компьютерными противниками под конец партии вы можете пол минуты или минуту ждать ход компьютерных игроков. И это будет продолжаться пока вы не убьёте героев противника. Именно по этой причине их нужно найти и ликвидировать как можно скорее с началом партии на осколке.

Сама игра ОЧЕНЬ долгая. Очень долгая это значит проходить вы кампанию будете очень долго, сотни игровых часов. Я кстати так и не прошёл ещё её, вчера начал новую кампанию после годового перерыва.
Во-первых на скорость прохождения влияет очень сильно тот недостаток с ходом противника, который я уже огласил.
А во-вторых, вам будет хотеться отыскать на осколке различные ништяки, а для этого нужно исследовать провинции.

Лично для меня, как любителя таких стратегий, это плюс - чем дольше нужно играть, тем интереснее. Но у кого нет времени на это, думаю это не устроит. Наверное для таких "быстроходов" и ввели перенос персонажа в другую игровую партию. Я этого пока не видел, как оно реализовано, так как не играл год.

Игра однозначно для долгих зимних вечеров. Чай, копЭ и игра! :)

review: Buen juego de estrategia por turnos del estilo del HOMM , muy enfocado al combate. A pesar de ser un buen juego no lo considero para todos los gustos ya que es de desarrollo lento, excesivamente lento y dificil hasta en nivel facil sobre todo en los comienzos donde una mala planificacion de las construcciones  o una muerte y resurreccion del heroe te pueden dejar la tesoreria en numeros rojos y hacer que tu partida acabe antes de tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132264539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 56473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6101, 'playtime_at_review': 4808, 'last_played': 1710663348}
review:
I'm not sure why this game has mixed user reviews. This game has so much depth, looks beautiful and my favourite thing about it - everything is transparent. There's a wealth of information in the game you can access by simply right-clicking and hovering over whatever, which makes learning the game a lot of fun. The combination of an (improved imo) Heroes of Might and Magic combat system with a 4x overworld map works really well.

Eador is the sort of game you can easily spend hundreds of hours in, the replayability is great. Not as much as Paradox games, but I feel like each run is different enough. Though this might be a con to others - a single game (called Shard ingame) could take anywhere from half an hour to 10 or even 20 depending on how large the Shard is.

It's a testament to how much I enjoy this game that I just get lost in it for hours on end; listening to the dreamy music, continually making and re-evaluating decisions, levelling up my dudes, conquering new lands. Give Eador a chance, it's a fantastic game!

review: Gra prosta jak kilo gwoździ, ale te kilo gwoździ z przyjemnością się przewala z misji na misję. Gra przypomina bardzo uproszczonego Heroes of Might and Magic. Ekonomia banał. Walki tragicznie schematyczne, ale, ale, ale... Jeszcze jedna tura i kończę. No może jeszcze jedna. Teraz to już ostatnia, na prawdę... W promocji grę WARTO ZAKUPIĆ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004037865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 10930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10480, 'last_played': 1446401208}
review: I've put in a lot of time, so trust me when I say this, this game is not very good.  It's extremely repetitive, virtually every shard is the same, with only a few additional gimmicks (which you are informed of before you start).  The units don't change much.  You don't get to keep your heroes, (unless you pay a great deal of energy to transfer them), but that is okay, because they can max level in any shard.  You see the same scenarios happen over and over again.  Eventually, you just know where in the box to click to get the most positive result for your run.  I'm just so bored of it.  Oh, and technically I have no idea how it ends, and I've only played one campaign.  So all that time in I've spent doing the exact same things on every shard hasn't even brought me to a conclusion.  Make of that what you will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039389382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 19975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17014, 'last_played': 1574923239}
review:
One of the best turn based games I have played.  After 277 hours I can say that I still found new things in the game today.  The campaign takes forever but it is well worth it.

What usually seperates games for me is do your choices matter and is the playability of the main function fun.  This satisfies both of those requirements.  You can win in a lot of different, satisfying ways.  I had mages who just fireballed everything or never cast a spell but summoned golems to destroy everything.  The warrior class is the strongest class by far but there are some challenges still if you play that class.

Pros:  Great gameplay, Solid graphics, Fun levelling for hero and units, awesome items, soundtrack is very good, solid strategy decisions and finally very challenging even if you are a veteran player. 

Cons:  Interface is really tough especially on buildings, overpowered class(warrior/slayer) but really all heroes but commander.  Some of the events get tiresome and repetitive.

Overall this is well worth your money and more importantly your time if you like turn based games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041139406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3207, 'last_played': 1539565663}
review: This game can be a bit slow, but very fun. Build however you want and create your army and your generals. You have multiple options, but can't access everything because they conflict. So you really need to decide if your going to build light or dark and that will effect which army units you can use, because they don't work together. It makes for a choice, but you can also pick up other units through mercenaries, so it's not like you're completely cut off from it either. Very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123391588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 11450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4072, 'last_played': 1547149816}
review:
So mein erstes Review ... um kurz zu fassen gestern hatte ich den Laptop bereits in der Hand um ihn samt Eador-MotBW an die Wand zu schmeißen !

Trotzdem oder gerade deshalb will ich das Spiel empfehlen.

Der Wiederspielfaktor ist also mindestens genauso hoch wie der Frustfaktor. Was die meißten bisher festgestellt haben, kann ich bestätigen. Die KI ist selbst auf Anfänger seltsam eingestellt.

Beispiel gefällig ...

Du besitzt die komplette Karte ALLE Landschaften bis auf eine letzte, die Hochburg des Feindes.
Jetzt sollte man doch annehmen das er finanziell am Ende ist, oder ?

Denkste, der Kerl zaubert Heldengruppen wie Kaninchen aus dem Hut und egal wie oft man sie auch zerschmettert, spätestens bei der Belagerung der Hochburg, fällt einem eine neue in den Rücken.

Ich habe bisher die Kampagne gespielt.

Das ganze reizt natürlich trotzdem, irgendwie muss man dem Typen doch in den Hintern treten können.
Also erneut laden und weiterkämpfen ... 

Das Spiel erinnert an andere Titel ... das vielfach genannte HOMM oder auch Warlord 3-DLR (zumindest die strategische Ausrichtung der Helden, Ausrüstung und Gruppen).

Eador ist dabei sehr umfangreich was den Ausbau des Reiches angeht ... das macht Spaß.

Negativ ist der dauernde Geldmangel ! Man kommt sich eigentlich jede Runde vor als müsste man den Offenbarungseid ablegen ... während der Gegener anscheinend in Kohle ERSÄUFT (siehe oben).

Was soll ich sagen, ich habe wohl auch erst 25% des Spiels angespielt ... mal schauen ob da noch mehr geht.

Fazit:

Trotz "teils" hohem Frustfaktor ein unterhaltsames und gut gemachtes Spiel !

Gruß
Hellspawn

Add-on:

Sooo, nachdem ich mir mal ein paar "Lets Play" Videos zu Eador angeschaut habe, habe ich den Bogen jetzt etwas besser raus und will das Spiel auf alle Fälle loben.
Wenn man weiß worauf zu achten ist ... dann ist auch Geldmangel kein Problem.

Schade ist und bleibt das man sehr oft seine hochgelevelten Helden nicht auf die nächste Welt übertragen kann weil einem dazu die Astralpunkte fehlen ... aber gut, mit etwas taktieren, schafft man es hin und wieder einen zu übernehmen (zumindest für die nächste Scherbe).

author: {'steamid': '76561197972718105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 6575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6575, 'last_played': 1485664763}
review:
FIRSTLY, be warned that as of the time of this review the mouse is broken in various monitor configurations; after spending heaps of time try to fix it with game settings, a helpful chap gave the tip of right clicking on the EXE and going to the compatibility tab and checking the "Disable display scaling on HDPI displays".

Great game that fills the perfect gap between RPG and 4X. Not 100% sold on the aesthetic of the landscape terrains but you don't really notice that after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037520882', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1866, 'last_played': 1430967628}
review:
There is so much here that make this game amazing. I loved the different units and the difficulty of starting off. I loved being able to 100% territories to get more benefits. I loved how there was an overworld with even more shards to take over. As much as I loved this, there was more that I just didn't love. 

After spending so many hours on one shard, you start with nothing on the next shard. It feels like a slap in the face. It is supposed to feel like starting another scenario, but there is virtually nothing different from this shard than the last one. Why can't I keep some of my shit!? What's the point? If I reread my favorite book over and over, or watch the same episode of my favorite show over and over I will still enjoy it, but how often will I want to do this? It will make you go kookoo for coco puffs. That is exactly what this feels like. There may be more enemies and a slightly different layout, but no real variety. 

I wanted more from this experience, but I was just left dissapointed. This is fun, but leaves you wanting so much more. This could have been a 10/10 if things were done just a bit differently. 

4/10 I wanted to love this, but it just left me wanting a better experience that incorporates all these elements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039965679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2658, 'last_played': 1612712203}
review:
you: "All the other masters seem to have a specialty, why don't i get one?"
annoying gremlin: "You can travel back into the past, the other masters can't do that"
....?
oh.
10/10.

+ Small number of heroes (yes this is a good thing!) very easy to keep track.
+ All units level up (+medals is cool also)
+ Campaign allows for continuing the same hero. Need to get some good income of magic first though.
+ Equipment for heroes can be easily bought. (In most similar games i've tried, buying new equipment is "late game"
+ Auto-combat can speed things up.

- Hero balance is pretty awful. Scout is OP, Wizard is good, Warrior has uses, Commander is pretty much worthless.
- Lots of useless units. Mostly tier 1.
- Crashes, nothing too bad from what i've had and it autosaves frequently so rarely will you lose more than 3 minutes.
- Difficulty of units you're fighting to reach the opponent can be "too hard". i.e i had to literally go through some semi difficult dungeons too "get lucky" and find a bow which let me kill some harder stuff which i couldnt find how to dodge to even reach the opponents side of the map to kill him.
- 1 "playable" race, but hireables from others is interesting (but a little too unreliable)
- Starting can sometimes be slow (depends on randomness of finding easy dungeons)

Basics for new players:
Get scout with either barbarians or swordsman (get 2-3), i recommend swordsman as they're easier to keep alive. Do not even bother with the other units. Bowman's can be added later on if you really want or elf if you get lucky as a mercenary.
Protect scout with units whilst it slaughters stuff. When he levels increase his damage & precise strike/ammo when possible
Exploring closer to your capital is more likely to find weaker enemies. Once the scout reaches level 10 select archer and win from there.
Buy him better equipment when possible pretty much as soon as your income allows.
You can figure out the rest.

Also, speed up the combat speed to max in the settings, yes it looks a little silly but so much better.

Might seem i have more negatives than positives, but i've managed 60 hours in barely over a week and seeing i work and  do other stuff, this is pretty much all i've been playing.
Highly enjoyable and worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048420683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1444456108}
review:
First off, this isn't a BAD game, per se, it's just really......really....slow.

I like TBS games, and I like RPG games, and this has elements of both.  Think Heroes of Might and Magic style battles but with more RPG elements.  But I can tell this is going to be a long game, with lots of story/text.  Right out of the gate there's a lot of talking and it pretty much put me to sleep.  I mean, yes it was the campaign with tutorial settings, but I found everything just moved too slowly for my liking compared to some other games.

It's pretty basic, nothing really new to see at all, it's not horrible so I can't NOT recommend it, but don't expect it to blow your socks off.

5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006646356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5354, 'last_played': 1446943391}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027380080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 25604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5587, 'last_played': 1700118504}
review:
Отличная стратежка по типу Disciples и Heroes Might & Magic.
Игру стоит пройти хотя бы ради сюжета, который заслуживает всяческих похвал: множество юмора, неожиданные повороты сюжета и разномастные персонажи с индивидуальными особенностями не дадут Вам скучать.
Развивайте героев и множество юнитов, повышая их уровни после сражений. Экипируйте героев, используя множество разнообразных артефактов (сокровищ). Порабощайте подданных или защищайте их от тирании и хаоса. Переносите избранных героев в астрал и покоряйте всё и всех руками избранного героя. Заводите богоподобных друзей и врагов.
Игра интересна для прохождения, если Вы - любитель повторять тысячи однообразных действий и медленно приближаться к желаемому, развивая персонажей и воинов. В противном слчае - прохождение окажется для Вас нудным, ибо бои разнообразием не отличаются (и это единственный, на мой взгляд, минус).
Игра на любителя... и им же посвящяется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003882372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 20312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15562, 'last_played': 1473634243}
review:
Excellent, truly excellent game. I am a player of fantasy based games and this stands out as one of the best. True, it is a game that will challenge you greatly, maybe even frustrate you at the start but the campaign is very well thought out and enjoyable with several threads. The sandbox game allows you to choose levels of difficulty and size of the shard that you wish to conquer. 

You might want to follow Martin Fencka's Lets Play on Youtube as I have learned so much from following him as he has played through over 300 parts of an LP. Its a complex game but extremely rewarding.

As I write this review, you can buy the game at 80% off. A great opportunity to open up hours of challenging gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010069501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6346, 'last_played': 1443683349}
review: It's a wonderful game that simply has too many bugs/crashes and is more or less abandoned by the developers. I'd pay another ten bucks to have someone 'finish' it, but that'll never happen. Sad! Don't buy - once you love it and you realize that it'll never be what you want it to be (a working full game) you'll be frustrated no end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078466405', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1469938621}
review: Интересная, затягивающая и хардкорная стратегия. Затянута, но не суть, ведь играть-то весело. Сюжет очень качественный, каждый диалог интересно читать. Есть возможность прокачки каждого ЮНИТА, а не только героя. В игре присутствуют и красивая графика, и удобный интерфейс, и увлекательный геймплей. Не понимаю, почему смешанные отзывы... Когда читал отрицательные, то заметил, что примерно 90% из них - это жалобы на баги и вылеты, которые пофиксили уже больше года назад... В общем, игра заслуживает твёрдую восьмёрку, но мжет потянуть и на девятку.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018231802', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1381, 'last_played': 1492347137}
review:
Things I like about the game:
- The game is very cheap compared to similar games.
- A different kind of adventuring: Your heroes spend time "exploring" each "province", finding and visiting different "locations" in each of them, and upgrading the town center in each.
- You may have more than one hero, but the price increases significantly for each one. You may hoard, but it will cost you.
- Unit prices increase for every one you hire of each type. You can't just spam the best units.
- You have to choose which unit types you want, because you can only use half of them in each game.
- Your hero can only use a limited number of each unit tier at any one time, with fewer of the higher tiers.
- Building everything in your home town takes alot of time and gold. I still haven't managed to do it.

Things I dont like:
- Lack of helpful tooltips makes some things hard to understand. Like how the size of a population will affect the game. It's hard to win a game when the game doesn't tell you how things work.
- The heroes say "I will easily defeat them", but then he dies and\or loses several units in auto-combat. 
- The combat AI is awful, sending archers and healers to the front row all the time.
- Not enough abilities available for each hero type.
- Unit animations are poorly timed (they deal damage and then they hit)
- I'm swimming in mana, without trying at all.
- Heroes are unbalanced. The scout and the warrior are one man armies, while the wizard can only cast 2 attacks through a whole battle in the beginning...
- Some province populations will hate you and rebel. You dont have a clue why, because the game doesn't tell you.
- Too little focus on magic, spells are too few and not very interesting.
- There's no combat log.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056680551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 21153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10859, 'last_played': 1605396199}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098834595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1443539128}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken World "เกม 4X ราคาประหยัดที่น่าจับตา" (ไม่เคยเล่นเกมแนวนี้มาก่อน)
ในช่วงเวลาหลายปีมานี้ที่ผ่านมาหลายๆคนน่าจะเห็นเกมแนว 4X หรือที่มีเข้าใจกันว่าเป็นเกมแนว ขยาย,เก็บเกี่ยว,ทำลาย,สำรวจ โดยมีรูปแบบเกมเป็นแนววางแผนให้เดินหรือสร้างเป็นช่อง Hex คล้ายๆเกมกระดานและผลัดกันเดินนั่นเอง จุดเด่นหลักๆของเกมที่ดึงดูดผู้เล่นให้ติดกับเกมแนวนี้ได้ก็คงเป็นความซับซ้อนของแต่ละเกมไปที่จะต่างกันซึ่งต้องใช้อาศัยความเข้าใจพอสมควรในช่วงแรกๆแต่เมื่อพอทำความเข้าใจได้แล้วก็จะทำให้ติดใจกันอย่างถ้วนหน้า
-------------------
ซึ่งในเกม Eador:MTBW เราจะได้รับบทเป็นพระเจ้าเพียงองค์เดียวที่สร้างสิ่งต่างๆขึ้นมารวมถึงมนุษย์แต่ว่าไม่ได้ไปมีความผูกพันธ์กับเหล่ามนุษย์มากนักทำให้เหล่ามนุษย์ไม่รู้จักเราเลยคิดจะรวบรวม Shard (คล้ายๆเกาะลอยฟ้า) เข้าด้วยกัน   ซึ่งก็ถือว่าเป็นเกมแนว 4X ธีมแฟนตาซีผสมกับรูปแบบ RPG บางส่วน โดยตัวเกมนั้นจะค่อนข้างมีความลึกมากพอทีเดียวโดยเมื่อเริ่มมาเราจะได้รับบทว่าอยากจะเป็นใครใน 4 ตัวเลือกคือ นักรบ,จอมเวทย์,ผู้บังคับบัญชาการ,โจร ต่อมาในส่วนของเนื้อเรื่อง(เกมนี้มีเนื้อเรื่องด้วยนะ!) ก็จะอยู่คล้ายๆในรูปแบบของนิยายคือจะให้เราอ่านไปเรื่อยๆ(ไม่มีแอนิเมชั่น)เป็นการเล่าเรื่องซึ่งเราต้องตอบด้วยเช่นเดียวกันโดยการตอบจะค่อนข้างมีผลต่อเกมพอๆกับการรบโดยจุดจบของเกมจะเป็นไปได้ด้วยกันคือ 8 แบบโดยทางทีมงานบอกว่าแต่ละครั้งการเล่นจะอยู่ที่ 30-120 ชม. (ยิ่งเล่นนานก็ยิ่งจบได้ดีนะ!) และจากที่เล่นดูอย่างคร่าวๆก็พบว่าเนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างลึกพอสมควรและควรค่าแก่การอ่านไม่ได้เขียนมาลวกๆหรืออะไรแต่ก็ไม่ถึงกับอลังการแต่ถ้าใครคิดว่าแล้วถ้าอังกฤษไม่ดีจะเล่นได้หรือเปล่าก็ขอบอกว่าไม่ได้มีปัญหาอะไรจะกดข้ามๆไปก็ได้ตอบเฉพาะตอนที่สำคัญๆซึ่งก็ไม่น่าจะยาก ส่วนวิธีการเล่นเกมมีบอกไว้ในเกมอย่างชัดเจนพร้อมคู่มือในที่ติดตั้งเกมแต่เราเล่นไปแล้วก็ยังไม่เข้าใจอาจจะเป็นเพราะไม่ถนัดล่ะมั้ง T T
--------------------
ข้อสังเกตุ
-เกมไม่ Crash เองหรือดับไปดื้อๆแบบรีวิวเก่าๆแล้ว
-2ปียังมีอัพเดทตลอด
-บั้คเหมือนจะแก้แล้วเป็นส่วนมาก
-เกมถือว่าดีกว่ามาตราฐานของราคาเกมที่ตั้งไว้มาก
-มีเป็นนิยาย3เล่มแต่เป็นภาษารัสเซียซึ่งเป็นเนื้อหาในโลกของเกม
-เกมค่อนข้างละเอียดไม่แพ้เกมราคาสูงๆและไม่ได้ทำระบบมาลวกๆแน่นอน

สรุป : เกมนี้เราอาจจะบอกไม่ได้ว่ามันเป็นเกมที่ดีหรือไม่เพราะไม่มีความรู้ทางด้านเกมแนวนี้แต่ที่แน่ๆไม่ใช่เกมที่แย่อย่างแน่นอน  และที่สำคัญคือเกมนี้น่าจะเป็นเกมเริ่มต้นสำหรับคนที่อยากลองเล่นเกมแนว 4X แต่ไม่กล้าซื้อเพราะกลัวว่าจะจะเล่นไม่เป็นแล้วเสียดายเงิน ถ้ารู้สึกแบบนั้นก็น่าจะลองจากเกมนี้ก่อนซึ่งถือว่าเป็นเกม 4X ที่ดีเกินคาดแต่กลับไม่ค่อยมีใครรู้จัก สุดท้ายต้องขอบคุณที่คุณ PAEW ส่งเกมนี้มาให้เล่นมาให้เราลองเล่นด้วยจ้า
วิธีเล่น : http://guides.gamepressure.com/eadormastersofthebrokenworld/

author: {'steamid': '76561198002567771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 4898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4890, 'last_played': 1401721672}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken World is a great game if you have a lot of time to spend, and do not mind a slow progression curve. Presenting you with a strategy game set in a detailed world broken up into multiple shards, you can spend your time gathering land and power to eventually find one of many endings. 

It is a big game, full of strategic decisions and plenty of things you can explore, find, and control. It is one of the largest games in scale that I have seen so far, which is both good and bad. Good, because, of course. That's more game for you to play in, and bad because all that scale takes a lot of time to get through. So much time that you may not have enough in your schedule to make good progress in it - I have over 80 hours in it, and I have not yet completed the campaign. As much as I like the scale, the shattered vibrant world, the astral mechanics and the immersive soundtrack, it has issues that it doesn't need to have.

The world in Eador is based on shards, with each shard being a whole new map to explore and conquer, and every one you conquer brings you a new building or advantage you can take along to the next. You gain astral energy based on how much of the world is in your possession, and how many people worship you, the astral spirit/master controlling the place. The problem here is that every single shard has you build up your forces from practically nothing. You can spend energy to bring some basics, but it is never really enough to skip through the early game and expensive. Plus, who knows what else you may want your energy for? Eador plays much more like several similar skirmish maps than a long unified campaign. Yet, there is throughout it all a large storyline, from world to world, where you can spend time talking to the other masters or decide to engage them, change things that have long term effects far past the one world you're in, or otherwise find out more about the game's world. 

While in the game itself, there are a lot of random and semi-random events as well. The world feels as if it is actually a world, rather than just a game through these. The soundtrack is very well done, and it is easy enough to forget about time and spend several hours to take over another shard and advance past it. 
But it has issues, as mentioned. It is imperfect, with occasional crashes and some balance issues making it very difficult to progress at times, as well as some design decisions, whether intentional or not, leading to some choices being just plain better than others. Out of all this, the worst of it is when your opponent gets a random event that allows them to have a guard dragon, while you are still in the earliest levels. There is no way to defeat a dragon at that point without a lot of grinding experience on your hero and luck.

The opposing AI is rather poor, and at times does not seem to even understand the basics of gameplay, which is sad as you will be spending a lot of time beating on said AI. Both the other masters and the neutrals tend to be like that, sadly. The battles being on a tiny, simplistic map that shows that combat is not the game's strong point. 

But you're likely not buying this for the combat. If you're buying Eador, you're doing it for the strategy, the long term plans, the vibrant world, and all the good things it has. Try to not let its faults get to you, and you will be able to spend litterally days on it without any regret. But if you do not have time, patience, or are not that much into strategy and similar 4X games, you may not enjoy it. For those who do enjoy those things, here's for you.

review:
It's a good game. It does Heroes of Might and Magic better then Heroes of Might and Magic. That said, it has some issues. It gets reptative, AND the plot kinda stalls towards the middle. That said, it still has some nice stuff, and it feels like a worthwhile game. You get a lot of bang for your buck, and it updates well too. 

Needs some more DLC, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115214979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 111343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16077, 'last_played': 1709049289}
review: Смотрю на негативные обзоры и удивляюсь!Какие баги?Вы чего,уже давно все исправлено.,все работает.Более того разработчики не бросают проект и добавляют в игру нововведения,о которых кстати спрашивают у игроков.Для тех кто незнаком с игрой-она шикарна.Здесь замечательная экономика-вы не сможете набрать 5000 оплченцев в одну ячейку,всего одного,так что приходится беречь это существо.Система оплаты войскам тоже интересная.Чем грознее нанимаемое существо тем больше мы ему будем отстегивать каждый ход золота.А золото здесь кстати на вес золота.Ну и бовая составляющая здесь тоже замечательная.Все продумано до мелочей.Недостаток у игры есть-на мой взгляд партии чересчур затянуты,но тем интереснее побеждать.Так что кто еще не играл-вперед,тем более по такой цене!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155648775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 39538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1979, 'last_played': 1690405609}
review: Игра вобрала в себя всё самое лучшее от игр Heroes III, Heroes V и Disciples II и конечно же King's Bounty. Очень атмосферная и затягивающая, довольно сложная, и что приятно - в ней действительно надо думать, думать на несколько шагов вперёд. Так же, тщательно планировать свои действия во время боя, один неверный ход и в лучшем случае вы теряете ценного юнита, в худшем проигрываете бой, даже, казалось бы с превосходящими силами. Я не буду описывать игру, что в ней да как, ведь это уже написано до меня, одно скажу точно: для фанатов вышеперечисленных игр - К покупке ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНА! Конечно же хватает ещё некоторых технические недоработок, побольше и поразнообразнее бы визуальных эффектов, хотелось бы побогаче озвучку юнитов, героев и окружающего мира. Но в целом никаких существенных проблем игра не доставляет, просто хочется что б её просто отшлифовали и довели до состояния близкого к идеалу, ведь идеал на то и идеал, что б быть недостижимым. Конечно - У всех свой вкус - сказал индус сажая на ...й обезьяну. Но на мой взгляд игра может стать классикой своего жанра, и стать фактически такой же бессмертной как и Heroes и Disciples. Она этого целиком и полностью заслуживает.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042395079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1481579780}
review:
This game has become a solid entry into the "4x" genre at this point. You conquer the Eador world shard by shard. Each shard you conquer allows you to build a little bit better buildings.  The combat is turn based and is done very well. The variety of monsters, creatures you will face is also very nice. I am a little over 16 hours into the game and I am on my 4th shard and to be honest it is getting a bit repetetive at this point. There is no hero carry over from shard to shard so after you conquer a shard you then recruit a new hero for the next. I think this is where the game falls a bit. You spend hours working through a shard, building your main provicence and adding a couple of smaller buildings to the conquered provinces all the while leveling up your hero. This is honestly quite a bit of work and takes grinding to beat the shard. However once you beat the shard , you lose all your progress and your hero. You essentially start the next shard at ground zero. Albeit you have access to a little bit better buildings but you do the same thing again. Start your hero at 0 and work on beating that shard. 
This is a fun game and at this point of its life plays solid- however I do not see myself logging 60 hours due to the repeat process on each shard. 
Things I think would make this game more enjoyable for longer play:
Carry over your hero and make the next shard a level harder. This way you feel you are building towards something as you play through. Right now on shard 4 I stopped because I have a level 0 Warrior and he just croaked on 3 imps with 4 barbarians with him. It is frustrating considering on shard 3 I grinded my Mage to a great level and was enjoying the game. Then .... he is gone once the shard is defeated.
Reduce the amount of searching in each province. To get to 100% per province takes quite a bit of time and is very repetetive. I find myself at this point in the game rolling my eyes when I hit nothing encountered 3x in a row and it becomes a click fest to see what you will find.
Add more heroes if you plan on keeping the new hero per shard. They are quite generic and there is no real customization you can do to make the new hero on the next shard feel different.
 Right now you only have 4 to choose. I have already used all 4 and I am on my 4th shard. From what I read this game can reach 20+ shards per playthrough.
The good :
Pretty game. Graphics are solid.
Combat is quite fun. I do like the movement points and I do like the challenge as the fights are not easy.
The variety of monsters,creatures encountered is very large. 
Once you get the hang of city building with the wheel its pretty slick. I found myself realy enjoying the building aspect.

All in all .. this a solid 4x entry ....however if you are like me and enjoy customization of your characters and buidling your characters over the course of the game you will find this quite repetetive and almost a chore when you hit the next shard. (notice my frequest use of the word repetetive)

I would give it 7/10 based on solid gameplay, graphics,combat but it falls a bit due to lack of hero diversity, growth, and customization.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008124410', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1991, 'last_played': 1558808698}
review:
Эадор - как много в этом слове!
Это отличная стратегия, сотканая из различных элементов других стратегий, но образущая нечто новое, свежее.
Вы один из Владык - высших существ Эадора, и ваша главная цель захват Осколков, представляющих собой дрейвующие клочки некогда целого мира. И за эти Осколки вам придется конкурировать с другими Владыками, с которыми, в зависимости от ваших действий и слов, будет меняться отношение к вам, от глубокого уважения до лютой ненависти.
Эадор заставляет подумать прежде чем действовать, разработать для себя тактику и расставить приоритеты. Здесь не попрешь напролом и не стоит идти вслепую, нужно всегда учитывать какой морали вы придерживаетесь, специфику Осколков, стоимость и особенности зданий и юнитов, выгоды союзов и т.п.
Эадор. Владыки миров вобрала в себя все это от Эадора. Сотворения и добавила приятную графику, которая вкупе с музыкой Сотворения, создает поистине сказочную атмосферу!
Окунитесь же и вы в этот замечательный мир и начните свое собственное зовоевание Эадора!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023742128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1691, 'last_played': 1431721005}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041308877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1757, 'last_played': 1442172861}
review: Unfortunately, Eador: Masters of the Broken World, doesn't add anything to the fantasy 4x strategy genre.  The game feels (as in it is) really dated with mechanics, graphics, music and themes that belong at the turn of the century.  Eador would be considered a "good" game back then, but it doesn't measure up to what can be done now.  There isn't any story behind any of the game, mechanics are pretty straightforward (meaning uninspired) and don't bring anything we haven't already seen.  You will encounter odd text in tooltips, ranging from some type of humor (which comes out of nowhere) to not helpful at all. You will spend many turns pressing "next", which brings the game to another issue: performance.  Turns are pretty long, even from the start.  Considering that this isn't a very complex game to begin with, it  proves that the studio doesn't know how to optimize a game for the current era. There aren't really any options as to who you play as, where you are going or what path to take.  Overall its just a sad, flat, uninspired game that is akin to a sophmore student's project at technical school.  A "must not" buy. :/

author: {'steamid': '76561197989312981', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6672, 'last_played': 1453762000}
review:
I decided to write this review because I've just seen a new update in my Steam download list and I thought:"wow they keep patching the game! Let's give it a thumb up!". After years the devs still take care of Eador, and this a great thing.

The game concept is quite original: long ago, after a great cataclysm, the world literally broke into pieces... but life did not encounter its extinction and now each shard of Eador is floating on the Astral Plane as a little world on its own. In the farthest dephts of the Astral Plane boils the burning chaos (a sort of hell), populated by demons whose only purpose is to swallow every single shard until nothing will be left on the Material Plane. This reminded me so much "the nothing" of the movie "The Neverending Story", and when someting brings me back to my early youth it's always a good thing.
Some elder entities or some fortunate, cunning or sinister mortals have found the way to "ascend" to become a Master: a demigod with peculiar powers able to reunite the shards and to shape them into their ideal world. Every Master wants to get all the shards for him in order to restore Eador (the official rightful goal), and because if he loses all his shards, often due to the attack of another Master, the chaos will swallow him (the unofficial but very compelling goal). You play the role of a Master (and a very powerful one, with the power of time travel... that is how the game justifies the "load game" button!). 
But enough lore...

The artistic style of the game is quite unique and in my opinion it's just enough to recommend the game to those who like the genre. I find it very "dreamlike": the colors are vivid and the illumination reminds me of a late afternoon in an autumn day. Very oniric. The loading screens are the best I've seen: they're handpainted and show different kinds of shards. I always find myself staring at them, searching for a little particular in a distant town or thinking about the loneliness of the people who live in the only creepy village in the swamp shard...
The music is soft and it seems like you're listening to it from afar... like in a dream. Just one thing... why isn't there a combat music??? fighting with a lullaby (even if it's a very, very good one) as soundtrack does brake the atmosphere!
The sound effects are not as good as the music, but it's not an issue.

The gameplay is structured into turns, this game is not meant to be played in a hurry, yet the AI is very fast (maybe because, as other people has said, it does not shine for its "intelligence"). Every Master who struggles for the shard can count on mortal heroes born in the shard (or, as recently added in an update, transported from the previous conquered shard through the astral plane to the new shard) devoted to him. 
In a given turn your "hero" can perform a single action picked from the common 4X choices:
- eXpand your reign by conquering neaby regions;
- eXplore your domains for places of interest (and give a boost to the economy with the treasures he finds);
- eXterminate your rival Masters and kick them out of the contended shard (or into the Chaos if you're attacking their world);
- eXploit the resources of your regions by building specific structures and by taking decisions and reacting to random events.

The "exploit" part of the game is nice (even though after lots of games it becomes a bit repetitive), because it is based on completely random events which can affect the morale of the commoners and/or the income of every single region under your control. For example plagues, fires, festivals, magic or scientific discoveries can happen and you have always to take a decision: you can be a tyrant that enslaves the workers in order to boost the production or a benevolent god loved by the people: there is a "karma" mechanic that sums all your decisions for the curent shard, and in the end the people will give you a title like "The Pure". The interesting thing about this is that the choices encourage you to think as a demigod, not as a human: your goal is the domain of the shard and mortals are just creatures (and if you try to please them always, you'll discover they are a quite expensive kind of creature) that you can cuddle or slaughter if needed. After all a game turn could last a day, a year or a generation... why should you concern about creatures whose whole life is a blink of an eye compared to the eternity of your being?

Combat is challenging but I find that only the Archer hero is useful (at least according to my playstyle). Other hero types are way too weak IMHO (although I guess that a high level mage would be able to win every battle very easily, especially with high level summons). 
Planning the logistics is very important as the main hero gets farther from your capital, because independent troops get stronger and heroes (apart from archers) can move only one/two regions per turn. So it's important to dedicate to production the regions which are near the capital and to build forts and marketplaces into the border regions. But these are general rules, since the absolute randomness of the shards (even the campaign ones) can really influence the outcome of the game, and this can be a pro or a con (you decide): the last shard I played, for example, a poor enemy Master started on a peninsula linked to the main land by a line of regions of deadland (which is not productive and it's difficult to conquer at the early stages of the game), so when I reached him at the end of the game he was blocked and weak... and I annichilated him. If that happened to me I probably wuold have reloaded the game... I am the timewalker Master after all ;)

I could speak a lot more about the management (hiring defenders, maintenance costs, combat and people morale, quests, alliances with NPC races) but this is a review, not a guide! 
I just want to spend a few words about the tech-tree because... there's no tech-tree! Your "technology" for the shard is decided by the buildings you build. In the campaign every shard you conquer adds some new building for your capital city to your building list (you start with an "empty" city in every new shard). Every building allows you to do something: recruit a new type of troop, give a bonus to morale, learn new spells, build special buildings in other regions ecc... In addition, like in a tech-tree, some buildings block others, so you have to plan which ones will you construct according to your desired gameplay style for the shard.

So let's talk about the bugs now. The game crashes once every few hours, so I sugest to enable autosave, which can overcome almost completely the bug allowing you to load the last turn.

What else to say?
I recommend this game! It has the "just one more turn" effect on me...

author: {'steamid': '76561198009742519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 40496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30932, 'last_played': 1557177706}
review:
i have almost 600 hours into this game and i have never been able to finish a campain due to game breaking bugs. over 2 years and this game is still infested with bugs. and now it seems to be even worse as now even random 1 shard games are  chain crashing with in 100 turns or so even with reloading prior saves and trying to do diffent things in game.   while sometimes game can be fun there are to many game breaking bugs to recommend the game unless it is less than 5 dollars.

update (jan3rd 2017) the updated added on dec 28 did not adress the playablity of this game.  crashed 4 times in 45 min, call me cynical but i expect the "update" was just pushed out because the game is broke as fuck and they are trying to sell a 3rd installment of their broke shit and they are trying to get the whole  look we keep updating old games line to sucker people into buying the new game. 

i will admit when the game works i do find it mindless fun just that fun lasts a very short time before frustration with constant crashes sets in. 

again i would not pay more than 5 bucks for any snowbird game ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993184982', 'num_games_owned': 1415, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 115882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57002, 'last_played': 1605601374}
review:
Purchased this because I loved Eador: Genesis. I love this game much more than Eador: Genesis. It expands upon that game in so many ways. Graphics, units, situations, encounters, gameplay, AND MUCH MUCH MORE! My playtime invested speaks for itself. 9/10

**update 3-16-16**

I now have almost 1000 hours in the game. I am very disappointed in all the negative reviews for this game. There has not been a single bug that is 100% gamebreaking for me. All bugs are minor and easily fixed. The game is well worth playing even despite its minor flaws. Don't pass up this hidden gem! 

Add me on Steam friends list if you ever want to talk about this game with me or if you are considering buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001883436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1440401027}
review:
I've never seen so much needless repetition in a game, which sucks because with a few tweaks Eador would be superb! But you will quickly see (within the first non-tutorial map) that the game is incredibly repetitive and grindy.

There is a concept of exploring provinces which is good but the execution is bad: Exploring takes many turns and you have to tell your heroes to "Continue exploring" every. single. turn. You may even get more than one hero to do this, so you will be clicking OK a lot. This really should be automatic.

You can then "visit" the locations you have found while exploring, which you will usually do this with your strongest hero. When visiting locations, any scouting information you accrued is lost and you're given no indication of the fight difficulty (if there is one) until you spend a turn. Both issues could have been covered in a 'are you sure?' prompt when selecting locations.

You're supposed to hire heroes and support them with an army. But I found it much easier to just hire a tough warrior hero and equip them with all the stuff you find from visiting locations. After a while they become invincible and can just stomp on everything. Armies are too expensive/upgrading heroes via equipment is too cheap.

Managing your kingdom is a horrible experience. You can only reinforce one village guard and build one building in one province per turn. Your kingdom will typically consist of dozens of provinces, making this incredibly tedious and difficult to keep track of. These limits could be removed.

Finally, there are too many random events. They can fire off for multiple provinces every. single. turn. Many events have multiple stages, depending on what choice you make. Do you care that there is a minor event in the insignificant province of Backwater Dump that might affect the citizens in some vague, indiscernable manner? The game believes you should. These events could have been more rare and had a larger impact.

So, Eador is entertaining and has great concepts but terrible execution. I can't recommend it when there are better games like it out there (Age of Wonders, Heroes of Might and Magic 3/5).

author: {'steamid': '76561197977703126', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 4159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4159, 'last_played': 1440198936}
review:
I tried to like this game, I really did, but the game is way too unbalanced and way too RNG dependent in order to be good.

The game is pretty simple, kind of like some sort of Total War TBS. The object is to conquer shards by taking each enemy's capital, then move onto the next using advantages you gained in prior shards. Combat is grid based on a board with your soldiers. Each army is led by a hero and they all have their own special powers. Seems just like my kind of game.

UNFORTUNATELY... the game is just broken in a number of ways. The shards are randomly generated and sometimes you can just get a trash start where it's very difficult to take neutral territories while the AI proceeds to take everything else. And on the topic of the AI... its cheating is in a league of its own. I've never seen anything like it in a game. The AI will do insane things like get tier 2 guard units before you even have access to them in game, all but insuring capturing their capital is nearly impossible. The same with spells. Tier 4 spells that one shot your entire army, super rare items, endless pools of gold... I've had the exact situation, where the AI was down to maybe 4 provinces and I had the entire map, but they would pop out heroes and full armies like it was nothing, all while their capital was defended by Centaurs, a tier 2 unit, that would utterly destroy even the best army I could muster since I hadn't even unlocked any tier 2 units!! By the way, this was on the 3rd from lowest difficulty, where the game still gives you advantages. Even when you don't get completely screwed with RNG and do pretty well all this cheating makes the game extremely tedious. Especially the guards. More often than not you need to grind up to beat them, sometimes for a long, long time. And you know what? In  the end, the AI cheating really doesn't make it that much harder. It just makes it take much, much longer.

Add in some bugs plus a less than stellar UI and you have Eador in a nutshell. If it were less tedious it'd be a pretty fun game. As it is though? I suppose it's better than Warlock, but that's all I can really give it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023804630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 50740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32045, 'last_played': 1489029723}
review:
One of my favorite 4x ever.  I didn't expect to like this game when I got it but found myself loving it.  
Most good and bad has already been stated in the other reviews.
Don't ignore the conversations in this game is all I'd like to add.

Yes the AI is dorky much of the time but I noticed (for me at least) it is only on some worlds. 
Bugs and crashes seem rare to me.

Everything else I love about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097680058', 'num_games_owned': 2148, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3434, 'last_played': 1432384205}
review:
What can I say... In this game, you have tons of thing to do, yes, tons of thing, repeatedly, YES, REPEATEDLY.

This is kind of Disciple or Heroes of Might and Magic turn base kind of game, where you have to take turn for everything, like planing which world you'll conquer, and how you conquer that world. This game does that aspect really good, though. You have a good amount of unit and enough ways to level up you heroes( yeah, just enough), then, you have a tons amount of choices when you are in a world.You totally feel like you conquer and control that world. That's a good thing.

But you have to feel this good feeling tons of times. I mean, whenever you conquer a world(or shard), you have to restart from the begining, YES, FROM THE BEGINnING. While this is not a bad idea, I mean it, but this kind of game IS very long, the campaign IS very long, and after sometimes, you will think, "What, I need to do it again? All right, I will do this, I will chose that. Come on, let get this war end". And BAM, after this, you have to that, again.

Don't get me wrong, it's up to you, I just show what you will do. But imo the game offers not enough content to make this mechanic fun to play. 

The graphic is kind of acceptable, the music is nice. 

What all I have to say, can not recommend though, our life is busy enough to keep doing the same thing over again to get a short ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039463852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1439618503}
review:
Concept sounded cool, so I downloaded.
First time loading up the game - it crashes as soon as I click "Play game".

I Google and realize that it's a hugely widespread issue with a lot of people guessing at various fixes which work for some people but not for everyone.

Spent 20 minutes trying to get the game to run, don't care nearly enough to invest more time - first time I've refunded a game in Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053234919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 127656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34711, 'last_played': 1700748354}
review:
While this game is worthwhile on a number of levels, such as the many choices of buildings to construct, the endless variety of maps that are generated, and the many different items you may find as loot, what I am most intrigued by are the continuously important choices you must make when it comes to whether or not to fight a battle.  Going up against 3 giant spiders may seem somewhat easy for an archer who has gained several levels and found a decent bow, but 8 or 9 may be overwhelming, so getting a sense of what is and is not achievable, and when, is a real skill here.  Should you decide to play at a high enough difficulty that the advice is turned off, then skillfull decisions become crucial, because it is there that the handholding is truly gone.

The discovery of what unit types complement one another is also quite fun to explore, especially on the occasion when you may acquire a unit type that cannot be recruited in your own castle.  I am dying to mention some of my favorites combinations, but it is the joy of these discoveries that makes them satisfying, so I will leave it at that.

True, there is still an occasional crash, but I have not had to begin a new game because of them in well over a year, maybe longer. Restarting the game lets me resume play after replaying only a single turn, so it's not much of an inconvenience.  In the end, this game keeps me coming back again and again because of its good things, and I am always delighted to discover more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969304557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1506, 'last_played': 1489957674}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110670597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2551, 'last_played': 1560879611}
review: I must admit all the negative reviews put me off, but most of the top rated reviews were all positive. So I decided to pirate the game to see what it was like. I can honestly say that it was extremely fun and I decided to buy it the next day. For those who are new to the genre or maybe even the game, I recommend using beginner difficulty and playing the tutorial to get a grasp of the game mechanics. It's a fun game that requires you to think tactically on the battlefield and strategically about what 'shard' you want to conquer. It can be difficult at times, especially if you get a bad starting position, however this can be overcome when you get used to the game. However losing a shard isn't game over, as long as you have more than your opponent you're still in with a chance. Look if you're still not sure pirate the game, don't like it don't buy it, if you do like it buy it, simple. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040521391', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2450, 'last_played': 1438519650}
review: Многовато багов. Особенно в сетевой за осколок, но я слишком долго мечатал об этом чтобы ставить минус. Всякие там HoM&M близко не валялись: живые воины устают - их урон снижается, а потом они выдыхаются и не могут даже толком защитить себя, они разочаровываются в своём лидере, боятся - их атака снижается, а потом они впадают в панику, Наследники древнего рода пытаются отнять твою провинцию, гоблины набежали, а решение выручившее тебя в прошлый раз может погубить твою репутацию и вызвать бунт в следующий. Мой замок пал от нападения двух гоблинов, не понятно откуда выползших, пока мой герой сражался с драконом, с тех пор я не оставляю родовую провинцию без охраны, что часто делал почти во всех подобных стратегиях.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082917255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1524858892}
review: игра норм(самый честный и простой обзор),собственно, мир разделён на множество мелких остравков, летающих в безкрайнем космосе, мы играем за божество(вроде)которое выбирает островок, и вселяется в одного из его обитателей, и потихоньку начинает захватывать мир( с нашей помощью),вот, захватывайте, города, бейте противника, улучшаете ситуацию в ваших владениях(ибо может случится что вашему народу вы не будете нравится и миссия автоматически будет провалена),есть так же другие божества, они также будут пытатся захватить островки, но типо нам нужнее,а так похоже на героев, стройка в городах, ходы,бои на поле из гексов, только есть некоторые пльшки,какие? поиграйте сами узнаете, вообщем ,вы могли не читать весь этот обзор , а просто обратить внимание на начальную фразу, и так заключение, игра НОРМ!(люблю запятые,а так же скобочки)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997102198', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1436778170}
review:
Ez a játék jó is lehetne, csak nagyon felül lötték be a nehézséget. 
Az oktatópálya nehézsége pont jó, az ember élvezi a játékot, de aztán belekezd a kampányba és rájön, hogy a készítőknek elgurult a gyógyszerük.
A hiba szerintem ott van, hogy nagyon kevés a pénzünk. Ha veszünk pár jobb(?) egységet, már nem tudunk fejlődni, mert a fenntartásuk mindent felemészt. Hiába foglalunk el provinciákat, szinte semmi bevételt nem termelnek (1-2 arany), építeni meg nem enged rájuk.
Példa: veszünk 2 íjászt (ami nem a legdurvább egységek egyike), a fenntatrásuk fejenként 12 arany, a várunk (az összes aranyat adó épület felépítése mellett) és 4 provincia bevétele pedig összesen  25 arany, tehát már be is satultunk. Ha pedig csak az alap egységekkel megyünk, azok harmatgyengék.
A játék onnan válna élvezetesebbé, mikor fel tudnánk szedni pár szintet és aranyat, de azt csak vért izzadva lehet.
Szóval ezt a játékot csak fanatikus stratégáknak ajánlom, mezei "heroes" fanoknak nem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004094178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5556, 'last_played': 1493544228}
review:
A very fun turn based 4x fantasy based strategy game.
Dangerously addictive game. Hours just melt away playing this game.

It's not an easy game, definately not for casual players. Build order for buildings is very important. You have to balance available money between buying new units and building new buildings/province improvements. Units require monetary or gem upkeep, some require both. Build too many units and you cannot improve provinces or build castle improvments. If you spend too much time improving your castle and provinces the AI will steamroll you with thier army. So a carefull balance between economy and military buildup is necessary.

Negative: AI does not calculate battles well. Battles that will destroy your entire army on auto will be listed as being very easy. Battles listed as too difficult are easy to win in manual mode. So most battles will have to be fought in manual, since even in very easy battles you will lose units (possibly even powerfull units) if these easy battles are fought on auto.

Pros: Good replayability. Map generator is similar to the civilization games. Large or small shards can be generated depending on desired length of time you want to play in a skirmish.
The Campaign is a good way to learn the game, but is very long. I played the campaign just long enought to get the game basics down.
Many different unit types available, good, evil, or neutral. As well as magical or mundane units.

Overall a very fun game. I would suggest setting an alarm clock before playing since hours can go by very rapidly. I started playing this game in the mornig, next thing I know it's 2pm. I missed breakfast and lunch. Recommended to 4x Strategy game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113029470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 18520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6115, 'last_played': 1503026073}
review:
Игра офигенна. Это не унылая Цивилизация, почти без свистелок-перделок AoW 3, мир не ограничен обычным средневековьем Stronghold'a, нет мрачновато-корявенькой анимации Fallen Enchantress.
Визуальная составляющая кажется некой смесью хороших картинок из карточных игр и... не самой, может быть, красивой анимации. Да и железо нагружается, на мой взгляд, неоправданно сильно, как, например, в той же Цивилке. Однако, в рамках жанра, визуал справляется со своей задачей... пожалуй, на отлично.
Здесь вы не увидите масштабных анимаций каждого чиха, как в той же LineAge 2 и им подобных, но и пустоты STALKER'а тоже не найдётся. Фэнтезийность мира не делает его суперсложным, как и не делает механику идиотской.
К сожалению, знаю не так много людей, которые знакомы с этой игрой, поэтому не могу судить, кому она понравится, а кому - нет. Зато могу сказать вот что: я буду играть в неё и через пять, и через десять лет; чем-то она меня привлекла, как, когда-то, Готика 2, и, пожалуй, единственное, что приходит на ум по этому поводу - атмосфера. Не подышите - не поймёте. =)
P.S. И, да, не обманывайтесь часами в Steam'е. Я играл в неё ещё где-то... с осени 2014. Йо-хо-хо, Jewel-box мне в якорь!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014950565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 35912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8026, 'last_played': 1660603871}
review:
Rundenbasiertes Strategie / Rollenspiel.
Alles in Allem sehr gelungen, finde ich. Verzeiht mir die Kürze dieses Reviews, aber ich führe hier nur kurz auf was für mich die wesentlichen Punkte sind. Wer wissen will was das für ein Genre ist und was es für Bugs gibt, sollte sich meiner Meinung nach nicht in Reviews schlau machen.

Okay Ich verstehe nicht recht warum hier Leute als negativen Punkt die "zu schweren" Kämpfe aufführen, die Herausforderung dabei ist, finde ich, eine der positivsten Punkte im Spiel. Man hat recht schnell die Prinzipien von Geländevorteilen, den verschiedenen Grundlegenden Zaubern und Einheitenarten verstanden. Man braucht sich nicht wundern wenn man 5 Milizen einem Troll ins Gesicht rennen lässt und nicht weiterkommt. Senkt man des Trolls Ausdauer jedoch einfach mit ein paar Zaubern und bespickt ihn aus der Entfernung, vielleicht noch mit Zaubern die die Verteidiungswerte senken, Erlegt man das Biest leicht. Rätsel gelöst.

Ich ackere mich derzeit durch verschiedene rundenbasierte Strategiespiele, und ich muss sagen das Eador: Masters of the Broken Word vorallem durch einige (nicht übermäßig viele, aber genug) verschiedene Einheiten, Einheitenfähigkeiten und vorallem durch das wie ich finde großartige Gebäudesystem Punktet. Es gibt vier verschiedene Helden. Im Laufe der Kampagne erspielt man sich immer neue Gebäude, Einheiten und Zauber, und ich fand großen Gefallen daran auf diese Weise immer mehr neue Inhalte dazu zu bekommen. Das Levelsystem der vier verschiedenen Helden ist auch okay, genauso sind die Helden halbwegs balanced, zumindest wenn die Kampagne etwas fortschreitet (In den ersten paar Leveln braucht es leider leider einfach einen Krieger mit einem dicken Zweihänder und ein paar Stufenaufstiegen, der die ganzen Papp-Einheiten alleine ummäht. Das macht übrigens auch der NPC ganz gerne. Nur dass man selbst den NPC- Krieger halbwegs effektiv wie den oben genannten Beispieltroll bekämpfen kann, was die K.I. nicht ganz so gut gebacken bekommt).
Also alles in allem ganz angenehmes Spiel soweit, nur gibt es da leider auch einige Punkte die mich stören und mir vollkommen unverständlich sind.

Vorallem sind das die Grafiken. Versteht mich nicht falsch, die Grafik an sich gefällt mir. Auch die Einheitenmodels sind okay. Die Angriffsanimationen kann man auch lassen. Nur warum, warum, warum steckt man so viel Arbeit in das game und hat dann nur eine Handvoll Zauberanimationen? Ich hab mich riesig gefreut als ich in der Kampagne ein Zaubergebäude freigespielt habe, das meinen Hexer Zauber wie Feuerbälle, Blitzzauber und ähnliches erlernen lies. Ich hatte nur schnell einen sehr verwirrten Gesichtsausdruck als ich feststellte, dass die Animation des Feuerballs/Blitzes genau so aussieht wie der einfache magische Pfeil, einen Zauber des ersten Ranges, der widerrum genauso aussieht wie die einfache Standard-Fernkampfanimation des Hexers und sämtlicher anderer Magiereinheiten im Spiel. Was zur Hölle? Die verschiedenen Items der Helden werden sowieso nicht angezeigt, die Models der vier Helden sind auch immer die gleichen. Ich fand mich recht schnell damit ab dass die Helden auf ungewöhnliche Art und weise um das ein-einhalbfache größer sind als sämtliche andere Vertreter ihrer Rasse, dann stellte ich außerdem noch fest dass wenn die Klasse des Helden mit dem 10ten Level erweitert wird, sich das Model praktisch garnicht ändert (Es ändert sich tatsächlich etwas, glaube ich. Jedoch so unglaublich unwesentlich, dass es mir die ersten paar Levels nicht einmal auffiel). 
Genausowenig wie die Fähigkeiten. Während man levelt, kann man mit jeder Stufe eine von drei (zufällig vorgeschlagenen?) Fertigkeiten wählen. Ganz praktisch, um seinen Helden leicht in eine bestimmte richtung zu entwickeln. Mit dem zehnten Level erhält der Held eine "neue" Klasse. In den Beschreibungen dieser erweiterten Klassen wird angepriesen was für tolle Fähigkeiten der Held hinzugewinnt, jedoch passiert nichts anderes als dass er beim Levelup neben Fertigkeiten seiner Klasse auch die einer jeweils anderen bekommt, die erweiterten Klassen heißen also beispielsweise beim Hexer eigentlich "Hexer+Krieger, Hexer+Späher, Hexer+Befehlshaber oder Hexer+NochMehrHexer".
Am absurdesten war wohl, als ich einen Befehlshaber mit der Hexerklasse erweiterte. Man kann dann entsprechend mehr Zauber lernen und Zauberstäbe ausrüsten. Gesagt, getan. Als ich dann im Kampf den Befehlshaber einen Distanz-Standardangriff ausführen lies, Griff er zu seinem Rücken (wo eine Armbrust ist die er benutzt, wenn man ihn mit der Späher-Klasse erweitert), nahm GARNICHTS von seinem Rücken, Spannte in der Luft eine imaginäre unsichtbare Zauber-Armbrust und schoss, woraufhin sich ein magischer Pfeil in seinen Händen bildete der zum Gegner flog.
Ich musste bei dieser Animation für eine Millisekunde weinen. Ein gutes Game sollte nicht durch so einen Unfug sich selbst verschandeln.

Trotzdem bleib ich dabei. Von meiner Grafik-Detailnörgelei abgesehen find ich das Gameplay sehr gut, die Story solala und es braucht wirklich, bis es langweilig wird (bei mir noch nicht der Fall).
Auch die Schwierigkeit finde ich okay.

Somit eine Empfehlung für Leute die das Genre mögen und über solche Schönheitsfehler hinwegsehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064884371', 'num_games_owned': 7909, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1431688126}
review:
回合制的游戏，可以在开始前招募民兵
蛋疼的是在进入战斗界面前要选好人物的技能次序，战斗中不能修改，而且施放技能的次数还得升级解锁
还有就是攻击动作还没表现出来，红字的伤害先显示，弄的我总以为砍完还会有伤害
