author: {'steamid': '76561197972518312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 5781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5781, 'last_played': 1435610962}
review:
After sinking 100 hours into this, I'm rather annoyed to be screwed by the AI.  The game uses a seeding system so things that appear random really aren't, I got invaded by another master who gets to rock up with multiple lvl 3 trolls which you can do very little about at low level.

Basically this is a good game, *very* long, but up until I hit a road block with AI that doesn't follow the rules I was enjoying it.   I can't even change the difficulty without replaying about 10 hours worth of battle as it goes straight into an unskippable dialogue after completing the previous shard.

So, recommended with caveats,

author: {'steamid': '76561198073218961', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1511, 'last_played': 1464918475}
review: Хорошая игра

author: {'steamid': '76561198008034924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 13608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12475, 'last_played': 1524985213}
review:
Удивлен, что до сих пор на данную игру так мало обзоров и отзывов. 
Постараюсь внести свой вклад.

Основные достоинства игры:
1. Интересный трёхуровневый геймплей. 
1.1 Верхний «глобально-стратегический» астральный уровень, на котором мы решаем сюжетные и политические задачи, а также вопросы стратегического развития. Мы отыгрываем роль одного из полубогов - Владык, собирающего из осколков ранее разрушенный неким катаклизмом мир. Здесь мы определяемся с союзниками и противниками среди других Владык, продвигаем сюжет, планируем свое научное развитие и расширение своего мира путем захвата нейтральных миров-осколков. 
1.2 Средний «стратегический» уровень осколков, где мы захватываем /исследуем/развиваем провинции, определяем свою карму, торгуем и выясняем отношения с другими Владыками которые также претендуют на включение данного осколка в свой мир. 
1.3 Нижний «тактический» уровень, на котором происходят все сражения.

2. Комплексная и логичная проработка каждого аспекта игры. 
2.1 Карма в этой игре  - не пустой звук. Сюжет, взаимоотношения с другим владыками, своими подданными и даже войсками напрямую зависит ваших решений и поступков.
2.2 Захват осколка осуществляется с помощью героев. Герой водит с собой ограниченное количество воинов. Каждый воин и герой может развиться до 30 уровня. Типов войск – около сотни, вариантов специализации героев – дюжина. Опробовать сразу всё не получится.
2.2 Осколки имеют разную специфику. Например, на «ржавом» осколке экипировка героев изнашивается в 5 раз быстрее, а на «мертвом» осколке населенных провинций мало, что кардинально сказывается на бюджете. Выполнять захват осколков по одному сценарию не получится. 
2.3 На самом осколке вы можете расширить свои владения за счет аборигенов  разными способами: силой, подкупом, заключая альянсы. 
2.4 На экономику каждой провинции влияет масса факторов: расса коренного населения, тип местности, степень заселенности, степень довольства, уровень коррупции, природные ресурсы, инфраструктура. 
2.5 В бою оказывает влияние рельеф, карма, мораль, выносливость и спецумения войск и героев.
2.6 Глобальная и боевая магия разных школ, артефакты, случайные события и т.д. и т.п. 

3. Интересный сюжет, возможность отыгрывать по-настоящему злое или доброе божество с неочевидными и далекоидущими последствиями.

4. Приятная (хоть и простоватая) «сказочная» графика и музыкальное сопровождение.

5. Игру делали инди автор и команда, которые не побоялись экспериментов и реализовали в одной игре гармоничный микс таких серий как «Герои меча и магии», «Цивилизация» и «Европа универсалис».


К недостаткам можно отнести следующее:
1. Малонасыщенный геймплей на верхнем «астральном» уровне.

2. При прохождении кампании надоедает определенная однообразность на стратегическом уровне осколков. Каждый раз при захвате нового осколка необходимо начинать развитие родовой провинции и героя/армии «с нуля». С последним патчем авторы вроде внесли изменения в этот аспект, но я их еще не опробовал.

3. Выход в релиз «сырой» версии игры. Именно большое количество багов в первое время после релиза принесло игре массу негативных откликов и отпугнуло широкую аудиторию.

Итог: каждый любитель пошаговых стратегий обязан попробовать данную игру. На мой взгляд - это тот путь по которому должны были развиваться «Герои меча и магии» )

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197994141516', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2907, 'last_played': 1465599426}
review: По сравнению с Eador:Genesis - сильно выигрывает за счет осовремененой графики, сильно проигрывает за счет лагов, тормозов и багов. Правда, чтоит отдать должное разработчикам, в последнее время багов стало на порядок меньше. Сама игра - прекрасный симулятор царя, ибо сидишь ты в замке - а тут к тебе гонец притопал, говорит - гидра завелась в провинции. "Что делать будем, Ваш-сиясь?" Вот такие выборы и составляют львиную долю интереса игры. Ну и стратегическое в полном смысле этого слова планирование, прекрасную тактику и баланс тоже не стоит со счетов списывать. Прекрасная игра для любителей варгеймов, глобальных и тактических стратегий. Не казуальная, да - даже на уровне сложности "Начинающий" будет весьма непросто; но в то же время достаточно хардкорная для опытных зубров TBS. Ну а для любителей мазахизма могу порекомендовать Eador:Genesis с модом "Новые горизонты" - вот где жесть. Даже на "Эксперте"

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1448396473}
review: Awesom little game many of the complaints regard the difficulty (then get a trainer or something, no guilt it's yours if ya buy it afterall). It's one of the best little Hex TBS games that exists, Being a veteran of the HOMM, CIv, Disciples and every other TBS I could get my havnds on over 20 years....lol This one fills the bill, the difficulty is pretty frustrating but any good gamer can adjust that to your needs. It is a very worthy addition to your library if you are into these kind of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055829271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 5201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1563350323}
review: Woo Woo this game is intense.  If you play HOMM, you may enjoy this game.  Looks great, flows nice, a bit of a hardware hog, and sometimes timing is off.  Devs are still taking care of it and loving it nicely.  Updates often.  I have already banked a few hours and only dented the surface of the gameplay.  The story is fun and events are unpredictable.  It is immediately challenging.  The tutorial is brief and sets you on your way in the most loving way a game can HA.  Anyway, give it a go if you have much time to spare.  This game is not fast, nor is it repetitive.  Each providence is different and even your own subjects may revolt.  I would recommend printing out the manual and keeping it handy.  There is immense detail in this game.  Plan well!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095092190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 14367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12066, 'last_played': 1440449887}
review:
Soon to be 200h into the game. Can't say that the campaign is getting to the end basicaly because there are several endings. Each shard is different, and it's not only lands, but the world itself is different too (world of fear, rust, magic and many more), and I unlocked only half of the buildings available, so probably that is why every new shard i start, brings new challenges and tactics to try out. There are 4 hero classes to choose from, that can be mixed together and yet, eventually, you will have to use all of them. There is also karma system in game, so sometimes you will have to be good and sometimes, evil is the way to win. You can amass an army or you can just go with a hero and a few units - it's all up to you. You will struggle to maintain economy but it's good that battles will be the main source of your income, so you will have to pick the right fights, because loosing is crippling, but not necessary deadly. 

I really don't understand the mixed score - the game is dynamic, interesting and there is "one more turn" feeling in it. Furthermore, the developer is still updating the game and replying on forums, bringing some new features and reacting to the probelms (can be faster though, but can't complain). There are minor bugs, but have encountered them two or three times and they are not gamebreaking (skip a turn or finish the fight and the bug is gone). Has crashed once after a big fight, but fighting it again wasn't a big problem and i believe my PC is the one to blame here.

If you're into a classic turn-based strategy - it's definitely worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033038965', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1678574595}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036766038', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 8718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7690, 'last_played': 1439202171}
review: While I definitely can't recommend this to people who aren't already fans of it's genre and I can even see some veterans struggling to pick it up I'd still recommend it as a nicely crafted Tactical RPG for it's price. Don't go in expecting Civ V gameplay though because this is in an entirely different genre poorly represented by its tags.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007486006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1505, 'last_played': 1430671265}
review:
Recensione piuttosto difficile a dirla tutta... L'idea è brillante, e il gioco dà un po' dipendenza, rientra perfettamente nella famiglia dei Civilization da "ancora un turno e poi smetto e intanto sono le 4 di mattina". Allora perché non me la sento di consigliarlo a tutto tondo? Intanto, l'instabilità: i requisiti sono ragionevolmente bassi, eppure il gioco crasha periodicamente senza un motivo. Poi, la difficoltà altalenante: anche alle difficoltà basse, certe partite sembra che l'intero universo ti odi per principio, altre puoi conquistare un intero shard come se tagliassi burro. Detto questo, la A.I. imbroglia un sacco nella rigenerazione di eroi ed eserciti: qualcuno mi deve spiegare come fa a far risorgere 4 eroi e a riarruolare altrettanti eserciti completi in un turno quando possiede solo la capitale! Se io possedessi solo la capitale ci metterei 200 turni a far risorgere un eroe... Frustrazione al massimo. Infine, è un po' lento e ripetitivo: alla fine di uno shard, uno si affeziona ai propri eroi, ma ogni volta bisogna ricominciare tutto da capo, arruolare gli stessi eroi da livello zero, gli eserciti, esplorare per livellare, costruire edifici, e soprattutto all'inizio, quando si hanno poche scelte per arruolamenti e costruzioni, sembra veramente di fare sempre lo stesso percorso, anche se il mondo di gioco cambia ogni volta. Da questo punto di vista, la lunghezza del gioco è eterna! Dopo 5 shards e 20 ore ci si può rendere conto che praticamente si è appena fuori dal tutorial...
Detto questo, non lo sconsiglio nemmeno del tutto: il sistema di gestione alla Might and Magic, con un po' di Civilization e Warlock è estremamente interessante.
Lo consiglierei solo ad appassionati del genere, e possibilmente con un buono sconto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198140527673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1465914980}
review: Отличная игра, с хорошей графикой,музыкой и развитием сюжета, напоминает такие игры как Герои,Disciples и Age of Wonders,советую всем поиграть

author: {'steamid': '76561198000715584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 16427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12963, 'last_played': 1435748798}
review:
Just read some of the negative reviews, bit confusing. 200-300+ hours on game yet "can't recommend".  Fairly sure you've already recommended it, pal.

Anyway, I have no idea why this game is still being updated, it was released 2 years ago, but it's rather nice for them to STILL be releasing updates for it. 

Been playing the game for a while and it seems fine to me, few glitches here and there that I recall but given the state of development of even AAA games these days, the glitches were no more pronounced than "usual" so seemed balanced. I had no game breaking glitches, anyway.  Game is pretty, combat is fun, levelling heros feels rewarding, taking over shards is the way to make the game "progress" and world feel persistent without forcing a heavy handed corny storyline onto you that limits player options per scenario.  Delivering an interesting turn based strategy game that works within a non intrusive narrative is no easy task, but I think handled quite well in this case.

Oh, love the dialogue too. Nicely written, surprisingly so, actually. The majority of game dialogue is trash, and that's fine, most don't read game dialogue for the dazzling display of talent - but in this case I thought it was pretty decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019197650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 50836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37306, 'last_played': 1633293172}
review:
When thinking of this game I think of the difference between Chess people and Checkers people. While they both use the same board they are not the same game.

Eador is much like a Chess match that you have to build the army, before you play a match, while the player you are facing off against is doing the same task.

The AI can seem either too easy or too hard but this can be the players fault for rushing or taking too long so part of playing the game is understanding the timing of how things work.  

The best/worst features depending on your like/dislikes.

-Turn based so you can think before you act
-Auto save feature so you can try out differnt options rather than having to play many games. 
-Many settings to adust for how YOU the player want your game to go.
-Many units so you can adjust your army based on how you want to play.

edit- New feature the option to take heroes from one shard to the next, while costly with prior planing this can really help before you invade another enemy home shard!


There are the bugs that sometimes will crash a game but much less than say Skyrim or any other complex game.  No game breaking bugs that will prevent you from finishing the game and not often enough for me to kill the mood,  Say one crash per 20hrs of game play is about what I have.  Not been able to narrow down if they were the programs or mine since often they are not ones I can reproduce.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967021747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6243, 'last_played': 1440552325}
review:
Apperently the game is entirely or borderline broken on some systems. I played this a bunch when I first bought. Tried reinstalling on a PC a while later and there's no way I can get the game to run now. I have installed on several drives, form several compatibility modes, run all the suggested fixes from PCgamingwiki but to no avail.  
This is not an isolated case. Looking for fixes, I found post after post of users with similar issues and no working solutions.  

Shame. It's a great game, on level with HOMM3, I'd say, but I cannot recommend a game that has a risk of simply not working no matter what you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007190315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 10440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10229, 'last_played': 1433662891}
review:
I played a long time this game, but I cannot reccomend it.

Postitive:
- Pretty for a tactical game
- they have fixed most/all bugs
- lot of differents units with unique abilities 
- complexe tactical game

Negative:
- too oriented around the tactical combat (stratgic layer is interesting but most of your time will be spent doing combat)
- hard to learn as you need to know each unit as some unit are totally overporwered and can wipe a whole army if you have nothing to counter them (example ghost are pretty much invulnerable against everything and are killed in one specific spell)
- unit tier X are way more powerful than unit of the lower tier. It seems fun but if you combine with the fact you start from scratch each map, it makes the first hour a repetitive grind before your reach unit of tier 2
- bad evaluation of automatic combat (making risky to automate even a simple fight)

And the most regretaable that could be really improved by mod done by users, but the game cannot support mod...

author: {'steamid': '76561198104368561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 12924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12839, 'last_played': 1452955504}
review:
Mi ideal inical era esperar a terminar la campaña antes de escribir el analisis de Eador pero como es probable que envejezca antes de que eso pase voy a poner manos a la obra.

En primer lugar aclaro que Eador es un juego de estrategia por turnos al estilo Heroes of Might and Magic cuyo foco es al menos un 90% el combate. Digo esto porque lei varios reviews que lo describian como un 4X con lo cual asumo que o bien no saben lo que eso implica o no lo jugaron y arriesgaron un genero. Digo esto porque si su idea es comprar un juego donde haya un balance entre desarrollo de ciudades, expansion, arbol tecnologico y combate este NO es el juego, esto no es Civilization ni The Settlers.

Con respecto a la jugabilidad, al inicio seleccionamos un heroe de entre 4 clases disponibles (guerrero, arquero, mago y comandante) y vamos a encontrarnos con un fuerte inicial en el cual vamos a tener que ir comprando las mejoras. Cada mapa se divide en provincias y el heroe puede moverse de una a otra usando 1 accion por turno. LAs provincias estan defendidas por guardias a los que vamos a tener que derrotar para poder reclamarlas como propias y ampliar nuestro terriorio. Ademas, es posible (y necesario) explorar las provincias ya que las mismas contienen locaciones donde se puede ganar experiencia, dinero e items. Una diferencia importante con otros juegos del estilo es que aca las unidades suben de nivel a medida que ganan experiencia con lo cual pueden mejorarse sus atributos o bien aprender nuevas skills. Por lo  tanto es de fundamental importancia evitar que las mismas mueran. 

En cuanto al corazon de la bestia, es decir , el combate, el mismo es muy similar a otros exponentes del genero con la particularidad de que el terreno tiene una participacion crucial. Cada unidad tiene puntos de movimiento y mientras cruzar un terreno llano consume 1 punto , atravesar un pantano o colina requiere 2. Al mismo tiempo , el terreno afecta las estadisticas de las unidades. De esta forma, una unidad cubierta en un bosque gana defensa de rango.

Dicho todo esto Eador no es para nada un juego facil y si bien es sumamante recomendable para fanaticos del genero no lo es tanto para quienes recien se incian. Por otro lado, hay decisiones de diseño que son realmente dificiles de justificar y me imagino que es lo que hace que este juego tenga tantos votos negativos. El problema al que me refiero es que es realmente dificl reclutar unidades las unidades de mas alto rango (3 y sobre todo 4) ya que los recursos que demandan por lo general requieren de partidas muy largas y para el momento que el jugador tiene acceso a ellos ya no los necesita.

Sin embargo, creo que si bien es un problema importante de ninguna forma opaca todo lo que si hace bien y a los seguidores mas acerrimos del genero no puedo sino recomendarles que le de una oportunidad porque es realmente adictivo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007072032', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7953, 'last_played': 1625186820}
review:
Eador(Genesis) is one of those few games where you don't get a nasty feeling that some gameplay mechanic, content or feature is really missing. In fact, it is surprisingly rich in every aspect. Developers were clearly aimed to make a game that they would like to play themselves.

Masters of the Broken World is basically the same game, with modern graphics and effects.

I, personally, liked "Eador: Masters of the Broken World" a lot, and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys games like HoMM, Civilization or Age of Wonders.

"+":
-Neat hero mechanics
-Lots of units
-Tactical variability

"-":
-Mediocre visuals
-Few bugs (major ones were fixed rather quickly after release; rare game crashes are still there though)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971640510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 18336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14278, 'last_played': 1427254002}
review:
I'd really like to recommend this game, but I can't, really.

It's just so good in its basic premise, and the execution is not half bad either, but some bad design and balance decisions make it a sad game to play. After a while you understand just how badly the AI cheats, how only one character class is truly good (warrior, solo all enemies, all armies), and the crash bugs finally get to you..

In short, I probably wouldn't get this unless the game balance is addressed. 
If you got a fun and balanced game, even crash bugs don't bother you because you just reboot it and continue. A bad game, even if technically perfect, you just won't want to play at all

author: {'steamid': '76561197993567513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1506800924}
review:
Strategy game that uses the Heroes of Might & Magic battle system and a tile-based overworld. You only have one city (your base/capital) as your major base of operations but you can upgrade captured tiles with minor improvements/defenses. There are four tiers of buildings/units (and buildings in higher tiers require you to construct buildings of lower tiers). In the campaign you unlock buildings slowly so it's nice for learning the system: you start with limited options, figure out what's necessary to build, then add in more options and change your build as necessary.

I've been playing in the easiest modes and it feels like playing Civ V on easier modes. I can be pretty flexible in my build order (since it takes a while for enemies to attack and upgrade tiers) and just safely build up my hero and steamroll into their capital. As a warning, games can take a long time (like in civ) so when I build up enough of an advantage, I quick-resolve battles (after taking out any key units from range) and head straight to the enemies' capitals (without capturing every single enemy tile).

On harder difficulties, I think it'd be more like immortal/deity civ where you need a victory plan: you should know build order (what buildings you need and can skip), what tiles you take (not every tile is worth wasting time on), and trying to balance upgrading unit tiers and spending money on economy-boosting buildings.

There are some changes I would've liked:
* Before battle, I would have liked to be able to click on the name of the enemy unit to bring up a civilopedia-style entry about the unit (Sometimes I forget what units are in each tier and the strength gap between tiers is pretty high). 
* When you're offered item rewards, I would've liked to be able to check hero inventory (to see if I already have that item). 
* In battle, you can use the hotkey 1 to use a selected unit's ability. However, that pretty much only works if your mouse is hovered over it (so it doesn't work if you had selected it previously and moved your mouse away over another unit).
* In battle, sometimes units that are brought to 0 hp don't die and are untargettable. If this happens to your own units, you can heal them up to 'revive' them so they aren't lost at the end of the battle. If it happens to an enemy unit, when you're ready you'll have to use 'quick combat' to end the battle (it'll count it as dead).
* I play on windowed borderless and sometimes there are game crashes (access exceptions, pointer errors) and the game doesn't really like alt-tabbing.

If you liked the HoMM series and turn-based strategy games, you should try your hand at Eador. If you're a fan of strategy games, you should take a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037834509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 8328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8082, 'last_played': 1432677632}
review: The basic game play in Eador is fine and enjoyable.  I like the character classes, items, building options, etc.,  but the game becomes too repetitive.  Each level you have to start over and do basically the same thing again and again.  And those basic functions like clearing land are too slow and become a grind.  With a few tweaks to speed up game play I would have recommended the game, but as is it is just not quite there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038529509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 15518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14709, 'last_played': 1402516416}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966287779', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1431896271}
review:
It's just extremely extremely extremely repetitive. For every new shard, play with a brand new hero. Build the exact same buildings and units over. Fight the same battles in the same way over.

Part of the problem is that it's not balanced. Certain units are just SO superior to others, and the difficulty can be punishing, which has you using those same units and fighting in the same way over and over.

Basically, once you've won one shard, you've won them all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110272725', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1525222416}
review:
:ALERT: Strategy Gamers Take Notice

I had 20 dollars. So I bought a steam card.
After hours of browsing and finding nothing to my liking, and developing several different
'steam search' methods of 'titles like this' on a strategy game I came upon this game.

Eador. Don't believe I had ever heard of it before.
But I sounded right.
It sounded tight.
So I bought it. spent some times with it
(after coming off a 4 hour civ v binge) 
and I must say!

This game is glorious!
It is totally real.
It is the type of game I was looking for, more so, the type of game I used to play as a kid
but grew up and couldn't find exact anymore. -Its got might and magic.
Its got Civilization,
its got tactical combat where you have effective control over the units
Its got gear to upgrade your heroes...

You know, I love Endless Legend, but after playing Eador, I find myself a little bit
in the stink about that game, not that its not great, it is!
But Eador is a wonderful game, with intelligent design that appeals.

I have never written a review on Steam before.
and this game made me want to.

I like the story, and the setting as it sets up the world for
more playing , -and that's what this is all about, isn't it?
Shattered Worlds across space is a theme very similar to my own
personal fantasy omniverse.

Maybe you're all getting pretty deflated by now, but
I guess it goes without

author: {'steamid': '76561198041432553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1463026661}
review:
This game is one of those "thorny rose" games.
I recommend it to players who enjoy learning complex game systems, or players who can look pass some buggy flaws and still enjoy the final product. (I've learned I can look past very crappy games if their mechanics are deep and complex enough)

If you are not the type of player that likes to hover over tooltips and read every single detail. You probably won't like this game.

review:
Игра отличная, очень нравится, слежу за её развитием уже 2 года. 
Правда толком не получается продвинуться дальше пары островов. Ну да ладно...

У меня возникла проблема, может поможете её разрешить?
Хотел приобрести через СМС дополнение, без него играть как то не охота...
Зашел на экран оплаты, ввёл свой номер телефона, получил смс.

Так как стим показывает что уже приобретено дополнение, но оно не оплачено и не устанавливается. 

Что то это меня это совсем опечалило, даже просто играть не охота. (( 
Хотя игра что надо. Бодрая.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041020327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 7839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7186, 'last_played': 1432371290}
review:
I honestly couldnt decide if I should recommend this or not. Eador is a game with a very interesting playstyle, that has some serious problems preventing it from being great. I decided to recommend it because, despite its flaws, I am pushing a three digit playtime and still enjoying it.

Eador looks like a 4X game, but I would argue that it is not. Your real focus here is on advancing your heroes. EVERYTHING COMES DOWN TO YOUR HEROES. You advance your heroes by clearing dungeons located in your provinces, which you locate with a "province exploration" mechanic, that is essential to advancing your economy. You will make far more money clearing these dungeons than you will with your economy, and the latter is really only there to support a few garrisons and pay for your leaders upkeep, which rises steadily.

You explore your provinces to find dungeons for your heroes. You expand your empire to get more provinces, so that you can find more dungeons for your heroes. You expand your economy to support bigger armies for your heroes. You upgrade your castle so that you can get bigger bonuses for your heroes. All of your tech advances are aimed at getting better spells, and better units, and better equipment... for your heroes. The goal of this game is to be the first the get a hero to level 30 and max out its arsenal, at which point it becomes more powerful than everything else in the game except for another maxed out hero. Once you do this, you march to the enemies castles, and start taking them out.

I have enjoyed this game a lot, because there are very few others quite like it, and the constant leveling is emotionally satisfying in an odd way. But, there are some real flaws. You cannot see far outside of your borders, and you cannot explore any areas you do not own, so the world feels vey small and lonely. You only ever meet your rivals when your borders physically touch, and even then you have no clear way to guage their strength. The world map will remain mostly hidden by the fog of war until you have conquered it, and even then there is no point in seeing everything. Just get to 30, find the keeps, and take them down.

The first few turns are nearly impossible to get right until you have really gotten the hang of things. This game snowballs INTENSLY... messing up on turn 5 basically means that you have lost the game, but it will take you 300 turns to find that out. Eador forces you to save scum. There is no scaling of starting zones to lvl 1 armies, and the RMG can place you in a beginning position where none of your surrounding zones are capturable. Depending on your difficulty settings, the first 40 turns or so could be the hardest of the entire game, as you struggle for even the least of progress.

Matches take so long (even the smallest of maps take 15 hours sometimes), that you cannot afford to simply play it by ear, you have to commit to a match for awhile. The largest sized maps can take a week to complete, if you really want to clear everything. The campaign is a joke. I spent the first 80 hours of my playtime on it, and I only barely got to the point where I could start to unlock t2 buildings. Basically, each campaign match unlocks (or permanantly locks) a single building and maybe a unit too, and gives you some small boost to your starting set-up. Given how long matches take, I could only assume an estimated 500 hour playtime for the whole thing, as there are hundreds of buildings in total. Either that or it ends way before you get everything.

Pick it up if you like heavy RPG elements, that seems like what this game is focused on. But, dont expect a true 4X experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032297836', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2206, 'last_played': 1497796855}
review:
Un 4X a ambientazione Fantasy molto interessante.Un gameplay a metà tra un Civilization e un Endless Legend, con la possibilità di poter controllare durante le battaglie l'esercito (battaglire rigorosamente a turni). Grande Varietà di difficoltà delle quest. La campagna è molto interessante con la possibilità di impersonare una "Master" e di "creare" il Nosto mondo  nell'universo di Eador. Inoltre l'uso deglie Eroi come capi dell'esercito e il loro sviluppo come se fosse un GDR è la ciliegina sulla torta.
Pro:
++++ Sviluppo degli eroi come "gdr" molto interessante 
+++ Gestione dell'esercito durante le battaglie
++   Grande Varietà di Quest 
+     Grande Varieta di equipaggiamento per l'Eroe
Contro
--- L'IA nelle difficoltà medio-alte potrebbe essere molto avvantagiata rispetto al giocatore nella conquista dei territori
--  Ci si potrebbe ritrovare delusi nell'aspettarsi la possibilità di viaggiare nello "shard" senza incorrere in combattimenti
-    Quasi inutile la diplomazia nelle partite con pochi avversari

author: {'steamid': '76561198055311780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 4034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3912, 'last_played': 1432443697}
review:
Eador is a game I have put off reviewing for quite some time and sitting down to play it I can remember why.
Difficult to learn, difficult to master, best sum up Eador.
If you are familiar with Heroes of Might and Magic then Eador is a familiar beast and just like those games you control a single hero who in turn controls an army. You are not limited to just one hero however and as long as you have the resources your army can be as big as you like. 

I am going to assume however that you are unfamiliar with HoM&M and even if you are, Eador is a different beast altogether. It's main gimmick is shards, that is each map is its own contained world so when you conquer one shard you move onto the next.
The game also features an ambigious moral choice system and certain units do or do not like being teamed up with others. Holy Paladins for example are not pleased by having to work with blood sucking vampires and such combinations will affect morale. Let morale get too low and units will flee the battlefield.

Already you can see a lot of systems are in play in this game and it isn't a bad game either. Complex doesn't have to mean 'bad' or 'begineer-unfriendly' but many things are randomized. You might get a start location with nearby provinces you have little chance of taking over and no resources to bribe them with. A province by the way is akin to a second city or to extending your domain so basically you want them if you can get them.

I really could go on and on about every little system but a game stands or falls on one thing. Is it fun? For me Eador is middle ground. It is [i]not[/i] a bad game at all and if you like games such as Civilization 5 or Endless Legend you will find yourself slowly adapting to Eador but for me I grew up on Heroes of Might & Magic so I want to love Eador and instead I find myself being [b]SUPER ANNOYED[/b] at the game lying to me so much!

3 Medusas? Yeah it'll be fine, we'll slaughter them. Lied the game shortly before I reloaded my last save.
6 Peasants? We stand no chance! Lied the game again and I wiped them out with no issues.

Lying is a harsh word but that is certainly what it feels like at times. The game will tell you that wizards can attack at range, but forgets to tell you that they need a wand to do so. A wizard is a hired hero and hiring is expensive so if your wizard doesn't come with a wand, your hosed. You have to spend more money to build a shop that sells wands. 
The game will tell you that a unit has a certain range like 3 or 4 but you get into a fight and it [i]forgets[/i] to mention all the modifiers that effect the range like trees or hills.
And this is the begineer difficulty, with tutorials turned on! 

As you get better at the game you learn to ignore the lies as you have a good idea of what kills what and who to fight or who to avoid but I can't help but feel like Eador sabotaged itself. This game should be as big as the remade Kings Bounty games with over a million copies shifted or something I mean this game is good enough to be a Civ5 contender, but due to the steep learning curve I imagine many people are just turned off and stop playing, I know I did.

Music is more of background noise, I honestly mentally tuned it out. Sound effects are funny, spiders sounds like jewels falling down an escalator but as I always say about sound effects, they are not the biggest factor. Graphics? Game looks wonderful! Really, the art is great it really is and their is so much of it you won't take it all in until after a few hours of playing.

Overall Eador is a niche game for a niche market and that is a huge shame. I stand by what I said when I said this game should be up there as a contender for Civ5 but as it stands many will have looked Eador over for Endless Legend and I personally think Eador is the better game but its amazing the difference some handholding and a tutorial can do.
The game does have a manual but I think that should be within the game itself like Civ5's civilpedia. 

I can't recommend this game to the majority of people but if you read this far then you will have a good idea if this is the kind of game for you or not, for most people they will struggle to get into this game and when they do the small playerbase will struggle to keep them.

Join Grumpy reviews for all your gaming needs
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/grumpyreviews

review: Отличная стратегия! До нее я поиграл в "Эадор Сотворение". Без сомнений, графика в "Эадор. Владыки миров" лучше, и это главный плюс. Также можно увидеть новых воинов и новые заклинания. Что по поводу кампании, так она осталась такой же. Обучение вообще не поменяли. В целом у меня впечатление хорошее. Игра должна понравится тем, кто любит "Героев".  Кстати, она чем - то похожа на "king's bounty" и еще некоторые стратегии.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022821134', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1662198054}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken World... What has it brought to us? A fine picture, a new DLC (which you will rarely use to your advantage) and a damn lot of bugs! 
First of all, the game is not optimized at all! Its graphics are not so great, because it's just a turn-based strategy, but is uses more resources than Skyrim until it just refuses to work. Relaunching the game may help, but I want to play, not launch it over and over again. But that's not all. Tons of bugs still occur after so many updates. Devs, are you sure you fix them? I don't see it. Just two days ago, it crashed, when I attempted to conquer a new shard and no matter how many times I reloaded the game and the save file, it was crashing in the same place. Do I have to begin it from the very beginning after so many hours of playing to get the same error again someday?! Oh, come on...
New DLC... Yeah, it's fun sometimes, but that's not what I expected. It could have been much better! You just have some new units for the creatures you can make an alliance with, but if you have a troll or a minotaur, then you won't use them at all, because they are too week. And completing some tasks becomes more difficult, because, if you need to kill 10 dwarves, you'll have to kill 100 dwarves and that's not funny at all. 
Tastes differ, I know, but I liked the Eador: Genesis's interface more. It looked better and worked better. It was more convenient. 
Another thing that I did not like at all! The game has become easier! A damn lot easier compared to Eador: Genesis. When you attempt to conquer a shard, you've got 3-4 new buildings to acquire... When you finally conquer a shard, you get 7-8 new buildings! And how am I supposed to call that bonus? Yeah, a piece of s**t! It just ruins all the fun! You don't have to plan ahead, you don't have to choose wisely which shard you should conquer next. And in the end (if you get to it, because it can crash anytime, as I mentioned above) you have to (yes, you HAVE to) conquer EMPTY shards! And you know what? It pisses me off to waste time like that! 
The result: yes, Eador: Genesis is older, it doesn't have that pretty though useless DLC, it's not 3D, it doesn't have these pretty (also quite useless though) achievements in Steam, but it works well and it's more challenging, and that is why I'll choose that old beauty instead of this new piece of garbage! So, as you have already guessed, I do NOT recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048311845', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1494174204}

author: {'steamid': '76561198121720355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1430085242}
review:
Годная пошаговая стратегия в стиле серии HoMaM, Desciples, Kings Bounty. 

Мысли по поводу геймплея:
   Интересная задумка глобальной карты, каждая ячейка которой - целая локация со своими данжами и микроэкономикой. Такой подход в разы углубляет геймплей, а в сочетании с размеренностью боя [искренне не понимаю, почему бы анимацию перемещения юнитов не сделать более динамичной] - делает игру затянутой даже по меркам 4Х. Хотя многим это только понравится.
   Также забавляет система кармы и частых ивентов в провинциях. Очень часто необходимо принимать решения, которые аукнутся в будущем.
   Про гремлина тоже говорят абсолютно справедливо: очень забавные диалоги, положительно сказывающиеся на атмосфере игры.

О багах:
   "Забагованности" на данный момент бояться не стоит - лично у меня было пару вылетов, но с учётом автосэйвов я их даже не почувствовал. Каких-то других ошибок за своё непродолжительное игровое время не увидел.

О графике:
   Графика... Своеобразная) Наверное, адекватно сравнить её с четвёртыми героями. Играйте на "максималках", тогда быстро втянетесь и даже сможете почувствовать в ней определённую прелесть.

Вывод:
   Если вам нравятся игры такого жанра, покупайте - скорее всего останетесь очень довольны.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073545504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 18576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11383, 'last_played': 1523742603}
review:
Отличная игра с хорошим балансом стратегии, тактики, развития, микрименеджмента и РПГ. Да и в общем с самим балансом тут всё прекрасно! 
Сложность игры достаточно вариативная. Стоит отметить, что на равных условиях с компьютерным оппонентом игрок играет не на "нормальном" уровне сложности, а на "экспертном". Для новичков это задача не лёгкая, так что перед прохождением рекомендую почитать мануал, а ещё лучше посетить сам Эадорский форум.

Эадор, наверное, чемпион по продолжительности игры среди офлайн-проектов :) Самую большую карту в свободной игре можно проходить часов 30. Что уж говорить о кампании, в которой этих карт море)) Я сам порой устаю и бросаю эту игру, а как отдохну, снова к ней тянет. Кампанию до сих пор так и не прошел, но ничего - всё ещё впереди, я ведь пока всего лишь каких-то жалких 180 часов отыграл)) 

Гейм-плей структуризирован:

1) Миры-осколки.
2) Глобальная карта каждого мира разделена на провинции-гексы.
3) Каждую провинцию можно застраивать и исследовать, находя полезные и вредные объекты, которые можно завоевать/разрушить или взаимодействовать с ними иначе.
4) Поле боя, на котором происходят бои за что-либо в провинции и зависит оно как от провинции, так и от условий боя.

Дипломатия в игре достаточно развита. Можно даже заключить альянс с какими-нибудь нейтралами, что даст вам новых воинов, новые постройки. Так же другие нейтральные провинции, населённые рассой из альянса, будут присоединяться к вашей империи без боя, что порой очень важно.
Самые крутые шмотки для ваших героев и самые крутые войска покупаются не в ваших городах, а добываются исключительно в боях с опасными тварями.
В мире не редко происходят случайные события, требующие от вас решения, как от главы правления. Зависят от вашей кармы, бывают как крайне полезные, так и очень не приятные или не к месту. Рекомендую всегда держать в казне запас хотя бы 300-500 золотых на этот случай. 

На этом всё, рекомендую! Приятной игры и передавайте от меня привет Зарру! ;)

review: This game is amazing!!! All of the poor reviews prior to this one must have been for buggy gameplay before patches because I would easily give this game a 9/10 in this current version. It starts off simple, but quickly moves to a game where building and unit choices really matter. The concepts that are mixed in give for an incredibly satisfying and enjoyable experience. If you like 4x games and turn based tile combat, get this game! This is coming from someone who has been buying random rpg type games for a couple years now and gets bored of most very easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041223084', 'num_games_owned': 1131, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1545997959}
review:
Schön komplex, doch auf Dauer sehr Nervig und Zeitaufwändig!

Als Fan von Strategiespiele wie Total War oder Crusade Kings schräcke ich nicht grundsätzlich davor zurück mich in komplexe Spiele einzuarbeiten. Und genau das ist Eador: Master of the Broken World!

Schon beim ersten lvl steigt der Frustfaktor deutlich hoch, den die Spielmechanik ist sehr kompliziert und man muss für jeden Kampf seine eigene Strategie festlegen.
Es ist ein Rundebasierendes Spiel. Man stellt sein Held und Soldaten auf den Felder auf und kämpft so gar gegen übermächtige Gegner die nicht auf anhieb leicht zu besiegen sind.
Es gibt leider kein schwierigkeitsgrad im Spiel so das man das Spiel auf Schwer durchspielen muss.

Das System ist sehr unbalanciert, einige Items die man nach der Zeit freischaltet sind sehr Kostspielig und sie sind zu 99% nicht sehr offt zu gebrauchen. Das beste am den Spiel ist das man sich sein eigenes Reich aufbauen kann und die Geschichte hat sehr gute Tiefen, das jedoch erfordert sehr viel geduld und Zeit.

Wen man bei einem Level scheitert muss man es komplett von vorne beginnen, den nämlich gibt es keinen Autosave oder Quicksave integrität!

Pro: 

+: Umfangreiches Arsenal.
+:  Erkundung und erschaffung seines eigenen Reiches.
+: Spielmechanik und Steurung (einige teile der Mechanik).

Kontra:

- Geschichterzählung sehr Linear und träge im aufbau.
- Handlungen manchmal sehr verstädnislos und anhang.
- Trotz Teutorial ist der einstieg sehr erswchwert.

Schlußwort; 

Um ein wenig abwechslung zu bekommen von zb. wie: HOMM oder Age of Wonders, kann man sich ein wenig die Zeit vertreiben, mehr sollte man nicht in diesen Spiel investieren......

author: {'steamid': '76561198114603867', 'num_games_owned': 1299, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 6427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1570357329}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076093112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1373945070}
review:
Как очень тонко подмечено в названии - в этой реализации Эадора мир игры умудрились полностью разрушить. Как разработчики смогли так испоганить игру - для меня загадка. Просто эталон ужасной реализация отличной идеи!
Разработчики сделали все возможное, чтобы сделать на порядок хуже то, что должны были улучшить в ванильнм Эадоре.

Ванильный Эадор, несмотря на отсутствие "современной" графики смотрится на порядок лучше.
Ванильный Эадор, с установленным модом "Новые горизонты" в тысячу раз играбельней.
В ванильный Эадор с его интуитивным интерфейсом, хочется играть снова и снова.

Вывод: Хотите получить удовольствие от игры - играйте в Эадор, а это поделие отправьте в корзину.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063409400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1499727226}
review: Я не знаю что это за игра. Ни в какие серии не играл. Но было скучно и думали с братом во чтобы поиграть. Благо в стиме теперь игры можно искать по классификации: русские. Выбрал русский язык и РПГ. Несколько вариантов предложило. Прочел описание игры - заинтриговало, даже скида 85%! Купил сразу себе и брату подарил. Но ни у него ни у меня на компах игра не запустилась. Щас буду пробовать в тех. поддержку писать. Прочел руководство пользователя - было приятно и понятно читать. Так что я надеюсь у меня игра заработает и я наслажусь этим творением! Но пока что "не рекомендую", т.к. ну не заработала она просто.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013132245', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 17896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13315, 'last_played': 1693619711}
review:
tldr:

Fun?  3/5

Work?  6/5  The enjoyability of this game is crippled.

Deep?  5/5

Compelling?  4/5

Pace?  Dog slow out of what it could be.  2/5

Good intro to TBS?  1/5

This game's learning curve is poorly designed and might turn off many beginners to the genre permanently.  A lot of the game is figuring out "this map is unplayable - I have to re-roll" or "this _campaign_ is unplayable - I have to re-roll."  Occasionally a really fun map does show up.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

My main complaint with this game is the random map generator.  Some maps seem to be fine, but others are practically unplayable.  Or they are barely playable in the openning game only to find out later that you were destined to be steamrolled by the opponent.

The game makes no effort to generate "fair" maps from what I can tell.

My second complaint is that the campaign suffers from the same problem, since it also uses random maps.  That's right - a campaign with randomly generated maps.  Which means a normal distribution of players will see some players able to beat the campaign on the hardest setting, while others won't be able to beat it on even very easy settings.

Sound stupid?  Well, whatever you want to call it, it still needs work.  Maybe it's similar to how Civ II would sometimes just be a bad map roll - but it is tedious to spend time learning the player skill "oh this map is crappy - now I have to start over".


Of course - it's REALLY TRICKY.  The game can offer a feeling of tension, of not knowing "how far behind am I?" and "am I wasting my time on this game?"  So maybe that's the largest enjoyment it has to offer - that feeling "do I have any hope of winning whatsoever?" before being plunged mercilessly to your death.  Ha!

The weakness seems to be a complete lack of balance between map economy and unit maintenance costs.  Don't believe me?  Try finding screenshots that show armies with high level units.  They are rare.  Which tells me the player base just never finds gameplay involving high levels.  By the time you could afford the big guns, the map has already been used up.  That's my guess anyways.

Lastly, progress is excruciatingly slow, both in the campaigns, but also on a single map.  It will take forever to see characters level up, and I think this design is probably intentional, but really misses the boat on making hitting the sweet spot on playability and fun.  After a while it really feels like a grind.  At least the Civ games had a pace slider, and that would help this game a lot.

------

As long as you clearly understand these shortcomings, I still recommend the game for its unique tactical layout and game mechanics. My first impression of the game has not been overwhelmed by the short-comings I only figured out after playing many many hours.

 Don't like tactics?  THIS GAME IS NOT FOR YOU THEN.  [Edit: Well... maybe... if you want to play on lower difficulties then sure - you really can skip most of the battles, but not all.]  The core mechanic of the game is the tactical map - sort of these mini-chess games that pop up over and over again.  I get tired of them after a while, and they can become rather complex.  It's not as deep as chess -- nowhere close -- but it's a similar mental workout.

I guess the only thing to remember if you decide to buy this game: "play it looking for the fun that it has to offer."  It's in there.



~~~~~~ Here is my response to someone asking how Eador compares to Warlock ~~~~~~

      Warlock is a good beginner 4x. It's relatively lightweight, it has a sense of humor, the 
      graphics are good. But the content is not huge. I played many many Warlock games 
      even when it first came out and I'd skip 20 turns because the AI back then was crappy. 
      But they've improved the AI. In Warlock you'll expand your kingdom until you've moved 
      far enough in your religious rating that one of the gods gets angry and incarnates to 
      battle you. Then it's that boss battle and the game is over IIRC. Battles are ALL on the 
      main map - there is no tactical battle map like in Eador. An average game in Warlock 
      is maybe 300 turns or less, and they go by fast. Probably less than 2 days for a game. 
      I'll probably play Warlock again in a couple years or so - but it's not as good as say 
      Civ5. Warlock does "just one more turn" very very well.

      In comparison, Eador stands out in that the RPG element is the heaviest I've seen in 
      any 4x. I have finished a few low difficulty games, which wasn't very satisfying. But 
      moving into "competent" difficulty and it gets frustratingly difficult. Lots of luck is 
      involved and restarting games is common (and again, frustrating). But there's a sense 
      that (or I have this sense anyways) that the tactical options are mind-blowing what 
      can be available at higher levels. If you can figure out how to play...

      The economy in Eador is extremely volatile. Nothing comfortable like other 4x where 
      you build your buildings and everybody is happy. Even Civ5 which is a great play 
      experience doesn't offer this sort of challenge. So in Eador it's like the house is 
      continually burning down and you're always just one or 2 steps in front of the fire. 
      That's the feeling I get playing it.

      Whether a beginner should try Eador.... my advice -- don't take the campaign at 
      all seriously because it uses randomly generated maps meaning you may get 
      screwed. Learn the basics and (what I should have done, but I doubt it would help 
      too much) read whatever guides you can find, and watch the youtube videos.

      Also, the tactical battles in Eador are very similar to the experience of playing chess. 
      Some other 4x TRY to do that (hello Fallen Enchantress) but they don't have stamina 
      or morale and simplistic in comparison.

      Eador also stands out from all other 4x in that it has no tech tree. Instead, the tech 
      tree is implicit in the buildings you build. I can't remember, maybe Heroes of Might 
      and Magic does this too, but no where near the complexity of Eador.

      I think "should I buy this?" is really a question of do you want one of the most complex 
      4x TBS available, with a brutal learning curve, or do you want something easier that 
      you might not play for as long? If you find it's too difficult and just give up - that's no 
      good. So if you do buy it, don't hesitate to ask in the forums for help and get the 
      most fun you can get out of it."

author: {'steamid': '76561198053748477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 170728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70247, 'last_played': 1678490940}
review:
Highly recommended!
I play a lot of 4x games. But I find myself replaying Eador more than just about any other game I played. Finishing the campaign takes really a huge effort (estimate 600 hours). And after, I immediately started playing a new one.
When making comparisons, Heroes of might & magic comes to mind. But me, I like this game better.

+ The game has personality: a lot of random events - tied to the personality (karma) of the master you play - and really adding flavour and also the opportunity to develop that personality further. Also pretty funny.
+ Challenging: rather difficult. Different scenario's take a different approach. Also, the technologies you develop add to that. On normal difficulty an experienced player might need several tries to conquer a world.
+ Strategic: resources are scarce. Investments in your lands take a long time to pay off (10-30 turns) and are nicely balanced to investing in units.
+ When comparing to Heroes of M&M: the units, spells and choices to make are just more interesting.
+ Lots of replay value: because of the above.

- Mixed feelings about the Allied forces DLC. I think it distorts the balance in the game. Because of that it is even more difficult.

+- The game did have a lot of bugs. But most are fixed and it is stable now. Nothing gamebreaking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 11997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3601, 'last_played': 1681150295}
review:
Eador: Master of the Broken World wcale nie jest nowym tytułem – w rzeczywistości to unowocześniona wersja rosyjskiej gry Eador: Genesis, którą w 2010 roku stworzył Alexander Bokulew (poza Rosją mało kto o niej słyszał, ponieważ dopiero w zeszłym roku została przetłumaczona na język angielski). Snowbird Game Studios w bardzo niewielkim stopniu zmieniło założenia oryginału – w zasadzie jedyną zauważalną różnicę stanowi oprawa graficzna. Pozostały nawet te same ikonki umiejętności i statystyki większości jednostek – wszystko jest identyczne. 

Na dryfujących wśród gwiazd ruinach zniszczonego Eador ścierają się podobni bogom Mistrzowie. Wszyscy pragną odbudować rozbitą przez Kataklizm planetę; każdy ma jednak własną wizję tego, jak powinien wyglądać nowy świat. Ostateczna decyzja należeć będzie do tego, który zgromadzi najwięcej mocy.

Eador to strategia turowa osadzona w dość klasycznym, choć rozerwanym na strzępy świecie fantasy. Znajdziemy w niej wszystko, co wyznacza standardy gatunku - klasyczne rasy, takie jak krasnoludy, elfy czy gobliny, magię i bitwy o kontrolę nad prowincjami. Celem gracza nie jest, co prawda, zabicie smoka i zdobycie księżniczki, ale zbytnio się od tego założenia nie oddalamy.

W kampanii wcielamy się jednego z tytułowych Mistrzów, którzy próbują skleić w całość zniszczony świat. Pozostali są naszymi przeciwnikami podczas podbojów poszczególnych odłamków Eador i partnerami do rozmów, kiedy dryfujemy w kosmicznej przestrzeni pomiędzy inwazjami. Każdy z nich mieści się w jakimś stereotypie, jak na przykład „dobry czarodziej" lub „żądny władzy tyran", i zbytnio od tego stereotypu nie odbiega. Sprawia to, że dyskusje z Mistrzami nie są zbyt interesujące.
Kluczowym elementem odróżniającym kampanię od pojedynczych potyczek są dostępne w twierdzy budynki - w pojedynczych scenariuszach mamy od początku dostęp do niemal wszystkich zabudowań. W kampanii każdy podbity odłamek zawiera kilka nowych budynków i generuje pewną ilość energii, dzięki której przed atakiem na kolejny możemy wykupić kilka bonusów początkowych.

W pojedynczych scenariuszach przenosimy się na powierzchnię jednego z fragmentów rozbitego świata, na którym kilku lub nawet kilkunastu innych, podobnych nam władców, walczy o dominację nad, no cóż, dryfującym w kosmosie fragmentem skorupy planety. Aby wyeliminować przeciwnika musimy zdobyć jego twierdzę, do której docieramy przedzierając się przez dziesiątki kontrolowanych przez neutralne siły prowincji.

Każdy z obszarów możemy podbić siłą. Niektóre, znajdujące się w rękach przedsiębiorczych ras, takich jak nomadzi czy wolni ludzie, możemy wykupić. Jeszcze inne oczekują od nas pomocy w walce z bandytami, ogrami czy plującymi trucizną ślimakami. Co ciekawe, nękające naszych przyszłych poddanych potwory często znajdują się na drugim końcu kontynentu... odłamka, jednak najwyraźniej nikomu to nie przeszkadza.
Nie mogło też zabraknąć herosów - potężnych jednostek, których największym talentem jest przeprowadzanie armii z prowincji do prowincji. Bez ich pomocy, biedni żołdacy nie są w stanie zrobić nawet pół kroku. Co ważne, pod kontrolą bohatera znajdują się pojedynczy żołnierze, a nie wielkie armie - w najlepszym przypadku na pole bitwy nasz generał zabierze ze sobą piętnaście jednostek.

Bohaterowie posiadają też kilka innych umiejętności, takich jak rzucanie zaklęć, zadawanie sporych obrażeń wrogim oddziałom, czy zwiększanie skuteczności swoich podkomendnych, jednak to ruch i umiejętność eksploracji pozostają ich najbardziej kluczowymi talentami.

Okazji do eksploracji jest całkiem sporo. Początkowo, każdy z bohaterów może prowadzić jedynie stosunkowo niewielki oddział, a jego zdolności bojowe nie robią na nikim wrażenia. Musi więc znaleźć kilku słabych przeciwników, którzy pozwolą mu zdobyć doświadczenie. Sąsiadujące z naszą twierdzą prowincje nie zawsze posiadają dostatecznie słaby garnizon, jednak każda z prowincji pozostaje w pewnym, zazwyczaj dość znaczącym stopniu nieodkryta, a na nieznanych obszarach kryją się legowiska potworów i całe stosy skarbów.

Badanie prowincji przynosi także jeszcze jedną korzyść - w miarę rozwoju królestwa w każdej z jego dzielnic przybywa poddanych, którzy nie chcą osiedlać się na niezbadanych i potencjalnie niebezpiecznych obszarach. W związku z tym, co pewien czas każdą z dzielnic musi odwiedzić bohater, który zadba o znalezienie jeszcze kilku przytulnych zakątków, w których osiedlą się przyjaźni jaszczuroludzie zamieszkujący prowincję.

Eksploracja, podobnie jak ruch między prowincjami, przebiega dość powoli, co powoduje, że na dotarcie do twierdzy przeciwnika potrzebujemy zazwyczaj dziesiątek tur. Czasem - setek. Aby czas ten nie dłużył nam się zbytnio, twórcy przygotowali masę wydarzeń losowych, gwarantujących, że nasze królestwo ani przez chwilę nie będzie ciche i spokojne.

Czasem zdarza się, że kilku chłopom nie podobają się nasze rządy, więc spotykają się w świeżo wybudowanej w prowincji karczmie (myślę, że całkiem łatwo się domyślić, kto opłacił budowę tego przybytku), by pomarudzić. Możemy zdecydować, co zrobimy z siejącymi defetyzm wieśniakami - możemy ich powiesić, zignorować lub spalić knajpę, w której siedzą.

Innym razem nasz dwór odwiedzi grupa archeologów, chętnych do zbadania Starożytnych Ruin, których, jak przystało na świat fantasy, jest w naszym królestwie więcej niż samych obywateli. Zgodnie z konwencją, w ruinach mogą czaić się potwory, jednak równie dobrze dzielni archeolodzy mogą odnaleźć niestrzeżone skarby - to od nas zależy, czy dostaną pozwolenie na wykopaliska.
Żadne ze zdarzeń nie posiada jednego prawidłowego rozwiązania. O wszystkim decyduje generator liczb losowych, a częściej niż rzadziej - niezależnie od tego, która decyzja wyda nam się słuszna - jej konsekwencje odbiją się czkawką w całej prowincji. Czasem straszny demonolog broniąc się przed wygnaniem przyzwie pomiot chaosu, innym razem uwolnione z krypt zombie zdziesiątkują ludność. Na szczęście, możemy zmniejszyć wyrządzone szkody - oddziały broniące prowincji mogą ochronić ludność przed atakiem sił mroku, a rytuał Ekstrawagancji odprawiony nad dzielnicą potrafi skutecznie zredukować niezadowolenie jej mieszkańców.
Najważniejszym elementem Eador jest walka. Rękami bohaterów podbijamy prowincje, odkrywamy ruiny i ścieramy się z innymi herosami. Pola bitwy zbudowane są z heksów i, co zdecydowanie ważniejsze, różnych rodzajów podłoża. Decyduje ono o mobilności jednostek, wpływa na ich wytrzymałość i skuteczność w walce. Dzięki temu, zarówno początkowe rozmieszczenie żołnierzy, jak i ich ruchy w trakcie bitwy mogą mieć znaczący wpływ na wynik końcowy.

Wyjście ze starcia bez strat jest niezwykle ważne. Nie tylko bohaterowie, ale i wszystkie podległe im oddziały zdobywają doświadczenie. System statystyk w Eador pomyślany został tak, by nawet pojedynczy dodatkowy punkt ataku czy obrony był wyraźnie odczuwany na polu bitwy - weterani są więc cenniejsi niż złoto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002877290', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 7674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6056, 'last_played': 1644058496}
review: Diverse and detailed fantasy TBS title with widely branched city building (actually world building) features and "god-game" elements extended with a complex economy structure and large number of diverse units. Sheer quantity of content is difficult to describe because after 100+ hours of campaign I did not even get to see half of the story and haven't unlocked good part of the units and buildings. The karma system is ubiquitous and well executed. Sincere recommendation for anyone looking for a slightly different designed TBS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089279002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 17301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12678, 'last_played': 1527240441}
review: Первый Eador был восхитителен. В этой же трехмерной версии, главное что добавили - баги. А ещё баги, баги, и много багов; каждый из редких патчей правит парочку и добавляет ещё два десятка. Эталонный пример ужасной реализации отличной идеи.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005288488', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 6970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1610870585}
review: A very good 4X fantasy turn based game. It's complexity is well balanced by the game system. I find this game as good or better than some newer and more-hyped games in this genre. One of the best unexpected discoveries I've made on Steam. A rare, beautiful and challenging gem that is a pleasure to own.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991527966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4052, 'last_played': 1498204787}
review: Take Heroes of M&M but without stacking units and cross it with Civ. Every unit has individual experience. Massive building tree and plenty of battles to be had.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023861443', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 19219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13801, 'last_played': 1461177884}
review: It's knda fun. has some bugs. past level 10 the choices kinda suck. heroes need more class specifics not mashing it with other heroes abilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022346008', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 12923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5212, 'last_played': 1709311598}
review:
I would recommend this game if you play solo.
The game depth is amazing and it's really addictive.

There is just a major flaw... don't play multiplayer or between humans only. 
AI confrontation always leads to crashes and since you can't save otherwise than at end of the turn in multi, you have to reload before the crash and crash happens again and the save is lost...

Good game ideas but really really badly coded. Their is still so much bugs 2 years after the release it's indecent.
Eador is the exact definition of genial ideas smashed by incompetent developpers.

review: Я ожидал что вы добавите новые функции и возможности . Или хотябы придумаете новый сюжет . В результате я купил нечто изуродованое с сверестелками и перделками . Первая версия игры лучше . Хорошо что я купил игру за доллар

author: {'steamid': '76561198115254775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1379, 'last_played': 1435816319}
review:
Эадор это отличная стратегическая игра в которой помимо тактических баталий и стратегических манипуляций присутствует так называемый "закон кармы", закон кармы это предписание на тему того как поступать чтобы тебя любили и не бунтовали подданные, он очень важен хотябы потому. что в дальнейшем, когда игрок встретит соперников некоторые из них могут пойти на него войной из за разногласий связанных с кармой. Лично я советую придерживаться светлой стороны, на ней всегда есть шанс ражиться халявными артефактами, нанять в армию редких и сильных монстров, заключить выгодную сделку или союз, да и подданные бунтовать не будут.

Геймплей.
Геймплей игры заключается в войне за участок земли плавающей в космосе. Игрок начинает с клеткой-столицей, цель игры битвы - разрушить столицу/ци всех врагов. Для этой цели игроку даётся возможность нанимать героев, строить в столице здания и нанимать в них войска, изучать магию в постороенных башнях мага, покупать снаряжение в столичном магазине(который тоже надо отстраивать, в этой игре сплошь и рядом надо строить).
Просто пройти к вражеской столице не получится, на пути встанут местные жители которые живут сами по себе и никого просто так не пропустят,с ними можно подраться или договориться, захватив их клетку игрок получит не только право прохода, но и дополнительные доходы и возможно даже ресурс, сильно понижающий стоимость найма определённых видов войск или строительства. Завоёванные клетки будут подвергаться спонтанным нападениям аборигенов и соперников, а потому нужно нанимать для них защиту. В игре присутствует куча трат и совсем немного доходов, самый простой способ получить доход это пройти подземелье или найти сундучёк с сокровищами, для прохождения подземелий их сначало нужно найти исследуя провинцию, а найдя ещё не факт, что действительно удастся пройти данное подземелье без серьёзной армии и прокачанного героя. Подземелья с более крутыми охранниками не пройти буквально до конца сценария, но зато уж в них то точно можно найти полезные артефакты, или даже особые чертежи строений. Строения здесь кстати открываюся по мере прокачки Участка Земли Великого Лидера героев, в начале игры доступ есть только к самым хилым воинам и самым ненужным заклятьям, но не беда ведь у врага дела обстоят так же. Что касается космичеких возможностей Великого владыки то они содятся к болтанию с разными соперниками и вредным слугой-гремлином, иногда выбором того, что подарить смертным поклоняющимся тебе (добро/зло/ничего), а также выбором того на какой участок земли претендовать на этот раз, ну или напасть ли на какого-нибудь особенно хамоватого соседа-соперника и прибрать к рукам все его кровью и потом труженников нажитые земли. У каждого соперника есть свои особые навыки, как то: видеть будующее, вызывать фей, знать всё, призывать демонов, быть грубым и брутальным, быть старым и правильным, но главному герою даётся самая крутая возможность из всех!(барабанная дробь) Автосейв! Божественная сила главного героя позволяет игроку сохранять игру и даже потом загружать её!

Сюжет
Сюжет игры сводится к тому, что главный герой ищет свою память и заодно пытается помешать/помочь демонам уничтожить мир, на пути ему встречаются боги, недо-боги, полу-боги и просто наделённые силой, но не умом личности. Герой их убивает, строит светлое будующее своим подданным, узнаёт правду о своём происхождении, и затем в зависимости от выполнения некторых условий наступает одна из концовок. Есть концовка всеобщего вымирания(две штуки т.к. два способа достигнуть и потому слегка разные в деталях, хотя в общем то одно и то же), есть концовка Совета, есть концовка абсолютной власти, есть просто гибель героя, возможно есть ещё, но лично я на них пока не натыкался.

Оценка.
Юмор 9/10
Графика 8/10
Геймплей 8/10
Сюжет 9/10
Итог 8,5/10

Могу сказать, что игра затягивает и к ней не скучно возвращаться снова и снова, сюжет мог бы быть и получше, но пробелы в нём умело заткнули неплохим юмором и лично я остался доволен.
Игра проходится примерно за 8 часов, но для тех кому неймётся получить 100 процентов прохождения может затянуться и на несколько дней непрерывной игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013540000', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 77170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20232, 'last_played': 1493659253}
review:
Ok I always look for negative reviews first. My opinion is that someone who hates the game will over exagerate the flaws, but at least will talk about the flaws where someone who loves it is less likely to. That being said, I still love this game even though it has flaws. However, some people won't like it as I do so I will begin with the negatives then move on to the positives since that's how I approach it anyway.

Negatives: 
Crashes too much. I'd say once every few hours of play time you will have the game crash. It's not enough to bother me, but it can be frustrating.
AI can be off pretty bad. Battles that will tell you are impossible sometimes can be beaten manually without losing a single hit point. Battles that say they are so weak they are not worth your time will sometimes wipe you on auto. That doesn't happen all of the time, and with some play time you can easilly judge for yourself. Also computer players will keep throwing themselves at your defenses every time they resurect even if they die every single time in some situations.
Bugs. There are a few, one that for some reason will pop up the AI's hero screen in front of me which has shown me they get a +10 gold per turn bonus per hero at the level I was playing at.

Positives
It is constantly changing. Every time you start a new character or see a new world, the game will be different, different maps, different quests available. It kind of reminds me of Civ in that aspect.
You can chose how you play. Some games require you to be the hero, some games require you to be the villian, this game requires you to be whatever you feel like being.
It is a great strategy game IMO. Losing a single soldier at the wrong time can cost you an entire map, granted like most strat games you can always load fail (load the game and redo a fight because you lost), but not all of us play like that.

So with all of that I'd say the game play and replayability are worth it. The bugs and glitches and even AI issues can be fixed (or modders can fix them if it ever opens to mod on steam). Overall I'd say the positives outweigh the negatives enough for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039136995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3332, 'last_played': 1521270059}
review:
Была проблема. Исправили проблему. Нет проблемы. Спасибо за то, что нет проблемы.

Итак, я буду очень краток, игра классная, хотя и очень трудная, баги исправлять не собираются и вносить что-либо новое в игру не планируют.

Игру рекомендую, очень интересная задумка и прекрасная оптимизация, жаль, что реализация подвела.

По поводу проблемы... Там ерунда, просто не запускалась пол года, а так ничего, всё нормально...

author: {'steamid': '76561198086135423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3468, 'last_played': 1430643637}
review: Игрушка неоднозначная.  На первый взгляд кажется красивой и интересной, но затем сталкиваешься с мелочами, которые портят впечатление и действуют на нервы как камень в ботинке или как осколок стекла в пирожке. Во первых, это не слишком удобное управление, во вторых - несколько запутаная система построек,  но это - цветочки! Главное - в третьих, баланс вообще непонятный. Я довольно грамотный игрок, поэтому в стратегиях выбираю либо сложный, либо суперсложный уровень. В Циву, к примеру на уровне Бессмертного балуюсь и иногда даже выигрываю. В Эадоре же уже на уровне Эксперта  надо быть задротом, чтобы играть.  Для кого еще два уровня сложности выше сделали - непонятно! Играть даже на уровне Знающего довольно некомфортно, поскольку  ИИ тупо берет тебя на усталость.  Армия управляемая ИИ может сто ходов стоять напротив твоей не давая никуда уйти ни ничего не сделать, а как только уйдешь - захватит провинцию, а потом следующую ит.д.. Тебе ждать надоест, а компьютеру - нет.   Ну и наконец что меня совсем добило, так это то, что я уже на уровне Знающего (средняя сложность) столкнулся с неубиваемыми героями противника ! Да! Один герой 11 лвл управляемый ИИ убил всю мою нехилую стражу в провинции, а затем с ходу перебил подоспевшую армию из 10 солдат с моим героем 10 уровня и еще одну такую же армию перебил бы, потому что каждого солдата он выносил с одного удара, а моего героя убил с 3-х, при этом сам не потерял и трети хитов. Все! Финиш. Как-то это неправильно. Если такой хардкор на среднем уровне сложности, то что же творится выше?! Короче говоря, моя рекомендация состоит в том, что эту игру надо пробежать на самом легком уровне сложности, чисто ради любопытства и забыть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006198755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 44903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38262, 'last_played': 1574794417}
review:
This game shines for me. It has its own distinct visual feel, a uniquely flavoured narrative and a varied and tactically deep combat system.
I rate this way above the HOMM series which I was a fan of til 6. I t has given me so many hours of enjoyment that I thank the devs for, a real gem for fantasy TBS gamers.
Its had a mixed review because of its buggy history. At one point it was a game breaker but was patched to my satisfaction. I still get some crashes after long hours of play, but nothing game breaking or that a reload of the game hasn't fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057335415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 28632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18207, 'last_played': 1542525401}
review:
게임 동영상을보고 마스터 오브 매직류가 생각나서 구매했습니다.
궁수 영웅을 주로 키워서 클리어를 했습니다.
한판을 클리어하는데 시간이 꽤 소요됩니다.
지금은 패치되었는지 모르지만 예전에 첫 출시때는 버그때문에 상당히 짜증났던 기억이 있습니다.
결국 끝판다가서 버그때문에 게임 진행을 할 수가 없어 엔딩은 보지 못했네요.
개인적으로는 나쁘진 않았지만 버그및 게임 한판을 클리어하는 전략이 거의 비슷했다는 것은 단점입니다.
궁수영웅->부하해고 -> 저축및탐색 -> 레기온2명 -> 힐러1 -> 던전 및 영역확장 
모든 샤드를 이런식으로 플레이하면 무난하게 클리어 할 수 있었습니다.
