author: {'steamid': '76561198087109661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1417274394}
review:
ФУ-ФУ-ФУ КАКАЯ ГАДАСТЬ. 
Жалкое подобие Kings Bounty. Скучно, тупо, не интересно. Даже если бы её бесплатно раздавали, брать всё равно не советую. 
Геймплей уныл, отсутствие сколь нибудь интересной истории не спасают даже юморные диалоги. Пытаясь пройти игру создаётся впечатление, что вынужден ходить на скучную, надоевшую много лет назад работу (за которую, между прочем, не платят).

author: {'steamid': '76561198080125655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1165, 'last_played': 1517037872}
review: Игра очень интересная, раскрывается через время. К сожалению допиливалась после релиза долго, поэтому многие отзывы негативные, но у игры есть потенциал как и у вселенной Эадора! Смесь Эйдж оф Вандерс на глобальной карте, пошаговых боев Герои меча и магии 3-5 и РПГ с исследование мира, плюс много вещей в инвентаре, прокачка героя, его умений и наввыков и из Дисциплс 2, прокачка твоих юнитов с зарабатыванием медалек и т.п. В игре много продуманных решений, постройка города, учтено потребление ресурсов (к слову их здесь два это деньги, для покупки новых новобранцев и построения зданий в городе и кристалы для кастования магии и заклинаний). Магия может использоваться как на глобальной карте так и в бою, что роднит эту игру опять жен с Дисципл 2! В общем наши разработчики опять подтвердили свой профессионализм, жаль не сразу избавились от технических недороботок но сейчас все в норме! Моя оценка 7 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101653128', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2424, 'last_played': 1696324968}
review: Классная игра. Множество возможностей и случайных событий. Рекомендую всем любителям стратегий.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036994404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2926, 'last_played': 1535223684}
review:
I really like this game.  It has most everything I like in a turn based strategy game.  For the price it is well worth it.  The graphics engine in the game kind of sucks in that it is slow at times but do you really play strategy games for fluid graphics?  Most of the bad reviews of this game site it is buggy.  I was at launch and while in beta but I have played 40+ hours and never encountered one bug or crash.

For <$5 its worth it.  I haven't even unlocked the 2nd level or 3rd level units... but I love the diversity of play with ranged/mele/fast/slow... magic/physical units.  the enemies are interesting.  The build paths for your stronghold are a bit confusing but using advanced mode for that helps.  All in all I played this game almost 17 hours straight with work breaks and time to sleep and I really like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008368160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3857, 'last_played': 1570331821}
review:
Games are meant to be fun, not a chore to play.  This game is so close to being fun, but with the silly randomness of events and the rediculous amount of freebies the computer is awarded all aspects of enjoyment are gone.  
I would rather say this game is recommended, but just cannot without that factor being present.  

You need to first slowly, oh so slowly, level you starting hero in order to explore with you weak units in order to gain xp, gold and gems for encountering the computer opponents.  Then just when you can expand out farther the computer jumps in, starting at peace and hopefully remaining there long enough for you to gain units that can tackle the outer rings of territories.  Usually however you cannot get those units in enough time for the computer to declare war, and then steamroll over you with a hero that is 5 levels or more above yours and bringing in tier 3 (sometimes tier 4) units when you have only reached tier 2 units last turn.  Then on each level (shard) taking 2-3 hours to complete and then having no feeling of accomplishment ruins the game in my opinion.

There is just something missing.  Games can, and should, be hard, in order to advance mastery of the game for good, hard fun to occur; at some level of hard however a game becomes stupid.  This game is at the border of this at this time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058986934', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1467388158}
review: If you like RPG s and or Turn based games you will like this game, it plays like a Civ game for the overworld and when you get into battle it changes to a smaller map and you have your army vs. whatever. and this game has so many choices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006342616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1416765298}
review:
Let me start off by saying that I've been playing all types of strategy games for nearly 25 years.  

This game has potential.  I found myself trying to figure out how to reach the higher level content once I managed to level my hero up.  Many of the quests were extremely hard at the beginning stages of the game and added to the frustration of leveling up.  Basic units are no match to even the most beginning level "monsters".

The economy is unbalanced.   Unit maintenance is very high in relation to the amount of coin that you bring in from provinces.  Building costs are low which allows for quick building.   This will allow you to access units for purchase fairly quickly.  However, it doesn't seem to matter that much because there is a logistical issue with your hero only being able to hold 4 troop types at lower levels.  Even after leveling up to level 4, a hero still can only hold 4 troop types.  It is very difficult to level your units and keep your favorite units around.  Combat is unbalanced.

I'm not sure if it's a bug, but my garrison was transferred to another province when an uprising occured in that province.  I would expect the garrison to stand and fight.

The loot part of the game was very cool at first.  But there's no originality to the items.  Many of them are common low level items that don't help out too much.  Most of the game is loot based with low drop rates.

There are several bugs that cause the game to freeze/crash in the middle of the game.  This is not a huge issue though considering the game saves every 2 seconds.

If this game got some balance tweeks, item updates, bug fixes it would be a much more fun game to play.  It feels like the developers wanted to portray the look and feel of a 4x strategy game with all of the bells and whistles , but forgot the underlying basic game mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042220545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6257, 'last_played': 1405539290}
review:
It's hard to play a game over 100 hours and then not recommend it.  And yet, I can't.  I wan't to - but I can't.

You've heard the saying that 'the sum is greater than the parts'; in this game, the parts are greater than the sum.  There is such a good game here waiting to 'happen'.  Unfortunately, the overall game design is flawed.

Specifically, the size of the 'shards' and the mechanics of the shards hurt the overall game.  Because of this, you won't even use most of the best units/buildings/etc.  In essence, you've got all this outstanding content that never comes into play bacause of the mechanics of the 'meta-game'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040811698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 10059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1853, 'last_played': 1650038777}
review: Highly recommend to all fans of fantasy, strategy, and tactics games. Plenty of unique units and buildings, heroes and units gain levels and you can customize their growth, explore the terrain to find new locations and upgrades, manage resources, and increase your own power by conquering other worlds/shards. The campaign does a good job of introducing you to more intricate tactics and developments as you progress. One downside is that with each new shard/map you start over somewhat, but things still manage to stay interesting through new units and buildings, new opponents, and randomized events.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980614776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1417790371}
review: I got this game as part of a bundle (for all of 3$) and it's better than some AAA billed games (looking at you where Civ : BE).  The game feels imperfect as it's a bit clunky and the controls are odd so you can tell it's not a game that wasnt intended to sell for 50$ but it's a lot more fun than I expected.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999501281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 10882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5621, 'last_played': 1647540324}
review:
Warning! Extremely addictive!
I have been trying to tear myself away from this game to be able to study with only limited success.
At first I did not understand the game and then I thought it sucked balls. But after learning what to do after beginning a map, thing have become much, much easier and more plesant.
If you are a completionist like myself you will find yourself trying to complete every single small quest you are given so I'm gonna give you an advice. Just complete the map and get it over with. Unless you want to spend several hours per map that is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033355204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 85317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35654, 'last_played': 1440892126}
review:
Уж не знаю у кого как, а у меня игра часто вылетает с ошибками. Игра вроде бы и неплохая - но этими вылетами бесит, посему и не беру дополнение к ней. Загружал через стим, пробовал удалить и заново установить- та же шляпа, таблетки от этой болезни не нашел, куда обращаться-     фз....
Сломал бы палец разработчику-программеру, чес слово!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035431835', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 5720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5437, 'last_played': 1429385017}
review:
Deep strategy, chess like gameplay, takes ages to get to grips with but very rewarding once you do.

If your looking for a flashy game with great animations and personal custamization then... go find another 4x game because this isn't it.

it's all about strategy, it's all about perfecting your early game and reaping the steam rolling rewards in the late game. It's on the deeper end of the complexity scale but unlike something like crusader kings 2, it's not initially mind boggling... for the most part. Though the building tree is extremely expansive and not very well laid out...

It doesn't run very smoothly either... I've got a 780 now and it works fine, but my previous 570m on my l;aptop had some stuttering, though anything over a 760 should be very smooth. And most people have that at least, so this is just a wasted sentence i guess lol.

anyway.

the game has it's flaws; the campaign is excessivley long and boring. Though the writing is great I'd reccomend just free play or whatever it's called.

also steam rolling... not very fun late game, it's a problem with most 4x games, it's steam rolling. Once you've bumped off the enemy commander a couple times YOU WIN.

though it can be fun to maintain and manage a huge kingdom, exploring your lands etc. 

it's worth the price, it's worth putting a good 100-150 hours into, and it's a 4x game I'll be coming back to at some point. The ai is very good and it's heart warming to see how many different strategies can be played out in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038244437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 14917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14210, 'last_played': 1418238808}
review:
It took me 248 hours to end the campaign - and I chose the quickest way to finish.

If you like to finish your games - beware of the necessary time investment!

The game runs very unstable (release 1.4.5) - during my playthrough I had over 100 crashes to the desktop (seems evenly distributed between "Invalid Pointer Operation" and "Access violation..."). 
The game might run smoothly for 5 hours or crash 5 times in 30 minutes...

author: {'steamid': '76561198031028950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1415576350}
review: interesting story, has some potential, but something feels missing. Tried a few games and could't get a positive economy. Felt combat was a bit vanilla -- I give it a 4/10 but do look forward to an improved Eador 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198005919137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 341, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1449219243}
review: I can't really recoment this game. Don't get me wrong its good, but gets boring too soon as it lacks pace and intrigue

author: {'steamid': '76561197979709607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3260, 'last_played': 1415892107}
review:
This game closely resembles Heroes of MaM, in its gameplay but adds several features.  First is is much more complex and takes significantly longer to actually play the game.  One difference is that each map is devided into provences where you move from provence to provence each turn.  Do do not actually attack enemies on the game map, bu through events that are specific to the provence that your hero is working in.  
Then there is the world building phase of the game, which acts as a break point between each of the shard games.  You play a campain on the world building section of individual conquests of each individual game map.  

Type of recommendation:  If you love the turn based HoMaM games or possibly King's Bounty but want something more complex, you may enjoy this game.  The biggest difference between those games and this one is that you are not moving freely on the map but moving from provence to provence where all the events take place.  

Otherwise this game is probably going to be too tedious for most people.  I will continue to play it but only periodically.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098830242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 30842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11465, 'last_played': 1707137507}
review:
Советую всем любителям тактических игр, наподобии Героев.
Плюсы:
-Огромное дерево строений города с альтернативными ветками
-Качать можно всех: героев и обычных юнитов.
-Боевые слоны :)
-Охота за артефактами.
-Интересный сюжет (если осилите продолжительность кампании, 200 часов игры и я ее еще не прошел)
-Система кармы.(ьакого точно нигде нет)
Минусы:
-Геймплей затянут
-Сейчас уже почти не осталось, но горький привкус от количества багов которые были у игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999236267', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1408944427}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032046845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 20745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6757, 'last_played': 1691328584}
review: Easily one of the funnest games I have played, that being said, I would not recommend you buy unless you have a god tier computer. On my normal computer, this game does not work it crashes all the time, I recentlly built a very nice computer and it runs as smooth as a lampshade made of fresh baby skin. Also the issue with the crashes and errors I got on my other two computers (ones a laptop) will not be adressed as none of my emails or error reports ever got a reply. Maybe the company is not the best at pr. This game is amazing nonetheless, I enjoy the strategy and it is not insanely easy as some others, so long as you dont select skilled or anything below you will have very nice combat that requires actuall planning and thinking, story line was pretty awesome too. Only issue I have had is that you need a strong computer to play it, and the lack of help or support from the creators, but I get that from ea and almost every company too. Another cool thing so far as gameplay goes is that you can use one method to win most battles, for example necromancy, however these battles can be slugfests, and you may end up losing, where you essentially trade blows until one of you manages to get the upperhand and you will end up taking days of back and forth battling to take or lose the shard, when if you just adapt you strategy and maybe add a commander with long range  units in the back and strong defense with low attack to shield the path of incoming land units you could maybe have won the shard or faster if you win anyways. There are flying units too, the strategy is quite varied, really an awesome game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005545583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22342, 'last_played': 1422394130}
review: Surprisingly fun turn based fantasy game. Basically you play through 'shards' each turn, building up an army and eventually conquering each shard, which then unlocks bonuses for the next shard. While this game isnt too challenging, it is very fun to play here and there as you conquer more. Similar to Heroes of Might and Magic but with new mechanics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021857629', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1406940095}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198006582244', 'num_games_owned': 608, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1414805487}
review:
Eador is billed as a stategy game and tries to combine Empire building 4x themes with turn based 'tactical' battles. Although the ideas are sound the execution is pretty bad. Everything seems a bit off at first and the feeling only grow the more you play it. Call it lack of polish or simply the mark of an 'indie' studio, the result is still the same...Not very fun. 

The tactical battles as gimped with an impossibly small field of battle (units are constantly getting in each others way if you have more than 5-6 units and archers and mages can wipe you out from across the map) and poor unit balance. Even on the easiest difficulty level the fights go from very easy to frustrating. Before the battle the game gives you an indication of how tough a fight will be but even fights that "You will win easily" can be a total wipe unless you use all your units in perfect coordination. 

i wish I would have had the willpower to play more to see if it improves but the game is simply not fun...

author: {'steamid': '76561198026726391', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1416253420}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960559290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 25498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17880, 'last_played': 1468120742}
review:
-Bought this when feeling nostalgic about Master of Magic / HoMM.  I also like CiV and slower, turn-based games sometimes.
-More complex building options than HoMM and in some aspects MoM..  More specifically the City Build menu can be overwhelming to look at for the first time.  I particularly enjoyed this aspect of the game - its complexity left me wanting more and more so I would restart a game after losing to tweak the build and see what works best.
-The heroes can be viewed as simple/straightforward - 4 classes.  Each time you level you put one point into one skill (out of three offerred).
-Spells are just similar to Heroes of Might & Magic. Build the 4th tower to get the best spells.. except there is a different building for each magic type - there are 6 magic types (I think?) at least as far as buildings / main spells go.
-More complex gameplay & darker theme than Heroes of Might & Magic
-Can't wait to play multiplayer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039462484', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7356, 'last_played': 1435707072}
review:
Пошаговая механика боя, исследования и развития - это огромный плюс. Сложность игры (нужно изучать огромное количество зданий, юнитов, умений) - это тоже плюс, пошаговые стратегии должны быть долгими. Из минусов - кривая система дипломатии, "дыры" в мета-сюжете, однобразность боев на 100+ ходе.
update. За три года разработчиик так и не пофиксили многие баги, а вместо того стали клепать кривые аддоны (жадность!). Не покупайте их.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995366221', 'num_games_owned': 1644, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1413752634}
review:
The idea is interesting but the implementation is lacking. Highly random starting positions can vary the difficulty from "cakewalk" to "impossible," and strategy games should be decided more by your decisions than by randomness. Hero units drive the game, so if your starting area is  good, you steamroll the map; if not, you may be able to grind through, provided the enemy hero did not get a steamroll start that lets it one-shot your troops and two-shot your hero. "First OP hero wins" is not an interesting strategy dynamic.

Before each fight, the game evaluates your forces versus your enemies and gives you a difficulty estimate from "no casualties" to "no chance." Whatever math is being done does not compare the units' strengths and weaknesses. You will regularly find impossible "easy" fights and "run away!" fights you can win without taking damage. Between this and the highly random elements, you can see why so many places on the forums advocate save scumming.

I encountered fewer crash bugs than other reviewers did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045771043', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1664798834}
review:
Все доброго времени суток!!!
Расскажу я вам историю о Эадоре.
Да да это тот самый старый добрый Эадор. Мир волшебства, героев, и владык. Но только это все в новом формате, хорошая графика (не герои 5-е конечно, но это Эадор), все кто инграл в первую, советую. Хорошая пошаговая стратегия, минус только один длинная как жизни владыки, тоесть если полностью исследовать каждый осколок, играть наверно придется всю жизнь)) Но в этом тоже есть свой прикол)) Так что всеам кто любит длинные историе написанные так сказать самим собой - ИГРАТЬ ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНО!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005654011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1404078240}
review: I wanted to love Eador, but after a couple of painful hours that felt like a total slog, I just had to give up trying.  There are a lot of complex systems that the developers have obiovusly spent a lot of time thinking about, and I commend them for that... I can see what their vision was.  Unfortunately the core of the gameplay - the battle system - is pedestrain to the point of being drab and boring, and that drags everything else down.  If a patch came out to make combat more dynamic and strategic then I'd be all in for re-trying Eador, but until that happens I can't give the game a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036932797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4260, 'last_played': 1438766361}

Плюсы:

Недоделки:

- В игре по сети дисбаланс со стартом: один начинает в месте обитованном, другой среди злобных нищебродов

author: {'steamid': '76561197999379421', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2566, 'last_played': 1587151468}
review:
You want to play turn-based combat and simultaneously building up your empire while leveling every single unit in your army up? You, dear Sir, have quite an interesting taste. And found a jewel.

The story itself is engaging while you conquer the whole universe and face from humans to gods everything you might think of. The shards (worlds) itself are then conquered by your hero and his armies, who fight your battles in turn-based combats. All the shards then allow for more units, equipments, buildings and boosts for the next shard to fall under your rule.

The graphical presentation might not appeal to anyone, but it is atmospherical and suits the game and gameplay well enough. A lot of peopel are reporting technical issues with the game, however I have never encountered such problems. If this bothers you, I recommend checking other reviews in more detail.

[b]7/10[/b] for breaking under it's own size from time to time and the technical issues a lot of people might have (This is hard to factor in, though, because if you do have such issues, one would very likely give it a 0, as in did not deliver).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030720951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4841, 'last_played': 1434869393}

I dont want to play anymore even though some bugs are fixed because im tired of building all the stupid buildings on large maps.  They really should have streamlined this or cut the number of upgrades by 80%.  There is a queue system but its very poor.  Im not sure what they were thinking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030767212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1399406052}
review: Das Spiel wiederholt sich mit jeder Partie sehr stark ohne wirklich Abwechslung oder motivierende Neuheiten zu bieten. Zudem ist der Spielverlauf sehr zäh und es kommt auch kein Gefühl für die immer wieder neu erstellten Charaktere auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068686975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7179, 'last_played': 1454191408}
review: Знакомство с игрой началось с поиска игр схожих по геймплею с небезизвестными "Героями". В итоге после просмотра видео и скриншотов был сделан выбор приобрести ее, к тому же она была по скидке. Наиграно достаточное количество часов, имется в настоящее время своеобразное мнение об игре. Так, можно отметить вполне удачную идею захвата материков как составные элементы развития игрока. Но, на мой взгляд очень уж это происходит однобоко. Пока я не увидел ситуаций одновременного нападения игроков (ботов). Имеются и скажем так имбо связки по прокачке. Игра достойна внимания тех, кто ищет тактических "экшенов", готов тратить время на обдумывание следующих ходов. Моя оценка 7 из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030624353', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1687346039}
review:

review: ДА, я люблю хомм и цив, а также разные мастер оф орион2 и эйдж оф вондерс. НО честно говоря затрахали уже НЕДОИГРЫ которые маскируются словами -инди и -TBS при некоторых хор отзывах.  Просто напрягают криворукие дауны которые выпускают сырые релизы подобных недоигр. Не смог установить в начале ХД разрешение, как не старался - оно сменяется на вовсе абстрактное 1280 на чтото там(экран 4х3 или угол экрана видно). Почему я купив игру в конце 2014 года должен танцевать с бубном при запуске?? накипело, сношу херню, лучше в героев погонять старых... а СТИМ на самом деле тоже достал подобное продавать - деньги они почемуто четко и сразу списывают, а качество контента не гарантируют. Блин , игра вышла год назад, ппц просто... ((

author: {'steamid': '76561198008369900', 'num_games_owned': 622, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 8734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6944, 'last_played': 1658715479}
review:
This game draws heavily upon the heroes of might and magic series, but actually gets it right unlike HOMM4/5/6. 

Pros: 

- Beautiful artwork. 
- Challenging gameplay. 
- Diverse strategy. 
- Developers are still improving the game. 

Cons:

- Multiplayer is unplayable. Too Buggy. 
- Some bugs in singleplayer (but nothing gamebreaking)
- Runs quite slow even on my I5 w/ 16GB ram
- DLC when the game is not even finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000385268', 'num_games_owned': 1567, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1707696320}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076291038', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1513032288}
review: I originally bought the first Eador game - Genesis. This is basically a remake with improved graphics. And with this I am perfectly okay because the graphics were the only thing that needed some correction - the rest is perfectly awesome as it is. An Age of Wonders / HoMM sort-of-clone, Eador uses the very cool concept of you being a God conquering the 'shards' that make up the world to send you in multiple mission on relatively small maps as you try to make your way towards total domination. The game is a mix of strategy with some resource management (very basic stuff, really), RPG with growing heroes, items, and spells, and tactical turn-based battles on hexagonal grids, in the best Warhammer tradition. If you like this genre, it's good fun - and in this version, it now is good fun with very awesome looks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012570858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1409461389}

review: nice tactical system but too long, too slow, too repetitive . On harder than normal it's too hard if you don't do it the only right way after a while in. Prepare to get stuck and owned making it slower and slower. AI hired guards don't scale with you. Item repair also ridiculous. loads of crashes still after 1 year and a half of patching and randomness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052265357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 4228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3425, 'last_played': 1536134148}
review:
Интересная и затягивающая пошаговая стратегия. Пожалуй одна из лучших пошаговых стратегий. И вот что её делает таковой: Интересный мир, большой выбор существ, заклинаний и предметов. Множество всяких событий и рандом почти во всём делает игру реиграбельной. Сюжет нелинейный, но очень затратный по времени (около 200-300 часов необходимо потратить что бы пройти кампанию). Так же мне понравилась возможность прокачивать каждого юнита в отдельности (в отличии от тех же героев, где основную роль играет их количество). 
Однако хотел бы обратить внимание на некоторые недостатки, устранение которых могло бы существенно улучшить данную игру: - Необходимо лучше проработать систему прокачивания героев (путем добавления большего количества навыков). Так например каждый из 4-х классов героев имеет возможность выбора 4-х специализаций, одна из которых продолжение "своего класса", а три другие заимствования из других классов, что делает прокачивание героев однообразным. Так же можно было бы добавить пару новых классов героев, иначе просто надоедает однообразие в героях.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997639000', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 5950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5949, 'last_played': 1409027353}
review: I love the multi-layered strategy and the worldbuilding that ties together different game mechanics.  Definitely a relatively punishing 4X, but absolutely worth diving into if you enjoy 4X/RPG hybrids that offer a real challenge without making it feel like the AI is simply overpowered.

review: Stuck between interesting leveling options, and horriblly uncomprimising a.i. its hard to recomend this game, the Heros of might and magic style combat stays ingrosing, but comp getting harder without ways to solve the problem other than losing and restarting.  You can get so far in even the smallest stages and if you play it wrong, you ll be so far behind that you wont be able to win. so you waste large amounts of time backtracking or throwing things at your computer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013997359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1408233159}
review: I am actually glad that I decided to go through with this game despite the bad reviews that users have been giving it. At a glance, it looks a lot like most fantasy setting 4x hexagonal grid strat rpg games, but this one is by far more punishing. As an example, the Age of Wonders series, when you make a mistake in that game it is typically a simple process to work your way back out of it, time consuming, but simple. This game is a lot less forgiving, to the point that even with all the right moves, you downright have to be cheating to get anywhere at all. In one game I had a single hero at level 2, was barely managing to stay on top of 4 hexes of land, and then a SINGLE beginner difficulty AI warrior hero comes along and stomps me. in the same amount of time the AI had somehow magically managed to have a level 5 hero, with 2 maxed abilities, and another with three points in it, which as far as I know so far, is not evne possible. So, all in all I definitely would have to give this game a 7/10, just for the sake of the mind-numbingly stupid situations I find myself in because of the balancing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025279443', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2627, 'last_played': 1473186182}
review:
Yo no sabía nada de este juego. Me vino en un Bundle y, sinceramente, tardé semanas en molestarme en instalarlo porque no me sonaba ni me atraía y tenía muchas otras cosas que jugar. Pero cuando al fin lo he jugado, se ha convertido rápidamente en mi juego revelación de este verano. 

Eador es a la vez RPG, turn-based strategy y 4x. Durante el juego saltarás frecuentemente entre los tres niveles en que se desarrolla: el de la creación y progresiva ampliación de tu mundo, a lo Civ, el de conquista de mapas repletos de localizaciones con vida propia que tomar y PNJs a los que derrotar, a lo HoMM; y por supuesto las batallas por turnos, similares a King's Bounty o un poco al ya mencionado Heroes; los tres niveles salpicados de elementos que le dan la parte RPG. Hay que aclarar que, sabiamente, han decidido hacer que estos "niveles" se sucedan consecutivamente el uno al otro en vez de mezclarse y han limitado estrictamente las acciones que se pueden realizar por turno, de manera que nunca te verás agobiado por todo lo que tienes que hacer; siempre tendrás 1 objetivo claro a la vista que estarás trabajando para alcanzar y los turnos se sucederán mucho más rápido que en un Civ o en un Heroes.

Pero el juego tiene tanta personalidad que todas esas comparaciones son, en realidad, muy inadecuadas: Eador es Eador y punto. No has jugado a ningún juego como ese. Se atreve a hacer más cambios e introducir más conceptos revolucionarios de los que la saga Heroes ha añadido desde la entrega 1 hasta la 6, y además tiene una deliciosa profundidad que solo se va revelando muy poco a poco y que siempre te deja con ganas de más. Me recuerda en eso a cómo las campañas de Warcraft 3 o de Starcraft iban revelándote lentamente, durante todo el juego, los edificios y unidades que componían la raza; Eador hace algo parecido, solo que es el juego entero y sus mecánicas los que se revelan así. Eador siempre te deja la sensación de que te queda mucho, mucho por ver, y que lo que has jugado hasta ahora, por mucho que te haya gustado, no es más que el aperitivo.

Perfectamente pulido y parcheado con frecuencia, muy bien equilibrado (hay muchas opciones estratégicas muy distintas pero todas ellas son viables a su manera e interesantes) y con un buen guión que a veces llega a hacerte reír, Eador es un juego como una catedral. Lo único que tiene de indie es el dinero que hay detrás de él. Por lo demás, Eador es un gigante del género de la estrategia. Si quieres un juego enorme en el que perderte que, además, tiene claro cuál es su público y no toma al jugador por tonto, no te lo pienses.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966739786', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3432, 'last_played': 1407957673}
review:
Ein schönes Strategiespiel. Mit Pros und Cons
Gut finde ich die erzählte Geschichte. Wenn auch nur auf Textbasis will man immer mehr wissen, wo wird das ganze enden, wer ist mein Freund wer ist mein Feind. Sehr gut ist, dass man sich dabei offenbar zwischen gut und böse entscheiden kann. Auch die Rundenstrategie gefällt mir recht gut. Leider wird mir die auf dauer etwas zu eintönig. So ist zwar jede Scherbe anders, aber doch ist alles gleich. Man nehme einen Helden (am besten hat für mich der Späher funktioniert), gebe ihm ein paar Babaren (billigste/stärkste Einheit von T1) und nehme Land für Land. Das eingenommene Land ausbauen (Miene, Sägewerk, Mühle) und nebenbei den Helden Leveln. Dem Helden noch ein paar gegenstände gekauft... und naja was soll ich sagen, der macht dann fast jede Armee im alleingang fertig. Die KI schein zumindest auf den beiden niedrigsten Schwierigkeitsgraden keine herausforderung zu sein, egal wieviel Zeit man ihnen zum Aufbau gibt. Was ich als besonders nervig empfinde ist, dass freie Städte/Länder zum Teil abnormal starke Armeen zur Verteidigung haben. Einmal alle freien Länder zwischen dir und dem NPC eingenommen, läuft die Armee einfach durch, da gibt es kein nennenswerten wiederstand mehr. Der Weg zum Gegner ist am Schwierigsten und eigentlich auch am Nervigsten. Ich hätte mir gewünscht das die Ländereien leicht zu erobern sind und ich dann, nachdem die Scherbe aufgeteilt wurde ich harte schlachten gegen meinen Gegner schlagen muss. leider ist es anders rum.
Wer den schwierigkeitsgrad anhebt damit es etwas interessanter wird muss sich an ganz neue gegebenheiten anpassen. Das was vorher noch zu den leichten sachen zählte wird nun bocken schwer. Naja und der nervige Teil mit den freien Ländern, nervt dann umso mehr!
Ich habe es noch nicht durch die Story geschafft (bei fast 60h Spielzeit). Damit hat es eine beträchtliche Spieldauer, für wenig Geld. Außerdem gefällt mir auch die Grafik/Artworke. 

Wer dem Spiel auf dauer seine monotonie verzeihen kann, bekommt ein klasse Strategiespiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025561198', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1433, 'last_played': 1641737583}
review: I'm a big fan to turn based strategy games, and there's the heart of a good game here.  Unfortunately, it's rendered virtually unplayable by huge numbers of bugs, even now, well over a year past launch.  There are weird graphical glitches where various images (usually heroes or the island images in the astral) don't appear unless you change the graphics options every time you start.  Even then, frequently all the text just vanishes at random points, or popup windows don't get displayed (but still block input), and frequent random crashes.

review: This is the best turn based strategy game i have ever played since Homm and Disciples series. First of all this is not an easy game. A lot of things to learn and much more random events to effect of the game playing session. All this range of variety units, events, building options there is no chance to play the same game twice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984819641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1404818813}
review:
Eador: MotBW if a solid game for sure. Gorgeous art, simple and yet fairly dynamic balanced mechanics, original aesthetic. Nothing not to like from this small time developer. Also, they are updating and adding to the game all the time.

However, the tutorial does drag on too much, and by the time you can build a full realm (all tiers unlocked) it kinda feels like you've already played the game for what it's worth. The story here is original, but there isn't much to keep you hooked. Add to that buggy coop/multiplayer and after 40 or so hours, I put this on back on the proverbial shelf.

If your really like 4x RPG's, don't miss this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006571741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12537, 'last_played': 1682677002}
review:
Ok, an small analysis on Eador:

I think this is a great game, played hundreds of hours and still had things surprising me (tried to be the bad guy, and if you let a lot of daemon portals open you will lose the game, as your world will be cast in chaos...)

The strategic deep is quite big, and can be a hell to win it on higer difficult levels.

Good thing on the game:
- Deep strategy
- Good history
- Keep surprising you
- Different ways to win, different scenarios which force you to try newer strategies

Bad things on the game:
- Sometimes you will have to use a lot of time to win over a shard (longer it takes to me was 16 hours), this mekes you thing you are advancing very slowly
- Thtas all, i like very much ^^

review: Довольно интересная игра, некая помесь героев и цивы. Шикарные диалоги между миссиями (и описания некоторых квестов), события которые происходят во время миссии порой удивляют. Советую поиграть всем кому нравятся пошаговые стратегии с ролевыми элементами.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047987096', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1399043798}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken World, ist eine interessante Mischung aus Heroes of Might & Magic und Age of Wonders und bietet eine enorme Spieltiefe. Die Kämpfe gegen Monster, Provinzgarnisonen und die Armeen der Gegenspieler laufen ganz typisch in Hexfeld-Arenen ab. Neben der taktisch cleveren Nutzung der verschiedenen Geländetypen (Hügel, Wälder, Sümpfe und mehr) kommt es hier vor allem darauf an, die Stärken und Schwächen der verschiedenen Einheiten gegeneinander auszuspielen und auf die Ausdauer zu achten.
Sehr komplex und auf dauer arg monoton!
Wem es gefällt, bitte. Mir ist das Spiel zu langatmig....aber für ein Sale Game war das alle mal in Ordnung.

review: Очень удачный продукт. Играл еще в двумерном варианте, до конца не веря, что все это придумал 1 человек. Без раздумий купил новую версию и ни капли не пожалел об этом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005437168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1421877741}
review:
A most excellent game. Eador starts out slowly, and has a tutorial that may frusterate a long time TBS game player, but once it hits its stride you start to feel like the God of a New World (death note quote 0.0) The game plays in a similar manner to Age of Wonders, with heroes and units doing turn based battles, but sets itself apart with its Province and shard systems. A shard is one of the pieces of the titular broken world, which when conquered joins itself to your fledgling domain and give you advantages to use in further conquest. Each shard is made up of a number of provinces, each with its own denizens, dungeons, and enemies. The meat of the game lies in the empire building aspect. Your heroes will spend a lot of time exploring the frontiers of you empire, pushing back the wilderness and revealing lost ruins, dens of evil, and the occasional friendly group. Quests and events will come every now and then, leaving you to decide how you want to rule your empire. The focus can lead to a forgetable shard endgame, as in my experience by the time the AI lords began to move against me I had heroes who could singlehandadly slaughter their armies, but I have only done one Shard so far. There does appear to be a diplomacy function, both on the shard and greater level, as well as a greater threat against the universe in a nebulous chaos, but I haven't gotten there yet. 

TL:DR Great fantasy TBS Game, lots of depth, some balance issues. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040474228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 16887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13858, 'last_played': 1407678075}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197973195871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1404157033}
review: I put a good number of hours into this game as it seemed as though there is a lot of depth to it. This may well be the case but unfortunately I finally gave up with it due to the fact that it is so incredibly slow, clunky and badly made. The game mechanics are rather confusing and it really does a terrible job of letting you know what you are supposed to be doing. The tactical combat sections are also terrible. Tiny maps with big daft looking units that don't really offer much in the way of tactical options. Either your units are better or the enemies are. It's all pretty dull stuff, which is a shame really as I tend to like this type of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056482585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 8729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7238, 'last_played': 1460739248}
review: Игр в серии пошагових стратегий множество. От героев до джаган альянс. Но вот в этой игре разработчики предлогают игракам не сколько уникальний сюжет и сравнительно неплохой диапазон войск, закленаний и способов быстро прокачатся. В игре дается логичное и постепеное совершенствование замка а с ним и возможностей в каждай новой битве пременят новие и новие тактики. Игру рекомендую всем кто не гоняется за графикой, кому надо отбигать от компа на 5 - 10 минут без ущерба игры, ну и главное любителям пошагових стратегий:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198032638096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 43750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1560803649}
review:
Купил и разочаровался, хотя фанат и поклонник гениальной первой версии Эадора. Всё, что можно было ухудшить в «Эадор Сотворение» 2009 года было ухудшено. А улучшения можно по пальцам рук  перечесть.
Бои тормозят даже «максимальной» скорости. И дело не в компе, он мощный и с SSD. Просто тупо не отключается анимация движений противников (ненужная и ужасно нарисованная). Итоговое время боя между большими отрядами может быть в 10 раз (!) дольше, чем в Эадоре Сотворение. Ну а теперь представьте, как на гигантской карте играть…
Баланс  «случайных мест» нарушен. Иногда этих мест вокруг замка не хватает даже для прокачки одного героя, не говоря уже об остальных. Нужно выставлять вручную увеличенное количество. Когда происходит событие в провинции, то не показывается, где всё это происходит. И десятки подобных недочетов. Т.е. игра попросту сырая, потому что эти огрехи видно после первого запуска.
Ну и самое плохое, что делает игру неиграбельной, это зависания. Вот сейчас в середине игры столкнулся с зависанием во время боя. И всё, надо загружаться на пару ходов назад, пытаться играть по-другому, чтобы как-то изменить ход событий. Когда такое происходит несколько раз подряд, играть больше не хочется.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030892591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1405284925}
review:
Bohužel i když na první pohled zajímavá strategie výsledný efekt se rovná = Absolutní nuda. Monotónní  kombat system kde střelecké jednotky rozsekají vše a průzkumné mise bez nápadu. Město přeplácané a stavba zbytečně složitá.  

Moje hodnocení ...  2/10.

Unfortunately, even though at first glance an interesting strategy resulting effect is equal to = Bodedom. Monotone combat system where all ranged units hack and scout mission with no idea. City fussy and unnecessarily complicated construction.

My ratings ...  2/10.

残念ながら、たとえ一目見ただけで効果が生じた興味深い戦略は、に等しい = 退屈. モノトーンコンバットシステム場所 あった単位はすべてチョップ サッパリと偵察任務. 市うるさいと、不必要に複雑な構造.

私の評価 ...  2/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037133949', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1386064934}
review:
Изумительная пошаговая стратегия отечественного производства теперь и в 3д. Отличная графика, интересные диалоги, отличная компания на долгие часы! Теперь и с мультиплеером!
Главный герой - владыка, он же "начинающий бог", владеющий кусочком мира и борющийся за вселенское господство в "астрале". Борьба с другими владыками за вселенское господство начинается с борьбы за кусочки миров(осколки) плавающих в бездне астрала. Мы выбираем осколок, а затем вселяемся в тело местного князя. Выбираем одног из четырех героев:
- Лучник - мастер дальнего боя, эдакий Робин Гуд, авантюрист-ловкач
- Воин - классика ближнего боя, рыцарь в доспехах
- Маг - некромант, колдун, вошебник
- Командир - эдакий полководец, дающий бонус остальным юнитам в команде, "саппорт"
Далее классические пошаговые элементы - прокачка родового замка, захват территорий, экономика, зачистка различных мест от монстров, получение новых вещей для своего героя и случайные события. Наша задача выбить местного лорда с осколка, чтобы захватить этот осколок и присоединить его к своему миру. Для этого нужно наити и захватить родовой замок. 
На пути  к победе нас ждут стихийные бедствия, набеги неитралов, болезни, козни демонов, сопли местного населения и конечно же выкрутасы местного лорда. После победы над лордами(их может быть несколько на осколке, прихвостней других владык), мы захватываем осколок и поднимаемся на ступеньку к мировому господству. Захват каждого осколка дарует нам новые возможности - бонусы при высадке на новый осколок, доступ к новым постороикам в родовом замке. 
Поднимаяся все выше и выше, мы встречаем новых лордов, у которых свои планы на распоряжение вселенной. Можно конечно и подружится, но союзы длятся временно - ведь управлять вселенной может лишь один!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021226900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1456181203}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008597582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7737, 'last_played': 1405198201}
review:
I really want to like this game, but it just ends up being shy of good. The game has issues with bugs creaping in, but the developers are generally pretty quick at addressing them. Unfortunately you rarely get a fully working game. As old bugs are squashed, new ones creep in. Also, some bugs just don't go away, the worst is the bug where you can't end your turn. You're required to basically sacrifice your next turn by converting it into 'auto combat'. In many cases this just results in you losing the battle. This means that 5-10% of your battles you are required to reload, purely because they won't/can't fix this bug.

There's three aspects to the game. A campaign-wide strategy, a map strategy, and tactical maps/tactics in small combats. Each one is flawed.

The Campaign-wide strategy could be very cool, as you earn astral power to augment your next map start, and you selectively choose what building upgrades you can get. Unfortunatly the astral power aspect is far too weak to have any reasonable changes on your map starts. So every map you start (which will be 10's if not 100's of times in a single campaign) is exactly the same thing. It gets repetitive.

The map strategy involves taking provinces and as you progress to diposing 1-N enemies on the map, but once you take a province you can instantly plop down a guard for the garrison, which is 1/10th the cost of the troops you would normally have to buy, and regularly a lot better than any troops anyone can produce. This means the game behoves rushing early on and plopping down guards, two of which the AI gains bonuses and cheats to accomplish.

Finally, the tactical combat is exeedingly simplistic. The AI does the same thing irrespective of the map or your compliment. There is no concept of "threatened zones" around your characters, so AI troops will run through your line and attack things behind you, turning the game into just balling your troops up, and your tactics are limited by the kharma system.

The game has a "kharma" system that is based on your actions and the results of the campaign, which would seem like a good idea. Unfortunately, the kharma system limits what troops you can acquire or use, and these limits have absolutely zero relation with your actions. The "good" kharma units are slow and expensive, while the "evil" kharma units are generally glass cannons. Since your world map size/complement would dictate which tactics you would want to do, the strategic aspects of kharma basically have negative correlary to the tactical aspects of kharma. Combined with the fact you're limited in the number of units you can build at any rank/tier, this means that if you start in a small shard with the zerg units (which since every shard is the same, is almost always the best early option) you're now locked out of the other units.

The concept of the game is great, but in practice the limits on troops, building ranks, and the failing of the astral campaign options results in a very tedious game where your choices are generally limited not by any sort of story or strategy, but just purely pragmatic necessities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979843174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1399826734}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041543513', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1404088494}
review:
If you enjoy strategy games and like a challenge, you will really love Eador.

The game involves you taking over "shards" in  grid-based expansion-style gameplay similar to the Civilization series. Each conquered shard offers bonuses to you in your quest to take over the broken world. During unit battles, however, you will move to an actual level where your armies must fight - slightly similar to games like the Disciples series and Age of Wonders. The battles, however, are a bit more basic compared to those games (you are put into a top-down style map grid and can place your units prior to the start of battle).

The aesthetics of the game are nice, there is good detail in the area tiles and the unit models are decent considering the large availability of characters to recruit. The sound, music, and effects of things like activated skills and magic spells are also decent.

There is a lot to do in Eador, and the learning curve is pretty high if you are not familiar with strategy games. During your turn, you can hire "heroes" who act as your generals for your armies. The game incorporates a karma system where "evil" units like skeletons and "good" units like dwarves will stack and provide bonuses if your army has only one type of karma (so mixing the two will result in negative attributes). 

You can "explore" each tile if you own it (up to 100%) and doing so may yield things like an adventurers guild that provides higher-tier characters for recruitment, various ruins or areas for you to fight monsters and receive treasure (there are A LOT of these), etc. Be warned, however, that is is not always advisable to explore your tiles to 100%, especially if you only have one hero because your enemy will surpass you in both troops and tile ownership very quickly. I think this contributes the most to the difficulty - when I play strategy games I am usually very good because I have a good balance of turtling while harassing, howver, in Eador the cost for subsequent hero recruitment increases substantially, and you can only move an army if a hero is leading it.

There are a lot of different buildings available to be built, however, there is a limit to how many of each kind/tier can be built. For example, the "military" buildings each provide a single unit (archers, spearmen, etc) and will also provide either "good" or "evil" units, , but you may only build 4 out of 9 buildings (if I recall correctly). At the next tier, you can only build according to what you have previously built (and this leaks over to other "types," like market/armory buildings). You may only build one building on a tile per turn. 

At the initial stages/shards, the AI is not too difficult, however, quite early on you will quickly find your enemy to be very unforgiven. If you slack in your expansion and troop building, you will soon find the AI's troops right outside your borders. Once you take over a tile, you can build a fort in order to garrison troops - if you don't you can hire a single "guard" unit to patrol around the tile and defend it from invaders. This makes it a bit easier to reclaim (or lose) tiles. 

There is variety in how to take over tiles as well, depending on what kind it is. For example, some village tiles will join you peacefully if you pay enough gold, and they will provide a free "guard" unit as a result. Others may offer missions and join you upon completion.

The battling system is decent, but if you are used to the more complex battle system in Age of Wonders or the Disciples series, you might not like this as much. You get flanking bonuses against your opponent if you can maneuver behind or to the side of them. Your hero is critical to victory here, as each type (ranger/scout, mage, general, warrior) will affect your party in different ways. The wizard, for example, is very versatile (depending on what magic buildings you invest in) because he can heal, buff, debuff, and use offensive spells. He can also summon units, and investing in specific skills can allow you to keep those units after battle (if they survive and you have space in your party). You unlock more party slots as your hero levels up.

The leveling system is pretty interesting, you get 2 options for your units (for example: +health or +morale), and sometimes your units will also be considered for awards/medals. These will provide extra bonuses (like extra damage), however, they will also increase the upkeep (and this can be significant in the beginning when you do not have much income). 

Overall, the game is very fun once you know what you are doing, and persisting over the learning curve will allow you to enjoy the unique challenges Eador offers.

Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996330330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4447, 'last_played': 1430688893}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken Game.  This game could be wonderful.  It is the best Turn-Based Strategy I've ever played, and it is broken beyond belief.  I'm currently nearing 70 hours into the campaign, and I've had to relaunch the game from crash over 150 times.  

That in mind, the game is surprising in its depth of world, story, and dialogue.  It incorporates the karma alignment options of games like Fable and Mass Effect, with actions made affecting the general disposition of everyone when they talk to you.  Based on their appraisal of you, the dialogue changes entirely.  If they like you, they may be willing to divulge information, or even give you a boost forward in the campaign.  If they dislike you, they'll be curt, aggressive, and might in fact attack your home world.  The karma system is much deeper and more involved than this, and is one of the flavors swirling in the mix that made me fight through the headaches of constant bugs.

Fighting is tough.  The entire game is incredibly difficult.  There are a large number of ways to beat the game (ten?), and each feels different than the others.  Each ending makes you fight for it, and while fighting for it, the possibility for another way out crops up.

Managing the empire on each shard of the broken world is tough, and requires capitalization of what you have available.  Once I felt comfortable and confident in my skills, I raised the difficulty to the maximum, which was a nice ego check: while I did still finish the shard, it was tooth and nail.

Bottom line for this game: if you're a fan of TBS, get this game.  The developers have stayed on it consistently, improving the game since its ill-advised release.  Even given how long it has been since the game was released, it feels like it's still in Beta release.  It's a fantastic game that absorbed a large amount of time, and likely will continue to do so, but I doubt most people would be willing to fight through all the effort it has taken to get to this point in the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116845541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1404639907}
review: Eador ist ein durchaus solides Fantasy-Strategiespiel. Das System funktioniert gut und die Schlachten lassen sich vielseitig gestalten. Allerdings macht der Spieler nur sehr langsam Fortschritt und erspielt sich neue Gebäude auf äußerst zähe Art und Weise. Schade, wäre das Spieltempo höher, könnte ich Eador mehr genießen, so wird es leider recht schnell langweilig. Für die ersten 12 - 15 Stunden ist es jedoch empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996568862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1405102038}
review: Eador: Masters of the Broken World is an enjoyable game inspired by the Heroes of Might and Magic series and the King's Bounty series.  However it does stumble a bit initially.  Players who don't fully understand the game are likely to stumble at the start of games after the tutorial if they play on difficulties other than the easiest.  This is compounded by the tutorial not doing a good job of explaining how to start each match and the game forgetting to tell players some of the ways of earning experience, like exploring.  The best way to learn this game is to approach it like something out of the 90's and go read the manual.  You should also make sure to turn up the battle speed significantly to make sure that it doesn't have horrible pacing in fights.  Eador also has bugs that range from minor nuisances to crashes that force you to restart your computer.  For me, Eador froze twice in my first four hours of gameplay and made my computer lock up twice more by the time I hit twenty hours.  Assuming they are willing to risk the bugs in this game, people who enjoyed the Heroes of Might and Magic series, the King's Bounty series, or other similar games will enjoy Eador also although it generally implements each element of its gameplay in a more average manner than another similar game although it balances this out by having more elements to its gameplay than other similar games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123669278', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 93771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3647, 'last_played': 1709316815}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001784686', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 3757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2842, 'last_played': 1702535448}
review: I really enjoy it as a strategy game. Many choices, like which shards you go after, greatly affect how things go for you. I played the other Eador game and loved it, this one seems better but the different controls took me a bit to get used to. The AI can be very predictable, this is good at times but also can be very bad when things are going against you because there is little chance to fool it or evade it, it pretty much hits you as hard as it can at all times so most should start on the easiest setting. Even if not the greatest it's a steal for the price.

review:
Immer wieder gern!

Inzwischen habe ich schon viele Stunden mit Eador: Masters of the Broken World verbracht - und es fasziniert mich noch immer! Immer wieder kann man sich neuen strategischen Aufgaben stellen... und die neuen Völker und Rassen haben dem Spiel auch nochmal gut getan! 

Von den bugs, die am Anfang wirklich sehr störend waren, ist inzwischen nicht mehr viel übrig, der Service durch snowbird ist ganz ordentlich, jdenfalls habe ich von den Leuten dort hilfreiche Mails bekommen. Ich würde Eador MotBW jederzeit wieder kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979416503', 'num_games_owned': 1438, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1403926978}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken World is a remake of Eador: Genesis. It is nearly identical, with almost all changes being graphics and GUI layout. Unfortunately, they absolutely failed at the GUI. They managed to make a game that was over ten years old harder to play through a series of changes that did nothing to improve the game, only hinder players.

Eador: Genesis was an incredible game for the time, and is still highly enjoyable. If you can find it, play it instead. The few enhancements Masters of the Broken World received are not worth the investment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002493801', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 46422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46192, 'last_played': 1516242716}
review:
やっとキャンペーンモードが終わったので、レビューを書き直しました。

なお、前作にあたるEador. Genesisも、続編で現在EAのEador. Imperiumもプレイしていません。あしからず。

とあるきっかけにより、アストラル体の化身になった主人公が、アストラル体のマスターと交流し、時には、シャードと呼ばれる力の源を求めて競い合うシミュレーションゲームです。キャンペーンモードはターン制限が存在し、何かしらの勝利条件を満たせばクリアとなるマルチエンディング方式です。

ランダム生成のモード（カスタムゲーム）で遊んだり、キャンペーン（ただし、英文多め）で独特のストーリーを遊んでもよし。最低限ユニットの動かし方や、施設アンロックの順番を把握してしまえば、英語関係なくカスタムゲームで楽しめるので、ターン性タクティカルバトルが好きな人にはお勧めです。


このゲームにはまった理由

ゲームによくある"お約束"をきちんとEadorの世界観の言葉で説明してくれること

ほとんどのシミュレーションゲームは、高難易度にするとAIが賢く行動するのではなく、単純にAIに有利なようにハンデが与えられます。最新のCiv VIですら単純にブーストするだけで誤魔化していますよね。
このゲームでは、各ライバルのマスターがシャードを集めて、力をつけていくに従って、難易度が上がり、ブーストされるようになっています。大丈夫。プレイヤーのあなたも、初期ユニットを増やしたり、ヒーローを持ち越しして使えます。

ストーリーが進み、数人のマスター達と出会うと、主人公が召使に愚痴る選択肢が表示されます。内容はこんな感じ。(注：セリフはうろ覚え)

「ネクロマンサーのマスターは死者を操る法に秀で、善のマスターは神聖ユニットの扱いが得意だ。翻って私はどうだ？ 何も良いところが無いじゃないか!」

- ボス。あなただけが使える特殊能力。それは、時を自由に移動できることです。時を遡り、間違った選択をやり直したり…。(以下略)

えっと、どうやらこのゲームは[b]セーブ&ロード前提[/b]みたい？ まぁ、間違ってドラゴンの巣に飛び込んで、全滅したりすると、リカバリーがかなり大変なので、よっぽどのポリシーのある人以外は素直にロードしちゃっていいと思います。


[h1]これから始める方へ[/h1]

Eador. Masters of the Broken Worldの難易度は最も簡単なBeginnerでもそれなりに難しいので、チュートリアルが済んだら、本編は置いておいて、先にカスタムモードで自分のプレイする予定の難易度で、練習してから臨んだほうがスムーズに進むと思います。

バグかな？って思ったら

発売後、何度かアップデートを重ねましたが、戦闘中に動かなくなったり、正常に進まなくなるバグは現在も残っています。 ほとんどの場合は、CTRL+F10かF11を押して、AIに委任させれば正常に進みます。

強制終了も1～3時間に1回と、安定しているとは言い難いですが、毎ターンオートセーブしてくれるので、我慢しましょう。というより、強制終了でもしてくれないと、ゲームの止め時を忘れてしまうので親切設計です。

[h1]DLC Allied Forces について[/h1]

エルフやオーク、ドワーフといった種族を中心にユニットの種類を増やすDLCです。追加されるユニットは、特殊なユニットが多く、戦術に幅が出ます。追加マップやシナリオといった要素はありません。難点は序盤の中立地帯の占領が難しくなってしまうことでしょうか。

マルチプレイヤーで遊ぶには、DLC必須みたいですが、試してないので分かりません。

ゲームを気に入ったらDLCを購入しても、損は無いでしょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198074387172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1404296387}
review:
Uwaga użytkownicy Linuksa tudzież SteamOS - omijać grę z daleka! Gra może i jest warta swoich pieniędzy, ale na pewno nie w obecnym stadium na Linuksie. Twórcy fatalnie podeszli do kwestii wsparcia Linuksa. Niby firmują grę jego logiem i twierdzą, że gra działa. Przestrzegam jednak, gra nie ma natywnego portu dla Linuksa, a jest jedynie butelką w wine. To znaczy, że pobierana gra jest w wersji dla Windows, a następnie uruchamiana w środowisku WINE dostarczanym wraz z nią... Oczywiście w pewnych przypadkach jest to dopuszczalne np. jak gra jest bardzo stara, twórcy nie mają do niej już kodu źródłowego, czy też nie dysponują licencją, bądź występują inne problemy uniemożliwiające przygotowanie portu jak np. niekompatybilne middleware. Tymczasem tutaj mamy istny sajgon. Twórcy nie wspominają, że kupowana gra jest wersją wineskin... Więc jesteśmy oszukani. Pół biedy jakby ona jeszcze poprawnie działała. Tymczasem większość użytkowników Linuksa w tym również i ja uskarża się na fatalne wrażenia. Wiele osób nie może nawet uruchomić gry, a tym co się uda i tak na niewiele się to zdaje, bo... wydajność jest katastrofalna, w zasadzie nici po wydajności, bo i tak grą się nie nacieszymy, bo nic nie zobaczymy, gdyż gra ma ogromne błędy graficzne, które sprawiają, że praktycznie nic nie widać i gra jest niegrywalna.
Tymczasem twórcy milczą, gracze wypisują kolejne błędy, w tym ciągle podnosząc kwestię graficznych problemów... ale brak jakiegokolwiek odzewu od twórców.
Jak dla mnie, gra może i jest dobra, jednak nie na Linuksie, na nim mimo "oficjalnego" wsparcia, grać, póki co się nie da. Jeżeli deweloperzy przygotują natywny i działający port lub poprawią dostatecznie działanie tego "czegoś w wine" to może zmienię opinię, tymczasem radzę omijać grę szerokim łukiem. Nie polecam gry na Linuksa.
Dowód na graficzne anomalie:
http://cloud-2.steampowered.com/ugc/3280059407729797685/139E0006CD35379753039557042B748C235C93BA/

author: {'steamid': '76561198031201286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1610983712}
review:
As long as the game goes, it's ok. I like turn based games, and Eador didn't disappoint me. But on behalf of all Linux gamers, I have a problem. Steam should not call this a Linux game, yes it runs, but it is not playable. It has some really nasty graphical glitches in Wine. 

There was some really good moves made to port few attractive games like CivV to linux, which plays natively and not in emulator (I know Wine is not an emulator...). My point is, if you do use linux icon, at least put some notion of it being played in Wine in system requirements portion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017817542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2996, 'last_played': 1404209313}
review:
Similiar to Warlocks, Fallen Enchantress and good old Master of Magic, Eador is all about battling in a fantasy worlds with heroes and armies. While you spread your influence for gathering resources you shouldn't think you're the only one doing the same.

As it is quite typical 4X game, there are few things that makes it work quite well - if you are about to invest some time to learn the game mechanics. That's the only drawback: construction (i.e. building up land) is more complicated, because you have capital region and "provinces" - and they don't develop the same way. Once you have built up buildings in your capital region you unlock more buildings for regions. And you can have only 3 buildings up on any given province, which doesn't make sense, but it forces you to prioritise. Luckily, you can tear buildings down on provinces. I wish there was a way to do the same on capital region, because you can have only 4 types of unit recruitment buildings.

That restriction is horrible. At the beginning you need some first tier "barracks" in order to muster up your initial army to get you going anywhere. The beginning is quite rough even on lower difficulties. However, on later stages you wish you could have more variety of higher-end troops, but the cap limit won't allow you to do just that. What's even more painful, some "garrison" troops, which are different from standard troops, require also certain "barracks"-types, so you need to do some research. Later on, you get hold on that, though.

Tactical battles are like from Fallen Enchantress. They can be very hard at first, but when taking full advantage of the terrain and vegetation it is possible. I am finding the very beginning quite hard on 2nd lowest difficulty level, though I haven't played but a couple of campaign maps. Like in Fallen Enchantress, you equip your hero, while troops get automatically geared up. Both heroes and troops gain levels and when they do, you can choose an upgrade for the victorious one. And when the leader gets level-ups, you can occasionally have more unlocked slots for more troops.

Balance on economics work quite well. Gold is scarce, but if you do spare provinces' guards you are asking for trouble. On frontiers they won't save you much against enemy troops, but fortification gives you more time to get in aid with your armies. But these fortresses cost dearly. But you still need guards and pay for their upkeep, because there are plenty of events you get randomly attacked on one of your provinces. These events vary though, and some are helpful. However, the events can occur a lot. It isn't unprecendented to have got four events on your regions at the beginning of your turn.

Graphics and sounds are okayish - nothing too brilliant, but they do their job.

Definitely worth picking-up on your game library if you're into Master of Magic and/or Fallen Enchantress - especially on this summer sale. 75 per cent off is not too shabby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044430978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1387757924}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977894286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3573, 'last_played': 1406028395}
review:
The last time I extensively played Eador was back in summer of 2013, outside of Steam. The game was quite new. It had tons of bugs but it was mostly playable. However it was no secret it was unfinished and many important mechanics did not work. But the small team of developers really deserve a load of respect because now a year and dozends of patches later - after many fans may have given up their hope on Eador and even taunted the creators "Masters of the Broken Game" on their official support forums - the game is great. 

My comeback to the game today was worth and to honor the good work on the game the devs put into it I decided to buy it on Steam. I never thought they could recover this game and even more important giving the UI a needed refresh. By today the game is like it should have been at release - it is fun and can be challenging. 

There are still some drawbacks: it can be confusing to learn how to conquer the shards and how the whole works.
The AI may be still better. The monsters, items and events you face on the shards are very repetitive. Not to start talking about the music.  Apart from that I would give Eador a good 6 of 10 rating. 

If you have some time kill and you love to combine strategy with roleplay elements  it is definitely worth the few bucks it costs! In strategic aspects how creatures are fighting each other it reminds me a bit of Magic the Gathering.
 
Bad luck for Windows 8 users this game needs .NET Framework 3.5 to be installed to work properly.

I rate the game with a 7/10.

1 point less for the repetitive music and missions
1 point less for the remaining bugs (mostly AI) and crashes
1 point less for the fact you have to delete a preexisting profile and start a new campaign to unlock steam achievements, also to get access to the DLC. if you played Eador before you got it on Steam and like to play on like me, it will be troublesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137547848', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1405273079}
review:
The games looks good.   Unfortunately I get a distorted screen and despite my best efforts cannot seem to correct it.  Upon checking out the forums, I've noticed that the problem appears to be with Nvidia.  It would have been nice if the store stated that there might be incompatibilities with Nvidia graphics.  Another things that bothers me is this is not a true linux port.  It's running on wine-which wouldn't bother me, if I could actually play the game.  Please correct these issues.  I do not like giving negative reviews.  The game looks like a great game with a lot of potential and I would really want to give it a positive review.  

I do not recommend this game until they sort out some of the bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098496720', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1477302920}
review: случайно наткнулся на эту игру,подкупила схожесть ее с небезызвестными третими героями,даже и не думал что так затянет,отличий много,при чем таких,которые добавляют интерес,чего только стоят случайные события которые предоставляют не только моральный выбор,но  и бывает,мощные артефакты,из плюсов стоит отметить приятную графику,музыку,интуитивно понятный интерфейс,нелинейное развитие замка(приходится думать что построить,так как построить все - невозможно)армию(здесь она не прикрывается цыферками,каждой паре по одной штуке,и каждый солдат к тому же растет в уровне и статах как и герой)исследование провинций(герой чтоб апнутся не обязательно должен с обмыленой ж бегать по всей карте в поисках опыта,он может просто постоять возле замка исследуя территорию)более продуманая боевка чем в героях,даже не смотря на мощные войска приходится думать кого ударить и как,ведь потеря своего высокоуровневого солдата скажется не лучшим образом на силе отряда. из минусов стоит отметить читерность бот-оппонента,к примеру если у тебя по сюжету армия первоуровневая,то у него уж может быть и вторые лвл(к слову,в игре присутствует только 4 уровня мобов,4 можно наннять только 1,да и то надо хорошо вкачать героя для этого) и также поломка экипированых предметов,что очень затрудняет жизнь и заставляет частенько мотатся к замку,особенно для лучника и мага,так как стрелы и сферы имеют очень мало единиц прочностит. в целом оценка позитивная,любители пошаговых - берите,не пожалеете
