author: {'steamid': '76561198108019383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2375, 'last_played': 1622541426}
review:
A decent turn-based strategy game with RPG elements. If you like games like Heroes of might and Magic, and Kings Bounty, this would definitely be a game to consider.

[u]PROS[/u]
Does what you would expect of the core elements very well.
A lot of variety; units, weapons, tactics, etc.
A lot of tactical debth.


[u]CONS[/u]
Not for everyone, the lack of pace can be frustrating for some.
There is a bit of a learning curve, especially for managing your city.
AI balancing, it does cheat.

If you like this type of games, and are a completionist to boot, you will be in for a long experience. The nature of progression makes your heroes start over each map/realm. And extensive possibilities of exploring provinces under your control makes it hard for you to decide weather to explore the land you have, or conquer more. And the AI tends to act in a Zerglike manner on the map if you dilly-dally too long. That being said, if you like games mentioned above there is a lot of hours of fun to get here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990739079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 33453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9232, 'last_played': 1675486592}
review:
A very fun fantasy strategy game where you control various commanders to take different shards, which act as randomly generated maps. Each shard gives you more power, abilities, units, and buildings. You have to balance gathering shards with dealing with enemy masters who are trying to do the same thing. 

The game would be quite a lot more fun if it was not so buggy, which is its most biting issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031749387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1399151054}
review:
You can blame me for not playing it enough, but after over 10h of playtime, the game did not get me hooked, not at all.
And i honestly think it's sad. The art is amazing, the sound atmospheric, the story... might be interesting, i can barely tell though and i think you can see the love and thought which went into this game, there are a lot of nice concepts packed into it. But, for me, the actual gameplay is so horrible that i don't even want to touch it anymore despite all the things that seem so nice about it.

Here is why: I like turn based strategy games, i've been playing Heroes of Might and Magic (oh no, so mainstream?!) since decades, tried every installement and Eador reminds me very much of it. But, while Heroes is definetly not the fastest game, it has a pace i can go along with, its mechanics interlock well into one another (usually, not the same for all of them and all the titles), so it is nice to be invested in them, fighting your way through the campaign with what little things might be given to you, or watching your puny town thrive to a huge empire in an open game, or make to many or one big mistake and probably fail. I think, this is not the case in Eador. There is a lot you can do, but to me none of it felt like i was achieving anything. Spending dozens of turns to explore one area, most of which is delivered in text, sometimes fighting encounters, most of which appeared meaningless to me, sometimes dieing to a threat i couldn't even determine beforehand, or when the game even told me "this should be easy" and my units get one-hitted one after another, because i coudln't know better - more than once, but then, maybe i could have known better after the first time - careing less and less about the individual parts of the game because it feels so tedious, until i even started skipping most encounters and finaly stopped playing.

So, i can't recommend it despite all its nice parts, because, after 10 hours of playtime, the game should have proven to me why i should care to carry on and not feel like a bunch of tasks i ought but not like to do to maybe get anywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010172974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4870, 'last_played': 1400272874}
review:
The game has a large amount of rather interesting mechanics; for instance units gain new abilities as they level up and some of them change them dramatically (fairies get a dodge ability that makes it so being attacked by a higher level enemy makes them retreat unless they are cornered or out of stamina for instance). It is a pity that units are so relatively fragile you won't be seeing any of that most of the time. Heroes are relatively overpowered to everything so the game turns into leveling them up and dungeon crawling for money sidling the rest of the military and economic development that exists in game.

Given the amount of bugs this game has, I doubt they'll be fixing that fundamental issue which turns the game into a boring slog to level up your hero and then smash your opponent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006135158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1683980597}
review:
Сначала скачал с торрента, но после нескольких дней "тестирования" решил прикупить. Поддержать разработчиков, так сказать. Действительно, достойный проект. Давненько я не играл во что-то подобное. 
Недавно увидел обзор, где пользователю не понравилось, что в игре одна играбельная раса. Видимо его не смутил внушительный список построек (около двухста) и количество комбианций для создания государства. В "Эадоре" игрок ведет королевство по тому пути, по которому хочет, а не следует по рельсам, установленных фракцией, как это обычно и бывает. Да, все бои начинаются одинако, но уже ближе к середине каждый правитель имеет собственную уникальную империю, не похожую на все остальные. Упомянутый выше набор постоек этому способствует, так же как и разнообразные юниты, которые доступны лишь на определенных путях развития.
Короче говоря, если вы считаете, что, на сегодняшний день,  нет достойных пошаговых стратегий, то купите "Эадор" и разочаруйтесь:) Они, таки, еще есть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013119250', 'num_games_owned': 2231, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1403448784}
review:
Tytuł dobry dla każdego fana takich gier jak Heroes of Might and Magic czy Kings Bounty. Oczywiście Eador posiada swoje oryginalne i unikalne dla tego typu rozwiązania - jak przykładowo bardzo duża...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kLft_I81smg

... "autonomia" regionów, które zamieszkują różnorodne istoty. Innymi zaletami tej gry są ciekawe wykonane opcje dyplomacji oraz cała masa zadań pobocznych mogących posiadać różnorodne zakończenia. Dzięki temu nigdy nie wiemy, co przytrafi się kiedy jakieś zadanie ukończymy. Do innych zalet należy niska cena gry - spokojnie można ją dostać po kilkanaście złotych (a nie euro!) dzięki temu, że była dostępna bardzo tanio na Humble Bundle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042457840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20253, 'last_played': 1420197158}
review: I played this early on when it still had tons of bugs and I loved it, it is an unforgiving game with a challenging learning curve. For a fantasy strategy game this ranks amongst the top for me, this game got the rough edges like that of an old school fantasy game and its content is vast..

author: {'steamid': '76561198059331653', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2359, 'last_played': 1370101906}
review:
This is an interesting game, which sadly suffers from dated mechanics.  While I'm posting this as a negative recommendation, if it's on sale, and you enjoy this genre it's certainly worth picking up, but with the current choice on the market there are just better options out there in the turn based strategy feel.
The slow development of technology from shard to shard is a great selling point of the game, as is the picking and choosing of which shards to capture to add to your range, however the starting afresh on every shard gets old very fast, and the interface is not particularly friendly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088277239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1465237839}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081745026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 58087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23320, 'last_played': 1657396177}
review: Великолепная игра, незаслуженно обделенная вниманием большинства игроков. Если бы было можно я бы заставлял играть в такие игры силой. Eador, настоящий “Олд Скульный” титан, пробужденный ото сна, подарок для всех любителей и ценителей  старых добрых пошаговых стратегий. Eador, являет собой один из лучших TBS, с невероятно огромным количеством плюсов (невозможно перечислить) и незначительным количеством минусов, самым значительным из которых пожалуй является затянутость начала. Что бы понять вкус игры нужно минимум отыграть часов 50,,,да да и это не покроит и 10% от продолжительности компании и игровых возможностей которыми располагает игра. Не нужно никаких сомнений, обязательно качайте и наслаждайтесь.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970922684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1403394058}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009799388', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1567266114}
review:
Игра затягивает. Снова эти бессонные ночи: "Еще ход, захвачу соседнюю провинцию и точно спать" :) 
Из плюсов:
1. Красивая, не раздражающая графика
2. Возрастающая сложность
3. Довольно длинная компания, что может быть и минусом
4. Сбалансированые воины

Минусы:
1. Мало изменений по сравнениб с предшественнице. Можно сказать, что те же яйца, но сбоку.
2. Очень много боев, любой шаг в чужую или нейтральную территорию - битва
3. Однообразие в компании. Вам нужно захватывать осколки мира, чтобы не свергнуться в хаос. Все осколки захватываются по одной схеме, что наскучивает.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027399921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4390, 'last_played': 1624639397}
review:
Good strategic game. 
The main advantage is that there are a lot of possibilities. There is no unbalanced/unbeatable combination of units, so you can play the game your style. For example Forests is good cover against ranged attacks and hills give you an advantage in melee fights. You don't have to kill all units, you can also reduce their moral to zero or reduce their stamina (that won't grant you the victory, but makes it way easier to kill them ;))

The Game is still a little bit buggy and freezes sometimes when you start a new shard and you have to play a different shard instead.

The Game develops slowly, you have to conquer a shard and as reward you get plans to build new buildings. You get the first tier II units after 3-4 shards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140824230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1403344365}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015495444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5729, 'last_played': 1488195783}
review:
I reccomend this game, although it has many cons. It is still a very nice turn based strategy game! The whole concept is that the world have divided into pieces (shards) and you are a God that fights with other gods for conquering shards. It's time you attack in a shard you starts a turn based battle that you pick heroes and troops and you have to destroy enemies fort before he destroys yours. ALso you will have to kill creatures and do quests to loot gold and items so your army becomes stronger. After you win (or lose) you go for new shards.

Pros
-Nice Storyline, memoriable characters, very nice dialogues
-Atmosphere of the graphics
-Units nicely crafted with interesting abilities and stats
-Many spells option
-Strategy Options
-Nice combat system

+- Very Hard (even in low difficulties)

- Many bugs, you will have to load previously game very very often because of game crashes. Also in sometimes you will not have some options in your campaign because the game will always crash if you pick the "x" option. It tests your nerves to their limits
- After sometime you will do the same strategy again and again and this leads to a boring gameplay. In truth Warrior is the best hero for the start of the game and some first rank units are much better than others. (Also second ranks,third and fourth)

So you may ask why i continue to play a game that has so many bugs and it's a litthle boring after some hours of play. Well that's because of the beautiful world. It's because the motive that give's me that the game in the third easier difficulty (of the 9!) it is not easy at all! It's is bexause i want to discover all the items, spells and generally the option tha the game gives you. It's because each dialogue of the game is a piece of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035851030', 'num_games_owned': 813, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1408651815}
review:
Linux logo is just for show. All they did is ship Wine with this, apparently without bothering to test it. The wrapper does allow the launching of the game but the graphics are garbled and the game is unplayable. This problem seems to appear mostly on nVidia binary drivers. There are a number of discussion threads about the problem here on Steam and on their own forums but as of yet the developers haven't issued any statements about this. Apparently they suck.

Wine wrapper IS NOT a Linux port. There should be a warning about this on the store page.

As for the game itself. I don't have a clue. I can't play it. If a miracle happens and it becomes playable at some point I might have to review the game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082503569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1403316766}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044092566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3393, 'last_played': 1598561185}
review:
Забавная игра. Сильно отличается от всего ранее мною сыграного, а играл я много ... Напоминает чем то цивилизацию .. Видимо тем, что даже если на какое-то время бросил в нее играть, чуть позже все равно возвращаешься. 
Но игра не обошлась без минусов и в первую очередь это проблема с багами. Буквально каждое обновление борется с предыдущими багами и к сожалению приносит какие-то новые. Тем не менее я рекомендую игру, уж очень хорошая задумка, приятная для меня графика и просто интересная игра за в принципе не такие большие деньги

author: {'steamid': '76561197963538243', 'num_games_owned': 2982, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1403293506}
review: Kjedelig i lengden

author: {'steamid': '76561198031702366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9679, 'last_played': 1550926008}
review:
OK. I've played this game quite a bit now. It is like the best game ever? No. But its quite good. The hours seem to fly at times when i play it. Its one of those "Just One More Turn!" kind of games.
Each board is kinda alike after a while, just with a tiny more options or differences from the last.
So no doubt after a while, perhaps you get enough... for a while.
Then you'll probably be back later on, and once more you'll see the days whiff past.

After having had several such moments over the months, its definatly got a recommendation from me if you like the turnbased strategy game genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006194682', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3081, 'last_played': 1397406392}
review:
Bellissimo gioco, all'inizio sembra molto difficile ma poi una volta capite alcune tattiche diventa molto più facile.
Tecnicamente è ottimo, è uno strategico simile ad altri con movimenti e combattimenti a turni ma l'ambientazione è davvero unica e originale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020779572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20948, 'last_played': 1567210623}
review:
Highly Recommended by me if you like Fantasy style Civ games, It plays similar to my favorite mod of all time; RiFe for Civ 4 - mixed with turn based Might and Magic type stuff. The elements of being able to Explore every province is pretty darn fun, and allows for alot of time to sink into a map. But by far the biggest pull for me in the game is the campaign; Imagine starting a game of Civ with a tech cap on most buildings/units. Choosing which "shards" to attack allows you to get new bonuses and slowly unlock everything. It's pretty awesome to have that sort of Metagame aspect to it. seeing as i can easily run through a million and and a half games of Civ that extra layer of progression was really fun to me. If you've got time and enjoy that type of game i'd recommend it to anyone. it's a grade A droning game. 

It's more a game of unlocking and and collecting items to upgrade your hero/buff your armies that civilization upgrading, but it works well i feel. and the different spells and unit types definitly give you the ability to mix it up a bit and find whatever is fun for you. That's the best part about this game is it tends to just let you go whatever path you want (beacuse most all paths will eventually let you win lol)

But, Pick it up if it's on sale, and Take care all!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074394347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1403205109}
review: Linux port is just a badly done Wine wrapper. Uses 100% CPU, graphics are totally bugged.

review: Всегда был противником DLC,  по большому счету это даже не вопрос денег, которые неадекватны а вопрос разьития игры на части... что делает её зачастую неоднородной. Да и то самое чувтсов когда ты купил что-то а через некоторое время осознал что тебе продали кастрированую демоверсию. Игра до сих пор не лишена багов, да и сам геймплей за счет наличия всего одной игровой рассы приедается. И DLC на 12 юнитов этот вопрос явно не решит...

author: {'steamid': '76561198000604423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1399036863}
review: Als die ersten Konzepte dieses Spiels zu mir durchdrangen wurde mir, der sich immer eine Mischung aus den zwei wohl besten rundenbasierenden Strategiespielen (Civilizations und Heroes of Might and Magic), ganz warm ums Herz. Was ist da nur schiefgelaufen? Schielend und Stammelnd traf ich diesen halbherzig gezeugten Hybriden an, der mir mit seiner öden, leeren Welt Spieltiefe vorzugaukeln gedachte, mich mit einer lahmen, zweckmäßigen und bestenfalls albernen (nicht jedoch humorvollen) Story zu bannen versuchte. Wie hätte ich Freude empfinden können, bei einem Kampfsystem, das schlicht alles Schlechte der HOMAM-Serie behielt um das Gute zu tilgen, gespickt mit Bugs, die strategisches Denken wohl unmöglich machen, schwerfällig, wie ein Marionettentheater, aufgeführt von einer Selbsthilfegruppe valiumsüchtiger Phlegmatiker. Das alles wird schließlich noch breitgetreten und ausgedehnt, bis dieser zähe Kaugummi, der schon nach zehn Minuten seinen Geschmack verliert, Dimensionen erreicht, in die ich gerne meine schlimmsten Feinde verbannen möchte. Zusammenfassend ist zu sagen, dass man hier eine Menge sparen kann, wenn man seinen Wurzeln treu bleibt und geduldig bei der HOMAM, sowie bei der Civ-Reihe bleibt, was wohl in Anbetracht der Tatsache, dass sich auf die meisten Teile überhaupt kein Verriss schreiben lässt, eine lohnende Alternative bietet. Und vielleicht kommt - eines schönen Tages - vielleicht doch noch ein Hybrid zwischen diesen beiden genialen Klassikern auf den Markt, der meine feuchten Träume wahr werden lässt und die bittere Erinnerung an "Eador: Masters of the Broken World" ins Reich des Vergessens schickt, wo es meiner Meinung nach auch eindeutig hingehört.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981356193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1411009237}
review:
I love turn based strategy games.  This game looks and feels a lot like Heroes of Might & Magic, but it has some flaws that holds it down from it’s true potential.  I’m writing this review for the TBS fans that know what they are looking for, and noting the exact flaws that ruin the game.

There are four tiers of strength for your recruitable units.  Each recruitable unit can level up.  However, no matter what high level they attain, they are really no match for the next higher tier unit.  No units can be resurrected, which can be infuriating when your tier 1, level 10 infantry is eliminated by a tier 3, level 0 archer in one strike.  I tried to cycle through my troops by only using my low levels to fight low level battles, but then you realize that your higher tiers would rather benefit from the experience, as they will need all they can get when they have to take on tier 4 enemies.  On top of that, the opponent AI will always bee-line to your weakest and most exploitable units first.  Battles have to be sought out, but are abundant.  The problem is low level encounters are just as rare as high level encounters.  All encounters are preset, and you can choose when to take on the encounter.  You might find yourself scouring the lands trying to find goblins for your tier 1, level 0s to knock out, wasting many turns in the process.  The best way to level up your army is for them to see combat head on, which makes it tough to build up solid armies without losing a few in the process.  I found myself sometimes recruiting low levels as simple cannon fodder or bait.  No units have a ‘taunt’ ability, so no unit can be used for ‘tanking.’ This greatly hurts the whole point of playing as a warrior type CO, and puts heavy armor defense infantry in a tough spot.  Most units can run or fly circles around them.  Terrain does play a role in mobility and stat adjustments, but not so much that it becomes a game changer.  Battles ultimately end up being very lopsided, with little actual strategy.

If it wasn’t for the core of the strategy being flawed, it would be a fantastic gem.  The graphics are very pleasing to the eye.  The soundtrack is limited and repetitive like an old console game, but can be turned off.  The interface may look intimidating at first, but it is simply spread out and unconsolidated, which doesn’t affect gameplay.  I only recommend it to those with a tremendous amount of patience and time on their hands.  Expect campaigns to take many hours at a time, and anticipate never being able to take on many battles due to the limits of what army you can develop.  In short, expect disappointment, but do your best with what you have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033617861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 9064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4981, 'last_played': 1594501893}
review:
If you are a linux user DON'T BUY THIS GAME!!!!

The developer promised the game to be available in linux more than a year ago, and the only thing he did after all this time in that direction is making the game run under wine (and it doesn't even do it right). There is NO PORT for linux on this game.

About the game itself... it has a lot of good ideas, but poorly carried, so... no, I don't recomend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073213855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4377, 'last_played': 1479566228}
review:
Aptly named title. With a significant overhaul this game could be something but in its current state it is badly "broken". This game will frustrate which makes it in many ways worse than a overtly bad game (at least with a bad game you could move on). As it is this one will have you going, "I wonder if it would be different if I tried this... or this...". 

It won't be. 

As things go this game prescribes too tightly the path you must take to be successful. Buy these units, not those ones, do things in this order and this way. Fight this, don't fight that until this, etc.

As a huge fan of TBS and fantasy genre and long time (decades) player of same. I don't recommend this game. What I do recommend is that some developers out there learn from these guys mistakes and make the game that this should have been.

EDIT/TLDR: Buy Age of Wonders III instead...

author: {'steamid': '76561198016222329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3798, 'last_played': 1402716104}
review: This game is intriguing at first, and the tutorial even tricks you into thinking it will be fun. This is far from the reality of the game. In truth, even the beginning difficulty level is more frustrating than it is worth. I have tried multiple strategies from single to multiple heroes of different classes, conservative and liberal spending. None of it matters. By the time you get any momentum in the game you are harried by your opponent and relentlessly picked off. If resources were plentiful this would be an acceptable challenge as you could build your defenses, hire support, and actually dream to achieve something. The problem is that when this happens you are typically stretched. Conservative play is likely key, but to be honest - I don't f*ing play a game to sit around for hours twiddling my thumbs. Yes, it's strategy, but different people like different strategy. I for one do not like this one. I'd rather play Civ, or most any other tactics game. Save your time and money - and buy something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014458793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1409869998}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972504347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1524619895}
review:

Not only is it wine, it has the same bugs from the winehq site, corrupted graphics that make it unplayable...looks like they could not do it natively easily enough so they slapped us in the face and are charging 20 bucks for a purely wine wrapped game, and didn't even bother to fix the GLARING GRAPHICS CORRUPTION, and to make it worse they have not even responded to complaints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 252, 'playtime_forever': 26913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3601, 'last_played': 1486020592}
review:
Very good Fantasy TBS game. I'm not sure yet if this 3D-remake is better or worse than original 2D "Eador: Genesis". No doubt that it is now harder to recognise 3D-terrain in battles, but there are some improvements too.

So why I think it is very good game?

Quite original, great story, superb battle mechanics and characters progression. Just as an example - in how many modern TBS games mages _remember_ spells to use them in battles?

If we come to downsides then there is one for sure as well. Eador is somehow repetitive, what _mostly_ comes from simply too long story and too many battles in process. Original "Eador: Genesis" you would probably need to play few months non-stop to reach the victory (or defeat). This one is shorter/quicker (4x times!).

Now let's check for possible comparisons...

- Player builds his own castle similary to classic Heroes of Might & Magic, just here there are much more buildings and most of them locked at start. As example player don't have access to native tier 2 units until he conquers an amount of new worlds (maps/shards).

- Shards (maps) are divided into regions which are explored by heroes. I do see some similarities here to Dominions game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046676880', 'num_games_owned': 1772, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1402334249}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022751934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 12301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9531, 'last_played': 1403973523}
review:
Eador is the first strategy game I've really been able to sink my teeth into. And that's saying something, because I seem like the kind of person to enjoy strategy games...

The reason for this is because the game remains paletable throughout. I think the thing that typically drives me away from strategy games a few hours in is that, once you start to amass resources and turn those resources into troops, etc., there's so much to take care of at any one time that it's too easy to lose track of anything or [i]every[/i]thing.

Eador isn't like that. While you can [i]eventually[/i] get a gigantic army, colossal empire, and a mountain of resources, the buildup to that is very slow and easy to take in. Your armies are led by heroes, which cost exponentially more for each successive one, and each hero only starts with the capacity to have three units in its army (except for one, which starts with four slots). Over time, they'll level up and be able to lead more troops.

Essentially, this leads to a strategy game where the most important resource is time. Hard limits are set on just how much you can do in a single turn, so, rather than a game where the first guy to get a billion troops wins, you get a game where the guy to best optimize his time wins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029403705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1438894685}
review:
Не знаю, что с игрой было полгода назад, если сейчас это просто невыносимо. 2 провинции рядом с родовым замком не могу захватить, потому что бой виснет на ходе противника. Локации бесплатной ДЛЦ "Дар богов" не работают - надо видите ли начать новую игру. А там переигрывать ой сколько... Что-то мне подсказывает, что с платным ДЛЦ будет та же песня.

Даже 50 рублей на распродаже, мне кажется было много за "это", особенно если вспомнить, что в оригинале, сделанным 1 человеком с таким же геймплеем (в основном изменилась только графика) глюков было меньше.
Может вернусь к игре через полгода - вдруг все заработает...
Хотя, да, игра хороша).

author: {'steamid': '76561197991413819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 19338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4272, 'last_played': 1537061960}
review:
AVOID AVOID AVOID

This is a port of a decades old game that adds nothing but bugs, glitches and buglitches. Hours and hours into the game (it did suck me in with its apparent complexity and challenge) I learned that the AI wasn't playing the same game I was. This is the epitome of cheating AI.

AVOID. AVOID.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030703081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5535, 'last_played': 1501728158}
review:
This has got to be one of the buggyest games ive ever played.  there are long load times when the enemy units start their turns, saves some times fail to load, and sometimes an enemy will drop to 0 hp but remain alive without the ability to attack or be attacked; preventing you from finishing a match.  Oh and by the way it crashes your PC

That being said this is game is rediculaously fun.  if the bigger (and frankly obvious) bugs are fixed this would be amongst my all time favorite games

author: {'steamid': '76561197968430427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 4850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4850, 'last_played': 1401409248}
review:
This game is still way too buggy and crash prone. If you pick it up for a couple of bucks or in a indie bundle then fine, but I wouldn't recommend buying it for the list price.

I've spent 80 hours so far and I'm only still at the beginning of the "campaign". Unfortunately I've come across a game ending bug and it turns out I've wasted all my time so far. FFFFFUUUUUUUU...

As for actual gameplay and the "campaign", it appears that there is no unit progression from mission to mission. Spend 4 hours building up your army's general? Start again at level 0 the next mission. So it's like playing an RPG where you restart the entire game every few hours. Maddening!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048490108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1681593526}
review: Игра отличная и не надоедает, займёт не один вечер. Музыкальное сопровождение великолепное. Геймплей очешуителен, особенно радует множество рандомных событий, происходящих там и тут. Уровень персонажа и юнитов в армии реально влияет на исход боя, равно как и действия игрока, общий сюжет довольно интересен, игра изобилует диалогами. Однако её плюс - её минус - игра займёт не один вечер и если вы хотите просто узнать сюжет, то вы попали не в ту игру, здесь нужно подумать и попотеть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119412039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1399472435}
review: Отличный ремейк старого доброго Эадора.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071146441', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1646, 'last_played': 1438864076}
review:
Я наслаждаюсь этой игрой.
Серьёзно.
Начнём с плюсов.
Отличная атмосфера,хорошая картинка,затягивающий геймплей,приятное звуковое оформление.Это если вкратце.
Если подробнее о плюсах:
1)Перво-наперво,есть отыгрыш роли.Здесь мы можем отыгрывать либо хорошего правителя,либо,соответственно,плохого.Делается это посредством выбора вариантов в диалогах,а также реакции на случайные события.И если,скажем,в Героях всё поддавалось математическому просчёту,то здесь так не выйдет - кто угодно может стать жертвой (или счастливцем) некоего события.
Случайные события делятся на логические и неожиданные.Скажем,ваша провинция рядом с землями дикарей?Будьте добры сдерживать постоянные грабительские набеги (и плохое настроение жителей).Плохое здравоохранение?Эпидемии тут как тут.А есть и события,которые просчитать не выйдет - зависят они в первую очередь от кармы (игровой),а также ряда факторов.Как то - появление всяческих торговцев,колдунов,нахождение кладов и прочие (не всегда приятные) прелести.
Это значит,что перед нами не просто TBS с элементами прокачки,а полноценная TBS-RPG.Хотите быть благородным и честным правителем?Приготовьтесь к плохому состоянию казны.А ведь добро должно быть не только с кулаками,но и с толстым кошельком.Отыгрываете злодея?Тут уже минус в основном в войсках - зато они дешевле обходятся,чем у "светлых".И правильно - пушечное мясо никто не считает,это вам не лощёные "добрые" рыцари.
И это только верхушка айсберга.
2)А сколько вариантов застройки родовой провинции - десятки зданий,и построить выйдет далеко не все - нужно всегда планировать наперёд развитие.Иначе ваша империя вскоре прикажет долго жить.
3)Как уже писал выше - картинка хорошая.Приятная цветовая гамма и общий визуальный стиль.Впрочем,те,кто играет в TBS,знают,что в таких играх графика - это вообще чуть ли не последнее,на что надо обращать внимание.Но здесь она в порядке.Понравился и общий сказочный стиль - на осколках кипит обычная жизнь,но стоит отвести камеру в сторону - и вот она,чернота космоса,наполненная звёздами и летающими кометами.Это - напоминание о том,что некогда единый мир Эадор ныне уничтожен,и разбит на осколки,за которые и воюют местные Владыки - стремясь собрать мир воедино.Под своей властью,конечно же.А где-то там,вдалеке,маячит вторжение Хаоса.
4)Музыка хорошо идёт фоном,и не давит на уши.А это уже само по себе плюс.
Теперь о минусах.
Я не застал те времена,когда игра была жутко забагована.На данный момент багов практически нет.Но увы,они присутствуют - временами игра вылетает,к примеру.Благо,автосохранение есть,так что не беда.И ещё,в какой-то степени минус (лично для меня) - когда играю в TBS,всегда хочется сделать ещё один ход.Думаешь - ну вот,ещё ход - и спать.А потом на следующий ход происходит сразу ряд событий,и про завершение игры уже забываешь.Ах да,ещё для кого-то может быть минусом продолжительность как кампании,так и сражений на крупных осколках.

Оценки игр числом я не ставлю из принципа (я же не игрожур).Так что просто делюсь мыслями и впечатлениями.Если готовы часами просиживать за развитием провинции,скурпулёзно прокачивать героя,постоянно балансировать на грани краха экономики (особенно актуально для начала игры), и отыгрывать роль,а также закрывать глаза на некоторые шероховатости - добро пожаловать.
Я и сам люблю вечерок-иной посидеть,да посражаться за очередной осколок.Эта игра абсолютно точно войдёт в копилку одних из самых любимых для меня.Игра,в которую приятно возвращаться.

P.S. Это 3D ремейк первой версии - "Эадор:Сотворение".Не то чтобы важно,но придумал и в одиночку создал эту игру киевлянин Алексей Бокулев (ранее работавший в небезызвестной GSC Game World).Ремейком же занимается московская студия Snowbird Games.Это не решающий фактор,но всё равно приятно,что играешь не в заморскую игру.
Готовы поддержать отечественного производителя?

author: {'steamid': '76561198028266595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1412171944}
review: My specs far outweigh the game requirements. Even the intro cinematic lags so much it's unwatchable. 'Nuff said? It would be an 'alright' game if it wasn't incredibly shoddy in terms of how much memory it uses. Many games exist with far higher hardware requirements that run better than this poor example of a 4X game. The battle mechanics are so simple that I'm amazed anyone finds this game challenging. I've had the game for at least a year now and none of the issues I or other players have had have been fixed by any patches or ongoing work. As far as I can tell, this game is a scam. Don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993729292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 6901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5685, 'last_played': 1659679887}
review:
A very clever 4X that follows in the footsteps of King's Quest and Heroes of Might and Magic, but adds plenty of its own to the genre. The scale of the game is horrifying, it's taken me several days to beat my first randomly generated scenario out of what promises to be a 50-100 scenario long campaign.

There's a huge amount of content and plenty to do every turn, but it's presented in an efficient way and turns go quickly.

The game isn't exactly unpolished, but it has some splinters that could be sanded down. Expect a harmless crash every 24 hours or so. There's one bug that can hit fairly often and prevents kills from registering, especially on retaliatory hits and especially on slower combat speeds. It can be resolved without incident by autoresolving at the end of combat and almost always works in the player's favour, blocking its AI reenforcements and almost never occurs on the highest combat speed, which I would recommend using either way, because the second slowest is much too slow. There are other cases in the game where the settings are not as delicate as they perhaps aught to be.

The game seems to be a direct remake of Eador: Genesis. I prefer this version, but there's not a lot between them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993617026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 30801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10074, 'last_played': 1666871420}
review:
A long time ago I wrote.

Nice game, and seemed to be bug free before the patch. Multiplayer is only the custom battles though, so not everything it pretends to be and who knows if it is actually working or not...

The game is stable in single player, very few crashes. Auto save to the rescue.

Its a great little 4x game, not your generic 'Hey, lets rip off Civ!'

I can come back to it time and again, for a long game or short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010013436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1464668550}
review: Bought this game on sale. Though the developers have made quite a few updates to the game, it's clear they do not have the staff or talent to make this game complete. One year later, it's still riddled with bugs, crashes constantly, and save files continue to become corrupt. Do not buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001771241', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1676, 'last_played': 1441082135}
review:
これは、かなり気合の入ったストラテジーだ。
システムもわりと複雑なので、まずはキャンペーンを一番下の難易度で始めましょう。
徐々にやることが増えて覚えていけるようになっています。

イベントなどで頻繁に英語を読まされるので、ある程度の英語力は必要です。
このイベントの選択次第で民の不満が高まって、反乱が起きたりする。
選択肢の下の方に「そんな事をいちいち報告する奴は処刑しろ！」というのがあって、いかにもロシア的で面白い。
もちろんこれを選んでもどうしようもないのだが、だんだん面倒になって片っ端から処刑したくなってしまう。
まあ反乱が起きたら軍隊送って制圧すればいいじゃん、という考え方もあります。

バグだらけでゲームにならん！みたいなレビューを見かけますが、私の環境では全くそんなことはありませんでした。
HPが0になった敵が残るという、しょーもないバグがありましたが、それもアプデで解消されています。

author: {'steamid': '76561198060151590', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1404599662}
review: I have been into Strategy games for about a year and a half now, have it RTS or Hex-Based. I love Strategy games, I love the strategy, I love that you need to care and protect your army in som RTS's or Hex-Based Strategy games. But this one falls a bit short of both of those. I love this game, do not get me wrong. I only have three hours in this game but it is still a fantastic Hex-Based for what it is. After you get your armor and weapon set down, you need no strategy to win battles. When your troops die, you don't need to worry since you can get 6,000 gold in the first hour and a half so you can constantly buy more and more troops, and you constantly get Gems which is currency for mage troops or buildings. You can have buildings in your kingdom to hire new troops or entertain your city population, etc. This is fun nonetheless, but one major bug (which is common, but not at all an annoyance) is the zero HP bug. Sometimes when an enemy reaches zero HP, they are still alive and you need to auto-attack in order to complete the battle. Other than that bug and the simplicity then comes into play with no strategy, if I had to rate this game, I'd give it a 7.5/10. If you would like to, check my FaceBook page, Gaming Reviews, for more reviews of many games! https://www.facebook.com/pages/Gaming-Reviews/496509297065566

author: {'steamid': '76561198000407356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8111, 'last_played': 1624937377}
review: I really liked this game.  But I recommend not buying it.  The developer provides frequent updates (that's good).  Those updates, as often as not, introduce new bugs that range from annoying to completely gamebreaking.  Until the developers find a way to quality control their updates before releasing them to production, I can't recommend this otherwise enjoyable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979537904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3025, 'last_played': 1410331435}
review:
It's got a bit of a stiff learning curve and the tutorial is actually kind of weird / buggy. I'm a fan of Civ / Master of magic type games and that's what this is. Dozens of "shards" each being a unique world ruled by one or more local lords and possibly a higher being (similar to you). You can use diplomatic relations with the higher beings or just fight everything, be a kind rule and loved or a tyrant and feared. Take things be force and pillage or grow and build. 

Every shard you claim unlocks new spells, troops and items so it's motivation to go for the hard ones. All in all a really fun game with a good auto save, buggy at times but auto save bails you out and you really open it up / start to enjoy a couple shards in so stick with it / power past the tutorial and the 1st demo shard if you can and you'll be rewarded with a lovely game.

review:
Very good game :)

Its really good combination of genres.
It matteres if your economy is good, if you take care of morale both of provinces, and army. But it is not build billions of units and rush, each unit is more important, as it is cost of having it in your army. If you liked homm3 its this combined with civ :) and without stacking of dragons/skeletons/... get it and try it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007822637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 43399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19313, 'last_played': 1617853002}
review:
UPDATE 1/2016:

A lot of the bugs seem to be fixed, though a few might remain. I'm switching this to a *very cautious* thumbs up. (By the way, my hours in the game are exaggerated. One of the many bugs is that when the game crashed, it didn't end the process in the task manager. So, I once had the process running for a week straight, adding a couple hundred hours to my play time).

ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW:

So many bugs! I really really want to enjoy this game. And for long stretches, I do enjoy it... and then a gamebreaking bug causes all of my progress to be lost. This happens over and over again. I keep coming back, so at its heart it is a good game. Every time there is a patch to fix a bug, several new bugs pop up in its place. 

Most recently, they put out a big patch, calling it free DLC, and supposedly fixed bugs. It introduced an obvious, gamebreaking bug right up front that makes the game unplayable (enemy units won't die, they just sit on the battlefield at 0 health).

Here is a list of some other bugs I've encountered in previous builds, some of which may still be present (I don't know, since the game is unplayable on the first shard now)

1) I attacked another master, and won the final battle to take the shard. This results in a "game over" screen (this ruined my longest campaign, and even happened when I went to beat a different shard first, then returned to that master).
2) My provinces are invincible. An enemy master will defeat my guards at a province, then retreat the next turn, with the province still under my control and my guards at full health
3) I attack a province and end up in a mirror match, where I control both of my identical armies against one another. No matter which side wins, I both win and lose the battle. 
4) Game freezing and crashing to desktop immediately after conquering a shard. It goes to the main astral screen, the conquered shard comes towards my shard, and the game crashes as soon as they merge. 
5) The enemy AI completely forgetting to play the game. I once took over an entire master's shard with the enemy hero having never been beyond one hex of his capital. This was on a large map.

I cannot recommend this game in its current state. It's been a year of heartache for me, since I want to play through a campaign so badly, and I keep trying, but it's just getting worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018195284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 46167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23017, 'last_played': 1703331076}
review:
Долго думал, что поставить. В итоге больше Да, чем Нет. Если вам нраятся герои меча и магии, то эта игра для вас. Но желательнол быть стресоустойчивым, игра при выполнение загрузки часто вылетает.

Дописываю спустя 64 часов игры.

Игра затягивает, время потратил уйма. Но столкнулся с проблемой. При дальнейшей игре в компанииь игра стабильно виснит. Если раньше этот баг был хаотичный, то теперь я не могу продвинуться по сюжетной линии. Залез в интернет, и очень пожалел что не сделал это до покупки игры.  На одном форуме 30 страниц текста о багах игры которые не лечаться. При чом как я понял форум офицальный, просто разрабы либо не обращают на него внимания, либо не могут решить эти проблемы. люди отчаялись уже выкладывать там ошибки игры. Просто наберите в гугле ошибки эадор, убедитесь сами. Очень обидно. Так то игра затягивает и хотелось бы её пройти.


Нашел исчтоник ошибки. Фиговый интернет. У меня два провайдера. Юзаю один, лаги и вылеты. Юзаю второй, всё нормально. Воот тока зачем такая жосткая привязка к инету.

Дополнение после 400 часов игры.

Вылеты, ошибки, вылеты. Поменял провайдеры, ошибки остались. Сменил полностью железо, новый проц, новая видиокарта( с середнечка на топ). Вылеты остались. Игра затягивает, хотя и порой довольно однообразна. Со скидкой можно брать, причом берите с дополнением, оно того стоит. Если выйдет 3 я часть, возьму обязательно, но только после распродажи, так как боюсь что тоже будет забагованна, а сырой продукт оплачивать по полной стоимости жаба давит.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995903886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1399355787}
review: Eador: Masters of the Broken Game.  Approximately 1/3 of battles end with a 0HP enemy not being recognized as dead by the game, resulting in a loss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045460195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1482725791}
review: Too buggy. Only one hour in and I want to quit. Main issue, which other reviewers have expressed is that units that are killed don't die. Their HP reach 0 and they just stop moving. This is quite a problem since you need to kill every single unit on the map to win the battle. Your best hope is to click auto battle and hope after a few turns the unit will finally die. Otherwise you constantly have to reload the game from your previous save. Way too much hassle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013202354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1399056745}
review:
I loved everything i read in the description of the game, but I was very disapointed. The game is extremely slow. It takes forever to get anywhere. The graphics are bad. The combat is bad and boring and developing cities is tedious.

I was interested in the exploring of the provinces. But that is boring, you just push a button and something random happens. That is fine but you have to do it to keep the provinces growing. Slowing down the get yet again. Instead I would recommend Might & Magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026300188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1399333391}
review:
This game shows a lot of promise and is an entertaining experience at its best, unfortunately it is also horribly bugged and this ruins it to the point that it plays more like a beta than a finished game. The interface is clunky and parts of the gameplay are irrelevant (i.e. exploring regions/visiting locations).

While I mostly enjoyed the game, even at its unfinished state, it is not worth the money I paid for it. If I could I would've demanded a refund. 

Don't buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969096617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1399223129}
review:
This game is atrociously bad.

Game breaking bugs (enemy characters just stand there with 0HP, giving you the option of either reverting to last save, or letting computer auto-finish), The animations are horribly slow with no option to speed up so half the time your waiting for animations to be done. The game is annoying on all fronts with no redeeming qualities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012446010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1744, 'last_played': 1644673314}
review:
First off: this game is fun. If you like HOMM/AoW style combat and empire development, this will be right up your alley. It's a bit simpler (units don't have many spells/skills and mainly boil down to melee/archer/mage/healer), but not simple. As is typical for these types of games, the combat gets repetitive.

Now, there's another Eador game, named Eador: Genesis. It's 99% the same game, but this one has (much) better graphics and some minor tweaks. However, MotBW also introduced some serious bugs, one of which is pretty game breaking. It's also a bit slower than ideal, especially on older systems. A lot of the gameplay revolves around reloading the game as a "go back in time" mechanic, mainly because of the inability to properly scout enemies and the impossibility to predict the actual strength of an army [unless you play the first or second difficulty, out of 7 or so]. 

Eador: Genesis is bug free and due to its age suffers no lag or delays. The "reload last turn" mechanic makes more sense there, but is also less forgiving than the full save/load in MotBW; to be hones it's much more interesting that way.

So my advice would be to pick up Eador: Genesis ($6 on GOG.com I believe) unless you REALLY like flashy graphics in a tactics game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970304427', 'num_games_owned': 1402, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1399215523}

review:
For a game that old, there is some unforgivable bugs that plague gameplay. No distinction from other game in the genre ( Heroes of might and magic, King's bounty, disciple, ...) just much more bugs and a horrible GUI. 

The Kings bounty F2P, is very similar and much better.

Example of bug : if a unit dies by retaliation, it is not regarded as dead but continue to stand on the battleground, immune to attack with HP staying at 0. The combat will never end, unless you choose the quick combat menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008612567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1398968661}
review: "Eador: Master of The Broken World" ist ein sehr schönes Spiel. Es besitzt wirklich recht extremen Tiefgang und ist  für den Anfänger daher nicht ganz einfach. Dennoch ist der Umfang gewaltig und das Spiel ist wirklich den lächerlichen Betrag wert, zu dem es teilweise angeboten wird, damit das Studio erhalten bleibt und vielleicht auch noch weitermachen kann. Insofern würde ich allen Strategen und die die es werden wollen, zum Kauf einfach raten wollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978131984', 'num_games_owned': 898, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1398971633}
review:
Un jeu qui a du potentiel mais qui est totalement gaché par l'instabilité du jeu. J'ai du me résoudre à résoudre automatiquement les combat parce que un combat sur dix ne fini pas. Parce qu'un énnemi mort (0 PV) n'est n'est reconnu comme mort et ne disparait pas du champ de bataille, résultat le jeu est bloqué.
Dommage Eador aurait pu être un jeu de tactique accrocheur pour les amateur de Heroes of M&M ou King's Boutny.
Si ce genre de bug ne vous décourrage pas il mérite peut être de s'y pencher un peu.
De mon coté ce bug m'est arrivé 6 fois en 4 heures de jeu. C'est simplement innaceptable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997421698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 41020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26395, 'last_played': 1575928246}
review:
Okay, I enjoy this game. I enjoy it alot. I have dumped alot of time into the game. If you like Strategy/RPG mix overall I think this game is something to look at. I won't hide the fact that the game is still buggy even after being out for a year, but the developers have been patching the game non-stop since it came out April 2013.

The Ugly:

Okay this game still has bugs, for some people game breaking bugs, and for others bugs that are iritating enough that can make it painful to play the game sometimes. The game was released last April almost completely unplayable, and over the past year it has improved for the major part. Yet I won't gloss over the fact that their is still alot wrong with the game.

The Bad:

The game probably is not all that balanced. Their are 4 tiers of units, and some T4 units could trample an entire army. Not all of the Hero classes are balanced. Their are 4 of them, but they all are playable. It will be nice to see what the game is like in the future.

The Good:

Did I mention patching? The developers still care about the game. They have been patching it a while, and still patch it. 

There is alot in this game, alot of units, alot of choice. Alot of lore burried deep within a rough exterior. The game does not look half bad. The game is not fast paced, but is the type of game you can start playing, and come back between turns as you do something else, but will also keep you wanting to play "one more turn" when things are getting good or you near to beating another map. The developers have recently added a boat load of new units and spells, and have dropped hints are future expansion to the game.


Is the game, worth $19.99? Its a hard sell considering how buggy it can still be. I do thing its a hard sell, but I've enjoy the time I've dumped  into the game and I do appreciate the patches that have gone into it. The game has gotten good, and hopefully it will cotinue getting better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048315465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 21316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2542, 'last_played': 1612038638}
review:
I thought this game was a lot of fun for the first couple of hours, then it becomes tedious.

The hero exploration seemed like it would be a lot of fun, if it didnt take forever and all the combat wasn't manual. 

The units are very imbalanced, you can spend a lot of time nurturing your troops just to have them one hit by someone elses tier 1 or 2 units.

There's also no real effective way to garrison your territory, so it plays a lot like a shitty game of risk, where you just make one massive army and roll across the map until you sack someones capital city.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104307658', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1413376149}
review: Народ кто подскажет как получить "бесплатную копию игры Eador: Genesis"?

author: {'steamid': '76561198074753047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13201, 'last_played': 1673811066}
review:
The game has three tiers. On campaign level you conquer "shards" that give you new technologies and buildings, and compete with other NPCs. Each conquest happens on a map where you and your opponent have a castle, raise an army and fight for territories and resources. Finally, each fight happens on a tactical hex map.

Campaign level is little more than a sequence of missions. You have some choice on what to attack next, but it does not matter much. It is extremely long, and most will stop playing before end. After playing 200 hrs I am about halfway.

Arena level is fun, but NPC is not competitive - its just something to kill when you want the arena to end. The fun comes out of selecting a sequence of fights to level up your hero and your castle. Its somewhat similar to King's Bounty in play style - you pick fights, your hero levels up, you can now win harder fights, but there is no hurry to do something by set time.

The tactical fights are reasonably entertaining, units have various spefical abilities and immunities that you have to keep in mind, there are spells, tile bonuces, fatigue influence etc.

This would be a very good game, if not for bugs. Bugs! When I bought it a year ago, it was essentially unplayable, so I let it settle down for a while. Now it is somewhat better, but still, hourly crashes, NPC units endlessly going in circles, lockdowns, corrupted saves... when half of the challenge in a fight comes not from defeating an enemy, but from avoiding triggering the known bugs, the game definitely has quality problems... and if they didn't fix it by now I guess they never will.

So... I am not recommeding it because of bugs.

P.S. Two years later, tried to start a new game... now save is not working.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001947328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1399158719}
review:
Игра потрясающе... потрясающе бездарно сделана.
Ни в какое сравнение, ни с героями, ни с дисциплес, ни с эйч оф вандерс не идет.
Крайне запутанный режим строительства с замашками на экономику, невнятные солдаты, неинтересная система развития героя, все это еще и не отлажено должным образом. Во время боя солдаты противника могут остаться с нулевым здоровьем и продолжать отвечать на атаки.
Игру крайне не рекомендую к покупке, выкинутые на ветер деньги и время.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121306637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1399559843}
review: Очень хорошая игра,хорошо что наши делают такие прекрасные игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016310828', 'num_games_owned': 1717, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 6161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4784, 'last_played': 1470557600}
review:
A great 4x game with interesting combat mechanics that will keep you comming back months later. Do expect yourself to be burnt out though after 2 weeks of non-stop playing, as some aspects of it can get repeditive. But give it a 2 month break and the little russian guys who make the game will have updated it with new units, spells, and quests.

Certainly a game worth having in your collection if turn based stratergy is of any interest to you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005013538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1419390337}
review:
Well, guess it had to happen eventually......first steam game to not even start for me..trying fixes all day...no go
Lesson learned.  Read the forums people before you buy to see what you're getting into!  Game looked so promising too..They are indeed masters of the broken world.  *** Update (May 2)*** I did manage to get the game running on a win 7 computer but a bug in the tutorial/ opening level of the campaign has rendered my hero frozen. Guess I'm destined to float forever on an unexplored shard! May the Shard be with you in getting through this one folks! I will focus on playable games now and check back in at a later date.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198113988020', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12375, 'last_played': 1450779371}
review:
Одна из лучших пошаговых стратегий, в которые я играл последнее время. Эта игра стоит своих денег. Каждый юнит в армии получает свой собственный опыт, и у вас есть возможность выбора пути его развития. Периодически возникающие события не дают скучать. Множество модификаторов на карты. Интересная компания с несколькими концовками, уникальная система развития (в компании). В общем все, о чем можно только мечтать. 
Есть правда и минусы. Компания в определенный момент начинает казаться непомерно затянутой (в силу того что захват каждой карты занимает много времени) Слабое взаимодействие с богами конкурентами. Карты генерируются только случайно. Присутствуют мелкие баги, которые правда не мешают наслаждаться игрой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010131631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 12039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5096, 'last_played': 1707432282}
review: It's a great game if you like turn based strategy. I really enjoyed it even tho I didn't play eador geneis. It's kinda hard at first but after you understand some strategies and take it slow it goes wayyy better. Also it offer huge ammounts of gameplay, since the campaign is fucking huge. About 100 hours more.!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021749237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3349, 'last_played': 1585538775}
review: Super complex if you mind exploiting undead/summons; but getting into the game is deceptively easy. Pulls you right in and then gives you challenges to meet your level of ability (or at least it does if you're paying attention). Only gripe is how long games must play out and how much of the game mechanics are not immediately obvious to players who want to learn organically and don't enjoy reading strategy guides. But the game is totally random after the first couple levels, so replay is still good. Very important because the same turn-based mechanics are played out over and over on the territory map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001663937', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1462195601}
review: Игра должна была стать хорошей, но увы. Техническая реализация испоганила всё что можно. После релиза прошло полтора года(если не ошибаюсь), а багов в игре не мерянно, при том что критичных из них достаточно. Поддержки проекта как таковой не наблюдается. Скупые патчи раз в пол года добавляющие больше ошибок, чем исправляющие, пустые обещания всё сделать играбельно с последующим молчанием разрабов на форумах и далее в том же духе. Знал бы что всё на столько плохо не отдал бы и 100р за нее на распродаже. Ибо не за что.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018934774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 24378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3078, 'last_played': 1706403337}
review:
Somehow this game got me. It has an easy learning curve which (after some reloading of saved games) is pretty easy to get the hang of. The game also doesn't rely too much on single unit tactics. I've only played the single player portion of the game but at 53 hours in there is still no end in sight. 

Simply put... I love it. It is challenging enough to keep playing over and over yet not frustrating. Can't wait to play the free DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063905884', 'num_games_owned': 2807, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1387540968}
review:
掉节操的玩意。整个游戏系统和Eador:Gensis没有任何区别。可以看作是前作的3D复刻版。
作为奇幻4X游戏，在度过刚接触游戏的兴奋期后，你会发现游戏流程就是简单的占地下FB攒兵推平敌人。可用的套路和策略单调得令人发指，白瞎了这游戏的多位面和业力设定。至于当初宣传的多人联机部分，除了游戏刚出那会，现在的官网平台几乎见不到人了。
如果你有很多时间，不要犹豫，买下它毁灭自己的人参和钱包吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561197970605218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 20330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8987, 'last_played': 1422231909}
review: Farligt pilligt och charmigt, 50/50 Mage Knight och Heroes of Might and Magic, omgångsbaserade hexagonstrider med förvånansvärd mycket djup där position, moral och uthållighet påverkar stridsdugligheten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961138963', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 4285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4685, 'last_played': 1448412022}
review:
***** EDIT *****

Someone pointed out that the "pointer error" bug was fixed w/ the last patch. The announcement for the patch claimed it was.  However...the bug STILL exists and it is in fact, an actual GAME BREAKING bug. 

See this report from another player: http://steamcommunity.com/app/232050/discussions/0/540740500665480910/

In addition, the patch introduced yet another game breaking bug (the "0 hp bug"). See this thread:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/232050/discussions/0/540740500975024315/

So my review stands. The game is NOT in a playable state for a great number of players...so new buyers will be taking a risk that the game will not work for them. The game hasn't worked for me in over a year due to that one error (described in the original review below).

/end edit


===== BUYER BEWARE =====


The game's premise is cool. The graphics are fine. The play mechanics are interesting and fun. The problem? The dev simply REFUSES to fix year old bugs that prevent a signifiant portion of players from playing the game.

For a large percentage of players...this game is simply unplayable. There numerous threads about this bug (the "pointer error") and many more posts about it.

Either the devs are inexperienced at debugging and proper coding or they simply do not care that many players cannot play the game they paid for.  Either way, it is highly problematic for the customer as the result is a non-functioning game. 

BUYER BEWARE. Spending money on this game runs the risk of resulting in the game becoming a  virtual coaster, nothing more.


Here's a link to the reported error: http://steamcommunity.com/app/232050/discussions/1/810923021679670190/

  There are several other threads doing the same, and even more posts (in different threads) reporting the same error (which has existed for over a year now). Simply search for "pointer" and you'll find numerous players who simply cannot play the game as a result of it.
developer_response:
Hello,

We saw you addressed some of the bugs in your review's update. Just wanted to let you know that those are fixed by now, so if you want you can give the game another try :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006917383', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 5218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5218, 'last_played': 1411057668}
review:
This is so close to being an amazing game that it causes me physical pain. It's that close, but there are a few crippling flaws that just ruin it. First, there's the combat. There are different ranks of creatures, one through four, one being weakest and four being most powerful. The problem with this is, after a certain point, anything below rank three will die in the first turn of battle because the enemy AI consists entirely of 'KILL WEAKEST CHARACTER'. The combat maps are tiny so forget any sort of strategy, mid and end game opponents can hit you anywhere you stand. Oh, and those opponents are almost always all one to nine monsters, plus nine to twelve wizards. There are three wizard types, and you will see up to a dozen in every single combat.

There are dragons in the game, and you can find them as random encounters. That isn't a problem. A single low level dragon can be beaten, but it's fairly tough unless you come loaded for end game critter hunting with high end, high level units. It's cool. You get an achievement. What isn't cool is that the dragons can spawn in groups of up to six, and all of them in the level 15 range. There might be worse groups out there, but this is literally what invaded one of my provinces in my current game. This isn't something you can fight. I also mean that Literally. You can not defeat these multiple dragon encounters. It isn't possible. You can build an arena in your home province and send heroes to battle in it to gain experience. Why am I mentioning this? because as soon as a hero reaches level ten, the enemy heroes you battle in the arena can also spawn with dragons as minions. It goes about as well as you'd expect.

On the plus side, your units can level up and improve their abilities, but it really doesn't matter, because a lvl 30 tier one unit will still be instagibbed by a lvl 1 tier four. And the upgrade system is utterly worthless as well. Why yes random number generator, I did want to improve my crossbowmans hand to hand skills for the fourth time in a row. No, he doesn't need better ranged attacks, he needs to be able to swing that butterknife he has like a man!

There are hundreds of items you can find, which is nice, but there's almost no storage space for them. You get a tiny little vault that can't be upgraded. It wouldn't be so bad but on the same screen you have access to the merchant window to sell stuff, and hey, if you guessed that had a scroll bar and infinite space in it, go get a cookie or something. You can build an artifact shop so you can buy artifacts, but unfortunately it doesn't cycle through different ones. You get the opportunity to buy three randomly chosen ones and it never changes for the rest of the game. Those three items are pretty much going to be terrible and I really want to chalk it up to being a bug that it doesn't refresh every so often, but it's been like that since release so probably it isn't.

There are four types of hero you can recruit, but you shouldn't bother getting anything but a warrior. The warrior is so much better than the other three it defies belief. Scouts can be useful for the rare encounters designed exclusively to kill warriors, but that's about it. Oh, and yeah, there are encounters designed from the ground up to murder warriors. packs of medusa will petrify you and then poison you, giant spiders will web you down and poison you, giant slugs will poison you if you hit them or vomit poison on you from a distance if you don't.

Edit: Okay, so I finally managed to grind a mage high enough to use a specific spell named 'white magic', and basically, it lets you break the game over your knee like a rotten twig. Two casts will clear virtually any combat encounter of critters, barring the two (the latest update may have added more) creatures who are magic immune. Once you get one cast per combat, better beleive that mage is going straight to lvl 30 since he can now effectively obliterate entire armies. Unconquerable foes turn instantly into big, meaty sacks of free XP. Just load up every unit slot with lvl 1 swordsmen, the enemy creatures/mages/whatever will go and kill them while your mage, free and unharmed, fires magic nukes that hit EVERYTHING ON THE MAP FOR MASSIVE DAMAGE. This is a well balanced, well implimented ability that reduces multiplayer combat to 'whoever goes first wins'. Casting it does a small amount of damage to the mage, but a couple of healers can fix it easily before any monsters that made it to turn two kill them for being a weaker, easier target than the wizard FIRING MAGICAL NUKES AT THEM.

Oh, and I hope you like really, really really loud TING! sounds, because the game plays one over and over at random for no reason I can discern.


Edit: I also hope you don't like loading saved games, because doing that while the game is running will cause the entire thing to crash. Not always, but often enough that I had to mention it.




Shouted at by a dev and I didn't even get an acheivement for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022576910', 'num_games_owned': 836, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 19398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5188, 'last_played': 1589760403}
review:
As far as strategy games go... I really like it.
The gameplay is quite easy to get, the difficulty is properly set up (if sometimes a bit annoying when you want to rush), the dialogues are quite humourous, and... well, the campaign has been keeping me occupied for quite some time now.
Some people are experiencing bugs that are quite annoying, but without them the game is in my opinion a solid 8 or 9.

TL;DR :

Pro : Easy to play, good gameplay, funny, lots of material.

Con: Maybe a tad repetitive and sometimes bugs.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006119705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 16552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11747, 'last_played': 1462521055}
review:
A good game with very original ideas. The idea of the shards is really nice and you get new buildings and new troops every shard. Many strategies are possible during each shard and you may wanna try every kind of heroes. The story of the campain is rather original well written and nicely thought, with opponents who all have their own secrets about how they became high spirits. 
Also, it is rather original and pretty nice to feel like you are a high spirit immortal and fighting for shards that look like little planets in the stars. 
Another positive point with the idea of the shards is that you can have several strategies on them : you can rush it, you can take your time exploring every region, trying to find btw legendary weapons or extra bonuses for winning the shard. 
On the other hand, it is true there are bugs in this game. However, in my games, I never had any bug that warned me from playing the game (always had minor bugs that didnt affect the game). 
Another negative point is that you cant have bonuses for your heroes when you get a shard. You always have to do the same farming for your heroes and it is kinda repetitive.
But still I strongly recommend this game .

author: {'steamid': '76561198039855196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1498553010}
review: Для фанатов пошаговых стратегий очень хороший подарок, но впечатление портят довольно досадные ошибки: если в провинции есть стражи- враг не может захватить провинцию(он уничтожает стражей и зависает в этой провинции, каждый ход снова уничтожая стражей) , если вы перепрыгнули на карте один из островов -следующие становятся не доступными(при загрузке зависают и иногда весят систему). А в целом очень неплохой перенос спрайтового Эадора в 3D
