author: {'steamid': '76561198058444006', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3005, 'last_played': 1673806770}
review:
Хорошая пошаговая стратегия судя по всему вдохновленная от Героев меча и магии.
Стоит отметить что один сюжет примерно 10-40 часов прохождения,а то и больше.
Если вы играли в первую часть то эта вам определенно понравиться так как это фактически перезапуск оригинальной игры с рядом изменений:
Улучшили графику (Сделали её в 3D  в отличие от первой части)
Добавили немного изменений по сюжету (Возможно я сам не видел это в оригинале)
Появился баланс сложности (В первой части на легком было потненько (или я был просто криворук) то здесь каждый уровень сложности стабилен)
Конечно это игру РПГ назвать можно,но не особо она похожа на РПГ:Выбор нам дают только когда мы "плаваем" в астрале
и то если "время придет",на осколках выбор сводиться к банально Добру (заплати сейчас и получишь БОЛЬШЕ потом) и Злу (забери все себе,грабь,убивай,будь плохим парнем сейчас но позже тебе будет ПЛОХО);
По сравнению с предыдущей частью Eador: Masters of the Broken World пошла в плюс.
Игра достойна внимания и своих денег.
8.5/10 (+0.5 за графику)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989570764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7733, 'last_played': 1433652687}
review:
While many of the serious bugs have been resolved a year later, a few game-breaking bugs do remain (albeit the ones listed above do not).

Gameplay balance remains an issue, and it inherently leads to a very grindy game.

So it remains a diamond in the rough.

---

After almost a year, this game remains a bug-ridden hellhole, with very little tactical or strategic balance at most levels of the gameplay. I'm almost tempted to say the bugs are worse now than they were a year ago.

Some bugs include:
- if more than one battle of any kind occurs on the map, no other battles can occur. They immediately auto-resolve with both sides being listed as dead despite not being dead.
- The AI cannot conquer any terrain where it has to fight player guards. Neither the guards will die nor will the province be conquered.

Some gameplay issues include:
- In campaign mode, it is entirely possible for the capitol of an AI to be guarded by 9 centaurs. Centaurs are powerful tier 2 units. If this occurs in the first or second mission, you have been given a near-impossible task, as the gameplay elements that allow you to defeat centaurs are not available until later in the game. You can, of course, surrender, and keep playing. This, and similar balance issues, remain a frustrating element of the game.
- Starting units are worthless and unless you follow certain strategies or know what you're doing, you're likely to be stuck in your home province for many, many turns.

All of this is incredibly sad, as the game's core concept is pretty great. The programming and game design, however, are lackluster and poor. A great game marred by poor design.

review: This game has potential but it ends up just becoming an endless grind after a while. I want to like it, but it wont let me.  If you like games where you have to endlessly grind out the same scenario and spend countless hours doing it, then who knows, it may be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033473318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 7693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7414, 'last_played': 1410031651}
review:
Eador is a really good game. It has an interesting world, great tactical combat (on par with Fantasy General), a lot of choice in developing your heroes and kingdom. I could go on about what's great about it... yet, I am giving it a negative recommendation. It is because at the same time it is a really badly written game, it has been plagued by bugs since day one. The devs have released a lot of patches, fixing many things and adding interesting features... but also adding new crashes and when the last patch broke game saving I decided that I can't believe in this game any more. If in some distant future they manage to fix all the bugs this will be a great game. But with every single patch breaking more things than it fixes I really can't believe in that.
EDIT> After the last patch it is playable for me... there are bugs still, but ATM nothing game breaking. So I'm giving the game a positive recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055671572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 220437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25828, 'last_played': 1639433683}
review:
This game is addictive, and the game play is fun, but they have some serious file handling errors.  Their file handling errors manifest it two ways.  The first is that if you try to attack the wrong shard the game will crash during the first save event.  The second is that if you try to attack the wrong enemy on a shard and the game will freeze.   I don’t know what’s going on, but this is pretty basic stuff.  It is kind of surprising that they could create the graphics and gameplay that they have and yet still not even manage programing 101 file handling issues.
Here’s the use case that ruins the game for me.  I have three shards that I can attack.  Two of them will cause the game to crash during the first save event.  The third freezes every time I try to invade a territory controlled by the last of four enemies.  As such, there is now no way for me to even attempt to continue, let alone win, the game.  I guess that I could just kill off all of my heroes, dismiss all of my guards and troops, and then wait for the last enemy to conquer my castle, but who would want to do that?  Besides, there is no guarantee that surrendering this shard will allow for the creation of a shard that won’t crash.
It looks like this game will be really fun someday.  But until they fix there file handling issues it is just frustrating.  As such, I wouldn’t recommend buying it until after they fix these bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074687408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 10814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1461506425}
review:
Рекомендую в качестве замечательного снотворного, в качестве мотиватора погонять в WoT, циву, тетрис или какую-то другую игру. И ещё для того, чтобы мне не было так обидно за выкинутые на ветер деньги, пусть и не большие, но всё же свои, а не чужие. А так я буду знать, что не один лохонулся, есть ещё кто-то. Покупайте.
Всё начинается с того, что параллельно со "строительством домиков" у игрока есть возможность пошариться по окрестным локациям и повоевать с тамошними обитателями. Ну как сказать локации... это соседние шестигранники, до которых топать почему-то так долго, что герой к концу игры должен бы стать седовласым старцем с единственным уцелевшим зубом. И в этих грёбаных шестиугольниках сидят всякие скучные бандиты и гоблины. Скучные потому, что вынос их тушек из одной, другой, третьей локации чертовски однообразен. Профита с этого всего мало. Навыки героя какие-то неинтересные. Никакой путней магии в начале нет, до поздних этапов я доиграть не смог, то в сон рубило, то в танки тянуло. Хотя обычно в пошаговые стратегии я играю часами, могу 6-7 до утра засидеться. Но это просто шляпа какая-то.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048687538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1621711773}
review:
I've played Eador for some hours and nearly two days non-stop. It is a promising game, really a masterpiece of a crossover between Civilization and Heroes of Might and Magic, the battles are really difficult but still fair, with the exception of 1-2 enemy units. It is a lot of fun for ppl who like to manage a lot, but still enjoy a nice battle every now and then.

The main flaw why I wouldnt recommend this game is, because on the technical side it's a mess. Errors prompting up every 5-30 minutes, most of them just stop the game from running, the minimum specs are a lie and the loading times are unbelievably long. You could say that in a playtime of 8hours you effectively have played 3-4.

Still I would recommend Eador for being one of those games that really fascinate you, if you give it the chance and maybe have a good PC, the game is still a work in progress so maybe it will get better in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031581056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3604, 'last_played': 1486100042}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973725830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3029, 'last_played': 1466225256}
review: MotBW, at it's heart, is a very good game. The mechanics are solid, the art is great, and the replayability is high. However, the game suffers from very poor balance and many, many bugs, some of which can be game-breaking. The developers seem to be keeping on this, and have recently released several patches that address some of the major flaws. I would hope that they continue to focus on this aspect (bugfixing) before moving on to others, such as any expansions that have been rumored. Overall this is very enjoyable 4X game, despite the aforementioned bugs. I do reccomend it to people with the patience to watch a fairly 'ok' game evolve into a great one, hopefully.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036743291', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 38838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11363, 'last_played': 1537918271}
review:
The game play itself is addicting and even beyond the "take over the world" goal, you can set up a huge number of secondary goals. Certain locations will give you tasks to complete for rewards, you can aim to complete item sets for your character, aim to fully explore all of your territory (that takes awhile, by the way) and much more.

The campaign is structured in a way that each map you win gives you access to a few additional structures when playing the next map.  However, you do start over from scratch on each map.  I enjoy the restart from scratch part of the game, but if that's not your thing, you might find that aspect of the game frustrating.

I have not encountered any of the game breaking bugs that are out there, and hopefully the most recent patch has resolved them.  Maybe I'm just lucky, maybe the developers have been able to get most of them fixed.  Either way, I fully recommend this game for the hours of entertainment in can provide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034956312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1670886710}
review:
[code][h1][b][i]Eador. Masters of the Broken World[/i][/b] - великолепная игра в жанре пошаговой экономической стратегии. Несомненно, она опережает Героев Меча и Магии. В отличие от первой части Эадора эта часть перешла из [u]2D в 3D[/u]. Увлекательный нелинейный сюжет; прекрасная графика; "прокачка" не только героя, но и воинов; сотни предметов для снаряжения и многое другое. Возможность игры PvP и битвы за осколок на одном компьютере. Эта игра заслуживает внимания![/h1][/code]
[list]
[*][b]Игра имеет небольшие недочёты.

[*]Рейтинг 9/10 (среди стратегий)[/b]
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198019846249', 'num_games_owned': 1836, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 20953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16130, 'last_played': 1565875832}
review:
Grę polecam, gra mi się świetnie i spędziłem już przy niej sporo czasu.

Uwaga dla graczy z windowsem Windowsem 7. Podczas gry mogą występować błędy "acces violation", z którym nie da się nic zrobić. Długo próbowałem, testowałem wszystkie metody zamieszczone w internecie i nic z tego nie wyszło. Dodatkowo, w którymś momencie kampanii, za każdym razem kiedy próbuję zaatakować bohatera Lokalnego Lorda, albo on próbuje zaatakować mojego, gra się zawiesza. Tak po prostu. I nie był to jednostkowy błąd, tak się działo za każdym razem, kiedy w bitwie o odłamek uczestniczył jakiś lokalny lord, więc musiałem się poddawać i atakować odłamki rywali lub takie, w których lokalnych lordów nie było, przez co w końcu kampanii fabularnej nie skończyłem

Dodając: Po odczekaniu kilku miesięcy na aktualizacje, jak również po wymianie sprzętu na nowy, tym razem z Windowsem 10, zagrałem od początku, tym razem udało mi się już nie doświadczyć żadnych większych błędów i ukończyć grę. Cały czas podtrzymuję recenzję pozytywną :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197966124980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1430842652}
review:
Easily the best "HOMM" type game I've played. HOMM is pretty much dead to me these days and I have no interest in the new version where you stack troops and faceroll boring maps for more story bits. I'm a bigger fan of the King's Bounty series but those are still largely about progression through troop stacks and a bit lacking in the grand scheme development. Eador however, is ALL about the development of your capital and all of the land around it. I was initially put off by the more story/objective driven campaign and didn't fully realize that this game did in fact have a sandbox mode, so I'm glad I gave it a second chance.

The thing that really sets it off is that you'll take over bigger plots of land, but will have to fully explore it, clear all of the dungeons within it and completely run the enemy forces out of it before you actually gain the land making fights a lot more thoughtful than just single tile-grabbing. This process may not even be possible until you level up a bit higher and come back As in just because you walked on a tile doesn't mean you fully own and control it.  You are also fighting not only all of the monsters around the map, but also the AI building their capitals as well. Not to mention there's actually things on the maps like rocks and hills that you can USE. I took out a bigger army due to great placement with ranged units and chokepoints. That would NEVER happen in HOMM.

Of course there's tons of tech tree type buildings and troops with upgrades and multiple classes of heros. It's your typical foray across a map, and the game itself does nothing brand new. It's just how it's glued together and operates that sets it apart. I picked this up for a fiver in a bundle at one point and I've seen it that low on a sale. If you like turn based strategy games you could do so much worse here for that price. It's another game that has 100's of hours potential going for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033125143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1531344628}
review: Genius of original game ruined by disgusting implementation of talentless developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053664657', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 6398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4178, 'last_played': 1489749992}
review:
Задумка хорошая, но студия которая занимается игрой - угробила ее полностью, полгода выпускать маленький патч, сеящий новые баги и не исправляющий старые - это просто сказочный маразм. Не берите эту игру. Может году к 2016 что то и сделают, а пока - пустая трата денег и времени играть в это сырое собрание багов.

апд: Баги наконец то исправили, спустя несколько лет можно играть. Поставил бы 10\10 если бы это сделали раньше и не стали забрасывать игру делая аналоничный клон...

8\10. Все равно остался осадок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017378914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 20175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9732, 'last_played': 1591660306}
review: I liked this game, though the campaign is RIDICULOUSLY long if you were going to complete it.  If you like strategy games this can certiainly fit the bill and though the learning curve is rather steep, once you get the hang of it, the gameplay is pretty cool.  I reccomend playing a few levels of the campaign and then trying your hand at the instant games where everything is unlocked, that way you have a grasp of the basics and are not overwhelmed with the number of choices in terms of buildings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024183051', 'num_games_owned': 3736, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 6416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3488, 'last_played': 1577819559}
review: Fantastic turnbased strategy game. the Shard World is an amazing idea and works to a fault. The fact that there is no Tech tree as such actually works as well as you have to find the plans for buildings on shards. A must have for turnbased fans and people who like to take their time contemplating their next move.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992820381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1394995412}
review: I like it! Loads of things to build, loads of powerups to select for both your heroes and troops and the graphics look great. Starts off nice and easy, then gets a bit tricky :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198044458165', 'num_games_owned': 1739, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 811, 'last_played': 1375027537}
review:
Un jeu de stratégie assez classique : des héros commandant des armées, avec combats et déplacements  au tour par tour.
Plutôt équilibré, pas de grand défauts.
Cependant, il manque quelque chose. Quelque chose qui lui permettrait de se distinguer. Quelque chose sans quoi un jeu devient rapidement ennuyant.
En campagne comme en multijoueur, on n'a pas l'impression de progresser, de faire évoluer un royaume, on se contente de prendre des bouts de terrain à son voisin, qui les reprendra peut-être plus tard. 
Un dernier malus : les IA sont calamiteuses, mais c'est le cas dans bien des jeux de cette catégorie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006820020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3093, 'last_played': 1455997426}
review:
I played this a lot, there are many good ideas, the game is very interesting and addictive.

However I will not recomend this. 
There are quite a lot of game breaking bugs. For example if the oposing units have the "atack and move"traints, they will simply  exterminate your army. This is an easy bug to find and fix, I found this in my game 6 months ago, and is still there . 
And there are other bugs:
Your hero will randomly get stuck while moving from province to province, or it will automaticly fight an invisible army and die. 

This kills your hero, you need to load a previos save and after 10-20  times you simply have enoght. 

This game has many good ideeas, I like the mecanichs but with all this bugs ( and no fixing in sight), I can not recomend it.

Edit. After a long time, finally the developer release a patch for many bugs, including the ones I mention above. Plus as a apology for the extremly long time, they release a free DLC. After playing for 7 hours I did not found any major bugs.
The game is not perfect, it has some balancing issues, but it is addictive and quite interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049627467', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 23653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20455, 'last_played': 1575952232}
review:
Несмотря на довольно сложное детство этой игры и непростое отношение к ней разработчиков, ныне эта игрушка вполне работоспособна и пригодна к комфортному и интересному времяпровождению после рабочего дня и во время его не хуже третьих Героев. Играл с нее с самого релиза, стоически борясь с тогдашней ордой багов и лагов, но ее создатели благодаря зуботычинам со стороны разгневанной аудитории и владельцев фирмы смогли наконец превратить вусмерть забагованную игрушку в нечто достойное.

Игра воистину многогранна, в ней важно не только умение побеждать в сражениях с соперниками, но и склонность планировать бюджет и дальнейшие шаги. Благодаря ДЛК "Союзники" вырос бестиарий, при этом новые монстры и подопечные имеют другие особенности, нежели их прототипы. В Эадоре придется заниматься не только боями, но и строительством и материальным обеспечением вашего боевого отряда, иначе можно легко вылететь в трубу и проиграть кампанию на ценном Осколке. Основных ресурсов 3: золото и кристаллы на локальной карте каждого завоевываемого мира и Энергия в Астрале, которая в дальнейшем позволит использовать преимущества вашего персонального Мира и даже сохранение и перенесение вашего раскачанного Героя с Осколка на Осколок со всем его обмундированием.
Интересна в игре система прокачки, касающаяся абсолютно любых существ, которых вы сможете нанять, начиная с обычного крестьянина и заканчивая нежитью и демонами. Набираться опыта и получать уровни будет даже скелет. При этом каждый уровень вы сможете по-своему выбирать путь развития для своих подопечных, в перспективе имея возможность вырастить из них легендарных вояк (с легендарно высоким содержанием, между прочим). Вкупе с хорошо развитой и разветвленной системой магии (аж 5 направлений), симпатиями/антипатиями, присущими каждому вашему воину, перед вами откроется множество тактик ведения сражений. Вишенкой на торте возможностей являются 16 субклассов Героев, вырастающих из стартовых 4 классических типов (Маг, Воин, Разведчик, Командир). От себя скажу, что всегда выбираю Командира, так как он равномерно развивает особенности ведомых и собственные таланты, использует все возможности игры, да и для переноса в другой мир годится лучше всех.

Выбор Осколка, на который вы вторгнетесь, также важен. Как правило, наиболее ценен тот из них, который даст наибольший прирост Энергии, что ускорит полное раскрытие потенциала вашего Мира и завоевания. Одновременно растет и сложность захвата такого источника. Существуют и другие Владыки, готовые всегда оспорить ваши притязания, и от ваших действий, принятых решений и общего морального облика зависит их отношение к вашему герою и их откровенность, что очень поможет в прохождении сюжета игры и к глобальной победе. Плохое приведет к бою на вашем поле и вашим уничтожением в случае поражения, а доброе сподвигнет дружественного соперника добровольно сдать Осколок вам, если вы на нем останетесь наедине, и выдать все свои секреты. К хорошим отношениям приводит также систематический подкуп Владык во время противоборства с ними на Осколке, и при должном старании Игроку, отыгрывающего добряка, удастся приручить хоть самого завзятого Владыку-злодея. Кроме того, ваш моральный облик позволит вам заключать союзы с различными расами. Особенно повезет, если это удастся провернуть с эльфами, у которых самые сильные лучники в игре, способные сокрушить играючи хоть дракона.
Ещё одной интересной гранью являются сотни артефактов и элементов обмундирования для ваших Героев, позволяющих, к примеру, вдвое ускорить прокачку ваших зелёных бойцов или дарующие Герою-воину способность высасывать здоровье из врагов или же наносить смертельный первый удар. Особой удачей будет собрать сет, серьезно увеличивающий бонусы от отдельных его частей.
С Героями и Kings Bounty игра схожа системой морали. Демоны и святоши с огромным трудом уживаются друг с другом и всегда готовы убрать с поля боя, если вы не озаботитесь раскачкой у них боевого духа и поисками воодушевлябщих артефактов. Только нежити все равно. Ещё воинов, как ваших, так и чужих, можно напугать, и у них упадет сперва натиск, а потом они и вовсе побегут.
Уровень сложности противников варьируется от отдаленности той или иной области от столиц Игрока и его соперников. На огромных картах можно найти практически непобедимых монстров, охраняющих сундук с не менее крутым артефактом.
Сами Осколки тоже многообразны, до 9 видов, начиная с равнинных и заканчивая мирами-кладбищами. Пикантности добавляет также особые факторы конкретного мира, как например, пониженная прочность вещей в "магическом" равнинном мире, вследствие чего Герою-воину придется худо, или мир песков, где ваши воины будут изнывать от жары и усталости.
Из забавных особенностей можно назвать негативное отношение разработчиков к магам. Почти все волшебники - аморальные личности. Исключение только целители. Отдельно хочу упомянуть диалоги. Сделаны они с юмором и старанием, особенно для гремлина, извечного слуги Игрока и очень острой на язык сущности.

9 ускоренных катапульт-спринтеров из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037070834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1247, 'last_played': 1448590546}
review:
An amazing Hex Based strategy game. It feels like an interesting mix of an RPG with hero units and tactical units, and this idea that there is this much larger struggle that you cannot intitally see. The game world looks great for what it is, and the enemies and units are all varied and well thought out. The game runs smoothly, the flow and pace of the game keeps you moving forwards without to much pause. The difficulty settings can keep even the most hardcore gamers entertained, providing a true challenge for those who think they can simply stomp through the game at their leisure. This game gives you so many ways to play it, and every way you can play it feels satisfying as hell.

It's one of those games you literally have to pick up to experience it, as it can't truly be full explained. One of those mixxed bags of  a psuedo 4x strategy, but not quite that deep, with elements of other games like Heroes of Might and Magic, among older games from the early PC floppy days and Amiga era.

If you like a more straight forwards approach to a psuedo 4x strategy game this would be it. They line it up and simplify it nicely, but keep all the complicated bits in if you want to play around with them and dig deeper. It's a must have for anyone that likes hero style tactics roleplaying gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019098418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5407, 'last_played': 1465031587}
review:
Good game for the short period that it worked.  The game is very buggy with some bugs (particularly battle screen freezes) popping up at highly inoportune times forcing the cancellation of entire campaign games that you have invested hours playing because you cannot proceed past the bug.
Deleting and reloading doesn't appear to help as it only seems to bring out different bugs and glitches.
Potentially a good game and I will have another look at it in a year or two after the developers have released some much needed patches.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017468074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 5211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3722, 'last_played': 1482706568}
review:
Really love this game. Not too difficult and not too easy, just right. This is a TBS type of game. The world consists of shards, which you have to conquer. Every shard consist of a number of provinces. Your hero (as usual you can have a number of them) has to conquer the provinces. Once a province is conquered you can explore it (find treasure, etc. usually leading to a fight or negotiation) pleasing the local population make money from them build mining facilities, mills etc. There are many kind of buildings to build and paths to choose. 

In between, events take place that you must resolve in some way. For instance there is some wizard that resurrects some death people and you have to decide whether to fight the wizard, pay it off or ignore it (just making this one up as an example).

Fights bring you to a hexagonal field which is pretty much standard across TBS type of games and you have to fight the enemy with the army you have (pretty much like you have it in other TBS games like king's bounty).


Loads of fun and highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036728286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 27751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 11430, 'last_played': 1710645077}
review:
(This review is from my opinion and has doesn't cover any issues the game others claim it may have.)

Well worth the money and time invested. 

It's a game that keeps you coming back so long as you're not a casual player. Has the hardest campaign I've ever played by far and I'm still playing on beginner without finishing or starting a new campaign for the whole time I've actually spent playing the game (over 190hrs). 

But it's been time well spent. The style of the artwork, the units, the models, the abilities and depth just work sooo well together.  I ACTUALLY feel like I'm in control of a kingdom while I'm playing. My choices have meaning and consequence/benefits. Although thats obvious when you play some games. I feel if I had to choose between games like ROME total war, Age of wonders series, Civ 5 etc, all those turn-based conquest stratagy games, I'd rather uninstall the rest than stop playing this one. But thats just my opinion.

The game in full could be taken furthur if the developers spent the same amount of time they spent making the game to make it go ever furthur. More intereactions, more interesting situations your kingdom might face, THINGS like shards clashing in the middle of conquering one shard then 2 more enemy kingdoms rock up that were originally clashing on that shard to begin with now I have to conquer both with more mayhem to add to the mix. The forging of alliances out of shards with other demi-gods, THE LIST is endless.

For what it is though it's amazing and a true inspiration towards what fantasy games should be/feel/look like. Not to mention the idea of shards and it's turn based stratagy while conquering territories. Well done! ^_^

p.s to myself: This review after reading does not serve the game justice, I feel its more than what I described by far but I couldn't find the words :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197996251590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1407720406}
review:
Hope you've got the next year or so free, 'cause Eador eats up free time at an alarming rate.

The basic gameplay will mostly be familiar to fans of the Heroes of Might and Magic series: Hero units, backed by a recruitable army, explore the world and fight with each other. There are towns, equipable items, all that good stuff. However, where HoMM  tends to be fairly simple, Eador has enough depth to drown a whale. What you build, where you build it, and what you stock your army with can have huge consequences, and every turn has dozens of choices about how best to improve your situation. Add in random events, potentially dozens of battles per province, and a solid enemy AI and you've got a recipe for a huge time-sink.

Most 4x games become bogged down in the late game: Your strategy is set, you've built everything you need to, and now it's simply a matter of hitting "next turn" until you win. Eador's campaign averts this in a wonderful way: The maps are fairly small by 4x standards, but you have to complete dozens of them. The world has been split into shards, and your goal is to control as many of them as you can. That means that by the time you've reached the "just hit next" stage you'll have completed one shard and it'll be time to move on to the next, where you have to build up your forces all over again. That's not to say that beating a shard has no benefits: Each one you control grants you boosts to your income, troops, or abilities, so planning which ones to conquer in what order actually matters to an extent.

All-in-all an excellent strategy game that I'd highly recommend to HoMM or Disciples fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986276633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1392161399}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025497673', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 26824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24598, 'last_played': 1562169836}
review:
a good game for those who wanted turn based strategy,management builder,alignment scenario depending on your game play , the units you use levels up individually so even a tier1 unit can beat a tier2 w/ sufficient levels. how you rule your world will be up to you. if you wanted to be a tyrant lord who will not hesitate to transform your own subjects to resources. or a paladin who will bring devine punishment , eternal crusade and unreasonable hatered to anyone who sides with the darkness. or a little goodie two shoes who will rule them all is up to you. how you protect your low tier units to be too highly leveled and awarded w/ multiple medals to match high tier units is up to you. strategy is very important. a good game that is easy to learn yet hard to master


Downsides:

the daw back for this game is that it takes neary a lot of time and i mean Hundreds of hours to finish and in my case im still probably in the half or close to half of the game

the bugs are crawling and some updates can fix some of the bugs but not all. cleary to a point making the game unplayable and rendering a savefile useless. currently i can say im still waiting for major fixes for the game so that i can probably play this w/ smooth sailing.

if you can overcome and have a LOT of patience for these downsides i can say grab this game if on sale. its a good game w/ good concepts its just that bugs crawl and used to be A LOT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030884303', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1398935501}
review: Нет, это просто удивительно, непостижимо, беспрецедентно! Как можно, имея в основе такой шедевр как "Эадор: Сотворение", сделать настолько неудобный, громоздкий, уродливый, изобилующий глюками клон?  В это очень тяжело играть, и не из-за сложности игры, а по причине чудовищно затянутого вождения мышью по кнопкам интерфейса, а также напряжения зрения и фаназии в попытках угадать что же тут изображено.  Псевдо 3д, шейдеры, мельтешащая анимация - вчистую проигрывают статичному пиксельарту оригинала. Утешает лишь одно - талант в нашем мире еще что-то да значит. Жаль что разработчики Masters of the Broken World им обделены. Ну а пассивность игровой поддержки не остааляет надежд на развитие проекта не умом так задом.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993164830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1385324969}
review:
I saw videos and previews of this game a long time ago and thought it looked awesome. I really liked the idea of a turn based fantasy based strategy with tactical combat.

So when the game came out I waited a bit and then bought it. I'm honestly not sure what to think of this game. There is all the right pieces there for a awesome RPG tactical strategy game, but for some reason it just falls short.

The hero characters aren't very balanced and just feel kind of blah. The game gets very repetitive very fast as you keep running into the same thing over and over.

While playing I just couldn't help but compare it to Fallen Enchantress which is a similar style game. In pretty much every way it feel short. Maybe not fair as Stardock is a larger company. But still the point is there.

You may love this game, you may hate it. If you play Fallen Enchantress I'd stick with that and not bother with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010490322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1391220375}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045533009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 15667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8165, 'last_played': 1706807863}
review: Very fun strategy game. Good humour, and tricky at times. After playing for a while feels a tad repetetive, but I'd highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972499798', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1390199332}
review:
The tutorial took 3 hours and that was one of the most boring experiences I've ever had playing a video game.  I honestly can't think of a worse way to introduce your game to new players then what I just went through.  

The basic game mechanics seemed backwards compared to every other game of this genre I've played.  Why would you make a move then wait for next turn to see how that move worked out, why doesn't it just happen now...  

Other overworld mechanics appeared to exist only to increase the amount of "grinding" you could achieve as a player.  The combat mechanics were even worse, the basic UI had enough numbers floating around that you would generally have no idea what nay of them specifically meant.  The "guide" dialouge to tell you how difficult an encounter would be how wrong about as often as it was right.

The music was repetitive beyond all measure, the sound effects and animations were amateurish. 

This game may have been a competitor with Heroes of Might and Magic 1 but nothing in that genre that's been created sense.  

It is possible that if you're willing to give this game more of a chance then I did there is a good game waiting for you on the other end, but I can't imagine it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053090948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 28255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9829, 'last_played': 1434940296}
review:
Still VERY buggy as of January, 2014.

There are a LOT of things that are good about this game.  That only makes it more painful however when you get to the point that it is unplayable because of crashes.  I have a nice gaming rig, but the game has progressively become less and less stable to the point where now I cannot complete even one whole turn.  In other words, it's unplayable.

If you are looking to buy this, I would advise you to wait and see what the discussions say about it after the next patch comes out.  The last one was in September, so we've been waiting for a good while for some fixes.  The next patch has been said to release in January or February.  Here's hoping it helps.

Until the stability is addressed, I would not recommend people buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058391932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1420279735}
review:
This game is broken.

Let me say that idea of the game is awesome, the concept of it, its very good.
The game itself, pretty much broken in my experience.

The game forces you to zerg, for me this seems the only way to win a match, even on easy.
When i drag out a campain on a shard, which you really want to do, because the game lets you do so much when you are on a shard, it becomes almost impossible to beat the enemy.

Let me give a example.
I was fighting against the local lord.
I killed of his entire army and only his lvl 6 warrior hero remained.
That was versus my fully eqxuiped lvl 9 warrior  hero, with 2 healers that both had ammo, 2 archers and a swordman. all around lvl 4-5.
I decided to use auto battle for the match since it was just 1 more unit, and I lost it, the local lord his lvl 6 hero wiped out my entire army on his own, I honestly do not understand how that is possible, when I re did the match, I saw why it happend, since his hero was able to one hit / kill my units, and pretty much kill off my hero in 2 moves.
To me this makes very little sense, but perhaps I am doing something wrong.

A other broken thing is when you start a battle it will give you a green / organge / red text saying it will be easy / normal / hard to win a fight. ( this being the case as well saying it would be easy to win against his local lord, but turned out to be rather hard )
Most of the times this is rarely the case , some of the fights that are being  told you would win wihtout losing anything, are hard as hell and you lose half your army, and some fights it says you dont have a chance to win, you win completely without a problem.

Also something that bugs me, but this is my own opinion, is early in the game, where you're gold is being used to troop building / castle building, you get random encounters on the lands you hold saying the people need / want this or that for X amount of gold, which you dont have at that time since you just started the game, leading into angry people.

Now I really like the idea of this game, and how it works, I just wished it was working better then it is right now, the fact that its 4 months without any updates or anything has me a little worried though.
Although I believed I read something about them working on something new, but dont know if its true.

I would not recommned this game right now as it can be very frustrating, but perhaps I am just doing something completely wrong.
If that would be the case I would definilty edit this towards alot more postive review, because the game does deserve it, if it works properly!

author: {'steamid': '76561197973049540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3739, 'last_played': 1452475166}
review: With all the new patches up and running this game is well worth the money spent. Its map randomizer is a huge plus, as you can make your own random maps with little time yet have full control.  Its AI opponents are particularly well done, with their own agendas and play styles. This game offers many many hours of fun as you explore the shards of the broken world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073842452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 38207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20053, 'last_played': 1594993226}
review:
Игра для тех, кто любит неспешные тактические пошаговые бои долгими зимними вечерами. Можно играть сотнями часов. Не знаю, сколько времени займёт прохождение до финала. Но скорее всего, вы просто не сможете пройти один из ключевых боёв. 
Количество "багов" в игре прогрессирует вместе с уровнем вашего осколка. Несколько раз удавалось найти обходной путь. Как пример, невозможно было напасть на замок противника. К счастью, удалось заклнаниями поднять восстание, и осколок стал моим. Но когда в очередной раз столкнулся с проблемой - невозможно провести любой бой, так как игра зависает, просто бросил играть.
Да, добавлю, что поддержки от разработчика нет. Все известные ошибки были зафиксированы ещё в конце 2013 года, но с тех пор никаких новостей. Электронная почта разработчика не отвечает, форм на сайте игры мёртв. Так что решайте сами. Возможно, кому то повезёт, и он сможет дойти до финала. Кому-то, возможно, нравятся бои в столь знакомом стиле. А иначе - игра не стоит ваших денег.

review:
I gave this game a shot as it looked fun. Maybe I just can't get into turned based games again or this just fun enough to keep my attention.

The script feels like its written by a 10 year old, the graphics are clunky and boring and the classes are not really well defined. I don't know more what to say. Its a rip off of Heroes of Might and Magic/Kings bounty but it does a terrible job of it.

I feel like my money would have been better spent on something else.

Don't bother buying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063999605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1425731524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198027209642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1542915702}
review:
Un bellissimo strategico a turni ad ambientazione fantasy che consiglio caldamente a tutti gli appassionati del genere. Veramente stupendo. 

L'unica cosa da specificare, che dovrebbe essere ovvia visto il genere ma evidentemente tanto ovvia non è viste certe lamentale su steam, è che si deve leggere il manuale (che pecca per incompletezza fra l'altro) e possibilmente qualche guida su internet; niente di troppo complicato ma si devono veramente capire bene le meccaniche del gioco e il tutorial non lo fa sufficientemente. 

Come nota sappiate che non c'è una mappa globale enorme alla civilization per dire ma tante "mappe" piccole  e grandi (alcuene molto) che si vanno a conquistare di volta in volta, ogni mappa conquistata (shard) sblocca nuovi edifici e possibilità che potranno essere esplorate in quella dopo (dove si "ricomincia da capo" se non per qualche bonus e le suddete nuove cose sbloccate).

author: {'steamid': '76561198009484076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6694, 'last_played': 1470694543}
review:
Wer spiele wie Risiko mag und Siedler von Catan gern spielt, der kommt an Eador nicht vorbei! Echte Suchtgefahr Garantiert! Eine (Halb)Gott Geschichte, bei der man selbst zwischen Gut und Böse und damit Hass oder Liebe seiner Untertanen etwas beeinflusst. Strategiezüge auf den Scherben und Schlachten ala Kings Bounty. Vier Heldenklassen und mit jeder Scherbe ein neuer Anfang, eine neue Welt mit der Ihr eure eigene erweitert!

-Nach Flo`s Hinweis habe ich meine Rezzi korrigiert, ja muss leider sagen: "Wer bei den Steamsales billig zuschlägt, übersieht manchmal Ursächlich, das es immer noch Spiele ohne Demo gibt! ^^" - Schade leider, eventuell bringt der Publisher noch eins. Ansonsten, bei Youtube nach Eador suchen, es gibt aus der Betazeit an die 50 Videos zum Game. Nicht grad viel im gegensatz zu ner Demo, aber immerhin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964092901', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 6033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5053, 'last_played': 1390259984}
review: This has to be one of the most fun and least repetitive turn based games I've ever played.  I honestly can't get enough.  With so many options available it just doesn't get old.  I highly recommend playing this.  Worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027106931', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 15117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3454, 'last_played': 1508688062}
review:
If you enjoy the old school Heroes of Might and Magic you'll like this game. It takes out some of the more frustrating resource management by reducing the types of resources from 6 to 2. Heroes feel a little underpowered in this game, but the four classes are pretty well balanced. The campaign mode adds a nice level of strategy. While each shard you conquer feels like its own world, and is a brief heroes of Might and Magic style game unto itself, the strategic brilliance is in how they link each conquest. As you conquer shards you obtain benefits and unlock technology that you can use in later conquests...for a price. The writing could use some polish, and it's difficult to pin down exactly, but it feels at times as though maybe a less than thorough job was done translating the game from another language. The real gold of this game is in its expanse. It is basically impossible to completely explore every shard, or at least would take a very long time, and the game does a nice job of providing you with new and different encounters. Do I want to try and forge an alliance with the elves on this shard or the halflings? Is it worth the time or should I just slaughter them all and take their lands? Should my hero spend his time hunting down that dragon that's plagueing my kingdom or should he pillage my enemy's domain? It's also nice to be confronted with actually insurmountable obstacles from time to time. No I can't explore this laborynth and kill it's minotaur at level one, but just because I can't face it, doesn't mean I can't see it. So many games have the "you'll get there when you're ready" mentality and it negatively affects suspension of disbelief. 

The story is fairly generic fantasy, but Astral politics can be fun, and it's nice that the way you treat your subjects and those around you has a concrete effect on the way they interact with you. That being said, being a bastard isn't all bad like it is in some games. Some races respect bloodthirst and power. As a do-gooder, I constantly had my orc provinces in rebellion because they view me as oppressive and weak. Certain Astral entities will ally with you out of fear or respect for power rather than just sycophantic loyalty to kindness.

All in all I very much enjoy this game. Is it Shakespeare? No, but it certainly passes the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043296773', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 2430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1459441283}
review: This is clearly one of the most addicting games I've ever played. A mix between Battle for Wesnoth, Heroes of Might and Magic and Total War (referring only to the Province system which is more Total Wari-ish than Europa Universalis) which will sink you deep. Challenging and truly fun to learn while playing, even though sometimes one might think it's a little bit complicated. Turn strategy games fans should be delighted.

review:
This game bloody well rules. Little have I played a game that has given me as much enjoyment since Heroes of Might and Magic 3. The only problem I have with this game are the giant trolls. Trolls will seriously slap your girlfriends booty and you'll have no other choice but to laugh uncomfortably because that motherfucker will spiderman punch the ever living shit out of you.
Then when you both go home she breaks up with you and kicks you out of your own home leaving you with only a handful of soldiers to hopefully reclaim your lost kingdom. Then when your feeling pretty good about yourself, the troll slaps your ass.
Slaps
all
of
your
booty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007455362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 20350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17603, 'last_played': 1451129602}
review:
Pros:
- Lengthy campaign
- Well designed and flexible turn-based combat system
- Random event/world generation
- Overflowing with elements from other genres to add depth
- Multiple playstyles can be effective
- Well implemented auto-save system

Cons:
- Campaign is a bit too lengthy due to repetition
- Still riddled with bugs that can be game breakers
- No voice audio, entirely text-driven plot
- Erratic AI behaviour and levelling

Ultimately if you are a fan of the turn-based strategy genre then you probably won’t want to miss out. But until Snowbird either adds in a whole new raft of features (multiplayer options, alternate ways to conquer shards) then for the sake of pretty graphics it’s hard to imagine why you would pay upwards of £20 for an identical remake of a game that is still available for £2 - especially in a genre where graphics are less than a secondary concern.  The amount of bugs and crashes I experienced as well as the constant repetitiveness makes this a hard game to recommend but at the same time I have enjoyed the game and how exceptionally well this game is put together beneath the surface.  Juggling multiple management systems and tieing them to karma, story and making the whole experience fluid is not something to dismiss on a whim, however that already appeared to be present in the original game, so the question remains: what value has Snowbird Games really brought to Eador?  That is a question I struggle to answer, even after 98 hours.

A (now) solid turn based strategy game that stands shoulder to shoulder with many others but perhaps not quite matching the immersion that the Heroes of Might and Magic series provided.  What it lacks in story and frills it more than makes up for with in depth mechanics and gameplay however it is difficult to see anyone who is pressed for time or ambivalent about this genre sticking with Eador beyond the first few hours - especially when the tutorial alone took me 6 hours because I hadn’t realised there was no need to explore everywhere to 100%!  It’s a shame as the game really comes alive after the first few hours of invading a shard when you get the tier 3 and 4 creatures involved to take on the larger encounters in the game.

7/10

review:
Eador: Master of the Broken World is good for everybody who liked Age of Wonders or the Heroes of Might and Magic Serie. It has a little Tutorial that helps to get things running.

On the flipside there are still bugs in the game that cause it to crash once in a whlie, not very often but annoying enough. The worst for me was, that the multiplayer in this game is only for single figths what makes it totally useless to me. I can only advise to everybody to wait for Age of Wonders 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084682244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1382827864}
review:
I love strategy games of the Heroes of Might and Magic and King's Bounty types. But this didn't feel right. It feels slow and starts out too hard for me. You can't level your units properly because they die so easily. You spend your money just buying new ones after each fight.

Also, I love combing the maps of these kind of games for every little secret or item or whatnot, but doing this in Eador is no fun. You can sit at the same map square and dig and dig and fight increasingly strong opponents, and it feels like you make no progress. I wound up giving it up and uninstalling it, but maybe you'll have more patience with it. It might be good when you get rolling for real.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969377378', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 11765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3882, 'last_played': 1491247142}
review:
Awesome game that so far keeps me coming back for more. Its one of those games where I keep thinking..."Just one more turn, then I'll go to bed". Choose from 4 classes for your first hero/general and then build up armies to follow him around capturing provinces and hunting for treasure as you go. As your resources grow, recruit more heros to lead other armies. Its got a bit of everything - loot, RPG character progression, a story (which I havent really kept up with as I'm fairly early in),  exploration, base building and army customisation.

For people that remember games like Gladius, this is about as close as it gets but with more frills. Highly recommended and was a complete steal in the flash sale. 

My only gripe is that completing some of the quests for the foreign races that you encounter in order to make them allies are sometimes near impossible to complete. Some more directions in game as to where to go to complete the quest would be good, instead of just "Find this item" (which could be anywhere amongst the dozens of map hexes, and in turn anywhere within the hex!).

I had originally got Heroes of Might and Magic which was also on sale, but this is so far infinitely better in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015204210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1394920818}
review: A game with a lot of potential, so perhaps I would recommend with a patch, but right now it seems to have a lot of little bugs. One particular one I have had happen to me on multiple occasions, you fight a battle and win but the hero dies after the battle for no reason I can see (during the battle he would have taken little or no damage).  The hero still shows on the map, and you can give him instructions, but he won't actually do them, so you check his status, and see it's because he's been stricken dead somehow.  Another is that during battle, even though I have auto-combat turned off, sometimes individual units will move or attack on thier own; it happens almost always after you have done something with another unit.  It's annoying and makes battle harder because you never know when a unit will decide to do thier own thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995425192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1367737200}
review:
I'm a big fan of the turn-based strategy genre, but this game does nothing for me.  The interface is unnecessarily weird and difficult to learn.  The rules are ALMOST what you've come to expect, but just different enough that you'll get annoyed on a regular basis.  The gameplay itself is not all that interesting.  As deep and intricate as everything seems to be, actually getting anything done is just too tedious a process for me to want to bother.

Sorry, Eador.  I can see that you're trying really hard.  The problem is, you just don't know HOW to be a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971554149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 7569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7476, 'last_played': 1388335771}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994915857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2849, 'last_played': 1580160014}
review:
Originally reviewed this a few years ago and recommended it after playing the first little bit of the campaign.  It seemed to be hitting all the right notes.  And then I stopped playing.

Picket it up again recently and started a new campaign.  And remembered why I'd put it down in the first place.  By the third shard on the campaign the difficulty ramps extremely, despite supposedly being beginner.  Despite having read numerous guides and despite trying most of the suggested strategies I could find no path to victory.

I realize that the solution is for me to 'git gud' but hey, I'm not writing this review for you. :)

Interesting premise with a great deal of potential.  Just not for someone who's looking for a game to play rather than a mountain to climb.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042605380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 11023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3997, 'last_played': 1703722959}
review:
UPDATE MARCH 15: GAME STILL UNSTABLE EVEN AFTER "FIX" OF MARCH 14TH.  Played only 1 full turn on my current game and it crashed in the middle of the next.



UPDATE 2, January 13 2014: Game is still crashing despite graphic settings fix.  Don't know why it can't just be consistent.

UPDATE: TRY CHANGING THE DYNAMIC LIGHTING OPTION TO "6" INSTEAD OF RANDOM.  MUCH MORE STABLE WITH THIS GRAPHICS SETTING.  SWITCHED TO "RECOMMEND".

OLD REVIEW FOLLOWS.

Eador: Masters of the Broken Game

I started playing this yesterday and have 13 hours in.  Unfortunately it is still glitchy.  Annoyingly, it likes to error out at the very end of the turn, so if you had a couple battles and an interesting random event... Sorry, gotta do it all over again.  And that cool random event will be something different next time.  So the mysterious magic items you see on the reward screen are never examined.

If the game would at least quick-save at the end of every fight, I could give this a "recommend," despite the glitchiness.  If the game is ever fixed, it is definitely recommended.

Consider this a public service announcement: Game still glitchy as of December 25th, 2013.  I hope it is fixed sometime.

EDIT as of December 30th follows:

I've added another 40 hours of playtime, despite glitches and restarts.  Its a testament to the fact that I really do like the game.  I try to limit the number of actions I take per turn, to give the game less opportunity to fail.  But I've hit 3 turns in a row where I've had to restart, and after lengthy battles.

Like I said, if the game is fixed it will be great.  But until then it is a tantalizing tease of a game.  I'm not saying you should never buy it, but wait for it to be a working product.  Save yourself some time and frustration.

I intend to update this review in the future when the game is playable.

People who disagree with this 100% factual review must be out of their mind, or reading reviews to discredit rather than fixing their game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072370060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 20529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16310, 'last_played': 1608649763}
review:
At first the game looks great and a different take on this genre. Sadly the game has an incredibly incompetent development team and that makes this game unplayable.

From spells that just bug out and don't do naything to game crashes to the game corrupting your save files. Playing this game is a pointless exercice in frustation.

These bugs exist ever since the game was lanched and while some things were fixed, the developers never bothered to actually fix everything or even bring this game to a playable state. It just feels like playing an alpha with how often it crashes and corrupts save files.

I thought about buying the second game if perhaps they had made a better version that did not have the same problems as this but from what I saw it was exactly the same thing, a bug, crash filled mess that no one wants to delve into.

Avoid these developers at all costs!

EDIT: There is a mod for the game now called fixers of the broken world which fixes most problems with the game. But the memory leak problems are still there and those are entirely related to certain maps. So if you're thinking of buying since there is a fix. Be warned, you still need some tolerance for the bugs. Also the mod only works with the expansion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035336958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8044, 'last_played': 1582082622}
review: An innovative spin on the turn-based strategy genre. Compare to Heroes of Might and Magic or Disciples. Well worth the money it features near endless gameplay, diverse maps, interesting characters, and tons of quests, loot, enemies, buildings, and units to play with. You can also be as kind a ruler as you wish, or as evil a tyrant. Eador has some cons; a diplomacy system that is extremely limited and almost completely non-user firendly (I have yet to successfully forge an alliance with another master while on a shard). It also forgoes a totally pure RPG system like the Heroes series as heroes don't carry over between maps. So while you can level up to your hearts delight within a shard, all those experience points and high-powered items are lost once you beat it. Your deity character is also non-customizable and has little effect on actual gameplay. But besides these minor qualms fans of the TBS genre should pick this one up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034817352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1884, 'last_played': 1589340125}
review: This is a pretty fun game. Single player could be comparable to Rise of Legends and a Heroes of Might and Magic game. I'm just waiting on an update that includes a multiplayer version of the shard battles. Currently the only multiplayer is for the skirmishes your heroes have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017211170', 'num_games_owned': 1164, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1387772910}
review: This game is certainly not easy. Be prepared to start over a lot, but each time you learn a little more to help you with your strategies the next time. Definitely not for someone who becomes easily frustrated by not having an 'I Win' button, but great for those that wish to have something challenging that takes time to master.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018176700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1431912272}
review:
Promising game, but too many big things wrong with it to recommend. Variety is sorely lacking - Units are divided into alignment, and despite a plethora of building construction becomes surprisingly linear based on what the surrounding area looks like, and there is only one player faction. Balance is bad too, with the margin for error being extremely unforgiving -  I couldn't make any headway even with the game set on beginner.

The setting, while enchanting, comes off as little more than your standard D&D story that we've all seen a hundred times. In the end, while strategy experts might enjoy it, there's just too many other strategy games with more depth and character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056135797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3371, 'last_played': 1389644036}
review:
+ The overworld is nice looking. 
+ Has a cute town upgrade system that shows the new buildings and technologies.
+ Units and monsters are detailed and well animated, though some animations are over-long.


+ / - Quite slow and very long. Each province needs capturing, then you can usually fight one or two side battles there straight away, then upgrade it (one building per turn only), then 'exploring' to quell overpopulation (about 5% explored per turn, totally automated, no actual walking around or exploration) which uncovers more battles. With over a dozen provinces per stage there is an awful lot of content, albeit drip-fed.

- Unfulfilling, slow combat.
- Even with a huge advantage, using the auto-battle will get half your force killed.
- The battles really don't have much to do with 'strategy and tactics'. The battlefields are so small, so full of terrain and your army so comparatively huge that you almost run out of room to deploy them (leading to just plonking them down wherever you can), units get in each other's way, leading to fiddly, grindy crawls across a map dominated by choke points. Pretty shallow, more about numbers than anything else.

If you like more board-gamey strategy games (like FF Tactics) then you might like this. But otherwise, don't bother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983196289', 'num_games_owned': 1603, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1377305480}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029042850', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1399, 'last_played': 1398956742}
review:
В отличии от первой части - прикрутили стандартные для ПК игр сохранения (раньше были неудобные, но как бы вписанные в логику мира откаты во времени, а теперь - сейвся когда хочешь, возвращайся куда хочешь, а не только в прошлый ход). Так же сделали онлайн, который правда пуст, да и играть там можно только в схватке (т.е. есть только битва армиями, набранными на определённые очки, сыграть на целой карте, с развитием и проч. - никак, только тот самый хот сит, который был и в оригинале). При этом всём есть нафиг ненужный 3Д-двиган. От его введения игра стала только медленней, ибо на красивые текстурки - пофиг, это ж не боевик, а стратегия. Плюс в оригинале было ЛУЧШЕЕ из возможных меню построек, а в новой версии его сделали другим, и пользоваться стало неудобно.  И дело не в привычке, в старой версии всё было на одной страничке, а в новой - постройки распиханы на несколько вкладок - и переключасться - неудобно, это конечно мелочь, но непонятно - зачем было чинить то, что не сломано?

Так что брать можно только в том случае если оригинал неведом, ибо сама по себе игра достойная, хотя я и описал считай одни минусы, плюсов много, но все плюсы есть в оригинальной игре (кроме нормальных сохранений), так что тем кто играл в оригинал не вижу смысла играть во вторую часть, тем кто не играл - можно купить и погонять, а можно взяь оригинал и погонять в него. Выбор ваш, но всяко - игра достойна того что бы в неё поиграть. Очень много хороших решений по игровому процессу, и играть интересно, одно замечу - геймплей длиииииииииннющий, хотя не для всех людей это минус.

review: I've ben waiting for a game like this one for YEARS, yes, YEARS, it's ben over a decade that I couldn't find a good turn based strategy game, All the HoM&M where kinda meh, more and more of the same thing, Civilization has only the franchise name lately, the last titles it released where terrible, if you like turn based games, Eador will definitively please you, it's simply awesome in every aspect

author: {'steamid': '76561197972621243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 822, 'last_played': 1432592076}
review:
Well first and foremost this game is way too hard. I know I'll come off sounding like a whiney kid, but with 7 different difficulty levels the easeaist shouldn't be that hard. The combat which is kept in a hexagonal turnbased style known from Heros of might and magic (and many others) has to be fought out with extreeme attention to detail each and every time - if not a weaker enemy will kill you. 

Thats great if you enjoy that kind of thing. If you want things to go a little faster - there is a "instant battle" button - or as I like to call it "Instant loss" button. So if you are into micromanaging the same stuff over and over and over again - starting over from scratch on each new map - this is the game for you.

If not - stay clear of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000929498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2600, 'last_played': 1398912999}
review:
Not what I expected.  This game makes you conquer a small map, which ranges from hard to impossible depending on the difficulty level you pick, and then start over again dozens of times without much to show for each conquest.  Now the game is pretty well made and polished, so it is fun if you're not playing on the higher difficulty levels while you are conquering, but the fact that you have to start over every time kills it for me.

I like playing on the higher difficulties, so now I just figured out a strategy which lets me win and this takes out some of the joy out of it as well - I am forced to use the same strategy over and over, otherwise I will lose.  Got old really quick.

review: I liked this game a lot. Civ meets HoMM 3 combat. Remake of an original that was equally complex. Reinforces what I already knew, more time, thought, and love went into older games in regards to gameplay and story. Why don't we just graphically remake old classics. XCom is a great example even if they simplfied that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983038989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3582, 'last_played': 1421513934}
review:
Eador: Masters of the Broken World is the very definition of a "flawed gem". It's a brilliant turn-based strategy with classical "heroesque" tactical battles, solid stronghold and province management component and profound RPG systems on top of that all. Add to that a uniquely structured campaign (albeit a one that's a bit too long to my liking) in an interesting charming setting with a good deal of both humour and seriousness. Imagine if Heroes of Might and Magic and Master of Magic had an illegitimate child. That's pretty much what Eador is. Sounds utterly fantastic, right? If only that was the whole deal.

Unfortunately not everything is sunshine and roses. Masters of the Broken World is actually a sort of a remake and a sequel, all-in-one. It took the great gameplay mix described above straight from its predecessor - Eador: Genesis. The idea was to greatly enhance the graphical appearance of the game with tons of *shinies* and stuff. Too bad it didn't really work out as planned. The new graphics aren't ugly, even somewhat nice but mostly awkwardish. The interface was a goddamn mess at launch and although it got better with patches, it's still pretty clunky. Add to that the fact that despite all the updates the army of bugs is still undefeated to this day. 

To summarize: the game is fantastic at its core, it has one of the best gameplay in the genre, but the technical side of things leaves much to be desired. Be prepared to battle the interface and fend off nasty glitches and bugs. Having said that, I must stress once more that despite the shortcomings, the game itself is brilliant. Don't let yourself be frightened off by superficial things, embrace the addiction.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095815247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 6126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1601422584}
review: I prefered the older version.  Nothing really new besides the bugs and 3d animation, Story line is still seemed to be the same...I thought the hotkeys would be the same as the older.  Apparently not...  Combact speed is also pretty slow.  Needs a decent graphics card or processor to manage it.  4/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018455082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4084, 'last_played': 1588981896}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049309242', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 4634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4634, 'last_played': 1385882540}
review:
Вы когда-нибудь мечтали стать Богом? При этом, чтобы у вас был собственный уютный мирок со своими жителями, и вы постепенно могли бы его делать его еще более большим и уютным? Если ответ положительный, то обязательно попробуйте игру Эадор: Владыки Миров.
Как и было сказано, вы играете за Бога, который сам и не помнит, как им стал. Собственно, это все, что вам нужно знать о главном герое. Дальше вы пишите его историю сами. Кем быть: носителем лучей добра или приспешником зла, решать только вам. Собственно, цель игры - это захватить как можно больше осколков мира Эадор, который был разрушен, объединить под своим командованием и стараться победить демонов Хаоса, появление которых рассказывается в пророчестве. Помимо вас, в мире есть еще не один десяток богов, которые также объеденяют осколки мира для своих целей. От того, стремитесь ли вы к свету или ко тьме, отношение тех или иных богов к вам будет соответствующим. Во время битвы за очередной осколок, вам будут выпадать случайные события, решения которых будут определять, злой вы, или добрый. В зависимости от вашей кармы вы можеет заключать союзы с нейтральными юнитами: c вечнопьяными и веселыми гномами и справедливыми эльфами, или с гнусными гоблинами и агрессивными орками. Так же есть расы с нейтральными взглядами, которым на ваш путь плевать с высокой колокольни, только союз с ними обычно заключить довольно проблематично. Пока враг еще не у вашей границы, можно заняться десятком различных дел: исследовать захваченные провинции, идти дальше расширять территории, посражаться на боевой арене, наведаться в магазин мага за новым товаром, пробраться в лабиринт и улизнуть с сокровищами, не попавшись при этом страже, и многим-многим другим...
Строительство замка - тоже интересное занятие. Постройка некоторых зданий с юнитами может вам навсегда закрыть доступ к другим, поэтому придется поломать голову, кого взять в данной ситуации лучше, а кого отложить до лучших времен.
В общем и целом Эадор - это игра, красивая и сказочная, в которой вам придется принять не одну сотню тяжелых решений, пролить много вражеской крови, потерять сотню-другую бойцов ради всего лишь одной цели - и эта цель, объединить мир для своих, возможно, пока еще не составленных, целей...

author: {'steamid': '76561197973706677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 16337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15543, 'last_played': 1556476321}
review: Oldschool turnbased strategic game, kind of reminds of the good old days of Heroes of Might and Magic. Sadly it also reminds of the bad old days of Heroes of Might and Magic. The game is quite challanging and complex but then again its slow in progression, not very friendly to anyone new to the genre and the basic functions arent explained very well. I can recommand it to anyone willing to sacrifice some time to get used to it...and the ability to cope with frustration...^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197993745882', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 10701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9270, 'last_played': 1481406845}
review:
The best way to describe Eador: Master of the Broken World is that is very much like heroes of might and magic or other hex based, turn based combat games mixed with a strategic map more alike something from the total war series.

But unlike other games set in alike setting, you do not get to chose race, however in its place is a karma system and so you still deal with creatures of different alignments and it also extends to the strategic events and affects such things as random events.

There are a few problems, namely the random nature of events and not knowing what causes it. I felt that it took a good while before things became clear to the players as to what might trigger within certain terrain, by certain races and for what reasons. While some might argue that it keeps things fresh and you on your toes at all times, I found it at least as much frustrating to be punished for things I couldn't possibly predict.

Because of this, some other random elements and because of limited knowledge of unit composition and generally what a good way is to start, I would say this game has a very steep learning curve. For some this might be a strictly bad thing, while others might enjoy figuring things out.

It should also be said that the more you learn, the more restricted you might feel as some choices are real not much of a choice at all, like your starting hero for example.

Sometimes the games can drag on, and because the game is repetitive in its nature, due to how the campaign is played by generating a new map with a basic start for every single new world you try to take over, progression can feel slow and unrewarding between maps.

But overall, it can be very tactically challenging and worthy the time of those who enjoy some management and above all this style of hex based turn based combat.
