review: This game is awesome. It's like everything I ever wanted in HOMM but without the crap company behind it. There are a few bugs, sure, but the devs are great on fixing stuff and have personally fixed save files for some community members. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015706912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4565, 'last_played': 1627745165}
review:
Великолепная пошаговая стратегия с оригинальными идеями и подходом.
Шикарная картинка, множество монстров и магии.
Возможность обыграть разные роли на пути к владению всем миром осколков ;3

author: {'steamid': '76561198055121346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2281, 'last_played': 1541041907}
review: Eador is very similar to Age of Wonders 2. This game is very much in line with the strategy genre where you move your hero and his minions and fight a battle on a field. Tactics are important, strategy a must, and even though you battle it out a lot the overworld play is also critical managing resources etc. It is a good overall game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198077064688', 'num_games_owned': 1006, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 17611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5283, 'last_played': 1684396391}
review:
Эта игра имеет жанр: "Пошаговой стратегии, с элементами рпг".  Эадор: Владыки миров это ремейк Эадора: Сотворения, но с красивой и приятной для глаз графикой.

Разработчик (он был один) потратил на создание первой части игры около 7 лет, если в прошлом вам нравились серии игр "Heroes of Might and Magic"/"Disciples", то эта игра вам определенно понравится. Длительность компании составляет приблизительно 30-40 осколков, на захват одного из осколков уходит от 30 до 300 минут (не считая свободной игры) Так что игра продолжительная и не надоест вам. В Эадор имеется очень хороший баланс между юнитами, магией и героями (это хорошо ощущается на уровне нормала (и выше) - 100% сложности - 100% хп у врагов и стандарный инком - сложность эксперт).

Хорошая линии сюжета и множество концовок игры, что честно говоря радует. Если говорить проще, эта игра собрала все лучшее из большинства пошаговых игр прошлых лет. У неё получилось собрать из множество частичек других игр свою собственную хорошую и качестенную игру, но и конечно же она имеет свои особые специфические стороны.

Если не уверены брать или не брать - можете скачать с оффициального сайта первую часть игры "Eador: Сотворение" (DMR, без граффики)

http://www.eador.com/eador1/downloads.html
1. Скачать демо-версию (после выхода 2 части, она уже не демо и ключ не требуется для полной версии).
2. Скачать обновление до версии...

author: {'steamid': '76561198047237535', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2672, 'last_played': 1419324935}
review:
Hello,

This is, in my opinion, a triple A title. That having been said, I would also like to point out that many triple A titles are more often then not unpolished and lacking on release, but patched at some point. As others have said, the game plays somewhat like Civilization/Heroes of Might and Magic. The developers don't seem to be in full swing patch-mode anymore either, which is really sad because it needs it.

One of the things I enjoyed the most was the exploration aspect of the game. Your heroes explore each province to provide more land for the province's population to settle comfortably. In the process you come across bandits, monsters, and unique shops. Sadly, for each positive aspect of the game, it tends to turn around on itself and bite it's own rear end. In this example , the game all but forces to you play with a "rush/zerg" mentality. Getting your hero(es) to the enemies stronghold as fast as possible, because nothing transfers over to the next map, and building up your empire on the shard is more or less wasted time. Couple that with the fact that the longer you play, the more the AI seems to advance in suspect manner (I've more then one grumbled the word "Cheater" at the computer screen). 

The game is very good, I played it for a long time and still visit it when the mood hits. Despite it's shortcomings, I would recommend it if you like HoMM/Civ/Fallen Enchantress/ect.

Cheers,
Michael

author: {'steamid': '76561197999277363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 18660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10258, 'last_played': 1638258113}
review:
It takes a good 2-10 hours to get into this game, but once you do, it is a great deal of fun and the main campaign is good for at least 150 hours.  The play feels like a better-balanced Master of Magic where the strategic (map) play is much smoother (one main city to upgrade, better resourcing) while the tatical (battle) play reminds me of Kings Bounty, but you don't cycle through troops as fast and they end up meaning more to you.  

Over all, if you like 4X or strategy games with turn-based combat, this is the best game of 2012 and 2013 in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006898454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2361, 'last_played': 1373885997}
review:
Το Eador: Masters of the Broken World κατάφερε παρ'όλα αυτά να βρει μόνιμη θέση στο σκληρό μου δίσκο και σκοπεύω να επανέρχομαι συχνά-πυκνά σε αυτό για να εξερευνήσω όλες τις πτυχές του. Έχω προσωπική αδυναμία στα... δύστροπα games και κατά συνέπεια μπόρεσα με σχετική άνεση να αντιπαρέλθω την εμφανή έλλειψη του λεγόμενου "polish", καταλαβαίνω όμως οτι οι περισσότεροι gamers δεν έχουν καμία διάθεση να υποστούν πρώτα ταλαιπωρία για να καταφέρουν να απολαύσουν ένα παιχνίδι. Σε αυτή την κατηγορία παικτών θα πρότεινα να περιμένουν μερικούς μήνες για τα απαραίτητα patches και να επανεξετάσουν την περίπτωση του Eador με την ευκαιρία κάποιας προσφοράς, αφού πρόκειται για έναν ενδιαφέροντα και αρκετά πρωτότυπο τίτλο. Από την άλλη, οι φανατικοί του είδους ας βάλουν το Eador στη Wishlist τους αφού τελειώσουν το Heroes VI: Shades of Darkness γιατί το παιχνίδι πραγματικά το αξίζει.

Bugs, glitches, ατέλειες, προβλήματα αλλά και βαθύ gameplay, πολλές ώρες παιχνιδιού, ποικιλία, τακτική, RPG, grand strategy σε ένα πακέτο. Αγαπημένοι μου ανατολικοευρωπαίοι developers, μην αλλάξετε ποτέ! Διαβάστε το πλήρες review στη διεύθυνση http://ragequit.gr/reviews/item/eador-masters-of-the-broken-world-pc-review

author: {'steamid': '76561198036058263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1385437279}
review: I'm on the fence about this game. On one hand it is a fairly fun. The game structure works for me, but there is a lot of missed potential. The AI is either too easy, or just tedious to play against. The story mode takes too long before you unlock even half the units. I'm 40 hours in and have unlocked about half. This wouldn’t be so bad, but the game starts to get repetitious when you get one new unit, that you probably wont use, every few hours. I ended up putting the game down when this repetition got to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040628088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 40359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1727, 'last_played': 1561885436}
review: I highly recommend this game.   It's like playing civilization but with Wizards and Warriors.  It's different from Civilization but has the same building a civ type ingredients.  You get to build different buildings in your Stronghold and the game is entirely Turn based Strategy even Combat like Civilization except you go to a separate map for combat.  You can build up your heroes so they can command more troops and cast new and different spells.  And build different buildings in your Stronghold that dictate what kind of troops you can build or what benefits you receive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995331356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 45534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10442, 'last_played': 1703896548}
review:
If you like Turn Based Strategy with a little more thought behind it, and you liked games like Heros of Might and Magic you'll love Eador.

It was made as a love letter to classic TBS games by a small group of Russian devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047194570', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5833, 'last_played': 1658619836}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963996120', 'num_games_owned': 1370, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1386125200}
review: This is the first game in a long time that kept me up late doing the "just one more turn" thing. I enjoy it's turn-based pace. It seems simple enough because who wants to do a bunch of slide-rule theorycrafting before every click? So far, I've only played the warrior hero, and am trying to finish the map or level cap before starting another hero. Grab this one the next time it's on sale (not putting the game down, but it's a $10 game in my book).

author: {'steamid': '76561198049990742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1699477112}
review: I remember this as Eador : Genesis but this version updates the game with more content and HD graphics. Anyone who loves their TB Strategy games should own this - It's deep, tough and has tons of content and is difficult to describe beyond comparisons with HoMM series, however this indie game definately adds something new to the genre, not least its high level of challenge and superb tactical battle system, random events, a wealth of world locations to explore and fortress management options to get your head around. You can easily lose 200+ hrs to this game, so be warned!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007308888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 17416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3506, 'last_played': 1575235862}
review:
This is a great game in the style of Heroes of Might & Magic. It's a bit more difficult to learn than your average game and  you can expect to get beaten down a bit in the beginning, but once you pickup on the strategy - it is very fun.

It's a cheap little indie game with a unique take on a strategy rpg. The campaign is long and grueling - be prepared to invest some hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011292213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3478, 'last_played': 1380586878}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004553771', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1578, 'last_played': 1380475545}
review:
Kein gutes Spiel!

Auf dem ersten Blick mag Eador: Masters of the Broken World, toll aussehen, aber umso länger man es dann spielt umso uninteressanter wird dann das Spiel.

Was mich am meisten stört ist: Das man nach jeder eroberten Scherbe, komplett neu mit dem Stadtaufbau und Helden leveln von vorne anfangen muss, gut der Stadtaufbau ist ja noch zu verkraften da man sowieso mit jeder neuen Scherbe, weitere neue Gebäude dazu bekommt, aber das man jedes mal einen komplett neuen Helden erstellen und leveln muss, find ich total nervig, gerade noch in auf der letzten Scherbe erreichte mein Held endlich mal Stufe 10 und wurde endlich mal zu einen brauchbaren, starken Helden, und kurz darauf war der letzte Gegner auf der Scherbe besiegt und schon war alles umsonst, da ich in der nächsten Scherbe ja wieder komplett neu anfangen "durfte".

Auch die Rassen bzw Einheitenauswahl find ich eher ungelungen als gelungen, hier hätte ich mir doch eine richtige Rassenauswahl ala Heroes of Might and Magic gewünscht und nicht so eine misch-masch Truppenauswahl, von denen mind. die hälfte davon unbrauchbar sind (ich sage als Beispiel nur Steinschleudertyp).

Ich habe mir von dem Spiel erwartet das es eine Mischung aus Civ5 und Heroes of Might and Magic ist, da mir diese Mischung sehr gut gefällt und das Spiel Fallen Enchantress es gezeigt hat das diese Mischung auch sehr gut funktioniert.

Wer daher wie ich, ein Spielmix aus Civ5 und HOMM sucht der sollte die Finger von Eador: Master of the Broken World lassen und doch eher zu Fallen Enchantress oder die neue Version: Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes
 greifen, den Fallen Enchantress ist um einiges besser und macht vor allem viel mehr Spaß.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027826544', 'num_games_owned': 1287, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1380051034}
review:
Эадор - наверное, самая задроченная стратегия, что я видел в жизни. Такое ощущение, что когда дизайнеры сели за мозговой штурм, они не смогли исключить ни одну прозвучавшую от рассвета до заката идею. Тут есть просто всё: и Цивилизация, и Кингс Баунти, и Disciples, и Age of Wonders, и Fantasy General/Wars, и миллион всевозможных элементов других игр. 

В итоге получился неповоротливый монстр, в котором совершенно не понятно, что тебе нужно делать и как развиваться. см. для иллюстрации список зданий в столице:
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=140129559
Более сотни разнообразных юнитов не могут нормально ужиться: вместо удобоваримой тактики на поле боя можно делать всё, что угодно - как бегать вдоль вражеских войск, так и свободно расстреливать тылы. Тактика нагнетается с одной стороны высоким уровнем защиты разных юнитов от разных типов повреждения (лучники становятся бесполезны против каменных големов), с другой - органичением боезапаса (закончились стрелы? tough luck) и выносливости (прямо посреди напряжённого боя нужно отдыхать). Юниты получают опыт и развивают скилы, но учитывая вышеизложенное в серьёзных битвах неизбежны потери. 

Самое главное - чтобы отвлечь игрока от вялой системы боя, авторы сделали упор на экономический элемент: теперь ты не можешь просто построить здания и нанять лучшие войска, потому что у каждого воина есть стоимость содержания, а зарабатывание денег - пожалуй, самая удручающая часть игры.

Вся экономика базируется на постройках типа "заплати 60 золота, чтобы получать +2 каждый ход". Новые провинции приносят обычно тоже +(1-9) в ход. При этом какой-нибудь лучник (умирающий с одного/двух ударов, если до него добегут/дострелят) стоит 60 золота, а также -12 (!) в ход. Здания, чтобы его нанять, стоят 300. Получая опыт, жалование армии также растёт. Да, золото дают и за сами битвы (и подземелья), но далеко не в тех количествах, чтобы было комфортно жить. И это я всё веду речь про самый низкий уровень сложности (beginner).

При этом в игре неплохая графика, хорошие диалоги, квесты, случайные события, а также судя по всему развитая сюжетная история. Жаль, что авторам не удалось выбрать какую-то одну нишу, и добиться там баланса, динамики, дружеского отношения к игроку (вместо этой перманентной борьбы за выживание и мозговой бухгалтерии). Впрочем, рекомендую попробовать при случае. Кто знает, может у вас откроется тайная мазохистская нотка ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991874834', 'num_games_owned': 2863, 'num_reviews': 1644, 'playtime_forever': 7149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2950, 'last_played': 1529945791}
review: Удивительная смесь HoMM и Civilization, которая вновь даёт возможность почувствовать себя местным божеством.  Многие игровые элементы и атмосфера сказочного мира очень часто заставляют вспоминать старенькую Mega Lo Mania...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005403195', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 6405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5282, 'last_played': 1380448894}
review:
This is an oddball of a game, on one hand the campaign can be incredibly tedious and repetitive (just got your castle and hero leveled to where you can kick ass? Oh well, time to start the next map from scratch!). But on the other hand, it's the difficulty of fighting you're way up from the bottom that really makes this game shine.

I'm hesitant to recommend this game on word alone, find some videos first and see if you would enjoy the Civ/Might and Magic/Kings Bounty mashup. The game is pretty fun, but after a while, I'm finding I have to take it in small doses as repeating the same actions to win a slightly different map gets very boring (even with maps/shards that have different properties to them, they don't seem to be enough to warrant varying from a proven tactic).

author: {'steamid': '76561198023529887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1419038382}
review: Highly recommended game if you like RPG/strategy turn-based games like Heroes of Might and Magic / Age of Wonders 2. Coming from Steam GreenLight this game was worth every 15 EUR (50% discounted price)!  I would still not buy the game at the current retail price, but once it's on a sale, do grab it. You will not get dispapointed!

review:

Eador: Masters of the Broken World is mediocre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991657927', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 440, 'playtime_forever': 8026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7421, 'last_played': 1500328853}
review: Imagine a typical hex-based strategy game such as Dawn of Fantasy, make it 10x bigger, twice as good, and inject an original and well-written storyline - this is what you get. There are some very minor issues in that the manual is written for acrobat reader but clicking "manual" from the splash screen does not initiate acrobat reader so you have to find the file and do it "manually" - ironic. Also, for some reason, the graphics auto-detect at highest levels produces in game errors where I had to change settings to get screens to display correctly. These issues aside, this is a must-buy game for any who like the genre and all but hardened haters. 90%

author: {'steamid': '76561198053061950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 16368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14137, 'last_played': 1578096043}
review:
While not a giant like AoW or the early Homm Series this game holds its own as a grand strategic game with some development and roleplaying aspects. It has a fairly steep learning curve so be prepared for some level of frustration unless you procede carefully. 

The economics determine your success or failure so be sure to think before buying armies willynilly. Scout/Warrior are best for starting out.

Fair warning: this game will eat up your time if you attempt the campaign mode. And there is a significant chance that there will be game killing errors. I still recommend it but with the caveat that you are buying a deeply flawed and yet beautifully implemented long time scale game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000262690', 'num_games_owned': 4003, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1262, 'last_played': 1400025637}
review: This game, along with Eador: Genesis are a pair of turn based fantasy strategy games made by a handful of russian Devs, and it's cleary a labor of love. If you've played any classic fantasy strategy games like Heroes of Might and Magic, Disciples, or Age of Wonders, you'll feel right at home here. There's a large number of buildings to construct, units to field, all set over a massive, randomly generated campaign that gets more complex as you get further in. If you love any of the games I mentioned, this ones worth a look. One warning though: They're hard, especially Eador: Genesis, which forces you to play in ironman mode: no loading older saves when things go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003526788', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1375547554}

author: {'steamid': '76561198051675171', 'num_games_owned': 1819, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1377654548}
review:
Technically, Eador is bad, but it's a good game and worth to be bought on sale.
A lot of working still missing, but overall is a good and relatively addictive game. Feels to me like a board game, the strategy doesn't seem to have so much depth, but i'm just beginning to playing, to really knows it.

If you will gonna play it, you have to know it will be a long way on a tutorial playthrough, and although it's necessary, this stage seems to be more buggy and/or bad managed. In fact the game really begins when this tutorial ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038758847', 'num_games_owned': 1382, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 20445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5808, 'last_played': 1707439733}
review:
Was kinda leary about this title as the game story seemed a bit odd (shards of a world floating aimlessly in space?  Really?)  I recieved it in a 5 dollar bundle deal.  Playing through the tutorial seamed a bit clunky and glitchy, but that was just the tutorial.  After the first few days of playing (countless hours of playing) , wow, I really like this game.
I will use an analogy from the game story to describe the game.  Its like a gem broken into pieces floating aimlessly, spend some time collecting and putting them together, well, its a gem to behold (thus far).
Its not your typical pick a race, class, here are your abilities, now get to it game.  The shards you attempt to conquer, will add to your abilities and somewhat define and refiine your strategy.  The game has been a pleasant journey of discovery as it doesnt come with a manual (although you can find the manual through google translate if you need game info).  Shards of different gametypes, pieced together (ex: HoMM, Masters of Magic, Warlords, etc) and its friggen extensive.  I am over 40 hours in and not even halfway through.   Altogether, it works for me and if you like these kind of games, you should find this a unique experience as well.
Did I mention the game is huge?  Some shard battles I take time to do some quest, others I have been forced to finish fast as the enemy gives me difficulties (I started playing on skilled mode).  I have heard complaint that the game gets redundant or repetative.  What game do you enjoy playing that doesnt get repetative?  The game solves this with some auto functionality.  You can just quickview the battle, or set it to auto and watch the battle play out.  Sometimes I am forced to do the manual battle as the AI doesnt do the strategy required to win.  It will say this should be easy then you lose your entire army.  The game does save every minute or so and I suggest you do some manual saves (just in case, as there is no restart scenario option).  In all its a minor annoyance in all the richness this game offers.
I have seen many gripes on the forums concerning this game, I have none here.  I guess you will either love it or hate it, but dont be swayed buy the naysayer if the above mentioned gametypes gave you some joy back in the day.  Eador:  Master of the Broken World is a worthy game.
Now if you will excuse me, I have some shards to conquer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972299640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1377723160}
review:
This is an early impression review.

This game seems like a real treat. The visuals are stunning. The music is wonderful. It is something I haven't quite felt since Age of Wonders. The first campaign is very newbie-friendly, going through all you need to know. All in all, this game has everything going for it. It just remains to see whether it stays interesting as you get further. Personally, I tend to tire easily with most turn-based games, and especially rpg games. We'll see, but so far it looks good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998544855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 27750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24499, 'last_played': 1627226915}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057820061', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1432214388}
review:
Что стоит знать об этой игре? Она увлекательная и сложная. Она совершенно не расчитана на новичков и не прощает ошибок. Тем не менее, продуманность игрового мира превращает каждую локацию в особое приключение. К сожалению, расчитывать на ИИ в боях не приходится, в то время как на глобальной карте уже третий из 8 уровней сложности заставит серьёзно поднапрячь мозги.

Моя оценка 8\10 - 1 балл снят за сложность, 1 за ИИ в боях.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042849911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 35899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8028, 'last_played': 1457271888}
review:
Four months after release, this game is totally bug free (in my experience, of course) and offers a combat system that is very different, ballanced, deep and challenging, more than any other recent turn-based games like heroes of might and magic, king's bounty and fallen enchantress. Also, the four heroes types are quite distinct and balanced. The building system is also very, very deep (sadly its building interface is not good as it isdeep).
And cheaper than king's bounty, heroes VI and fallen enchantress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047975106', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 12012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10953, 'last_played': 1390880535}
review:
пришло время запустить ебадор ебадор сам себя не запустит запусти его запусти поскорей зачем мне нужны мморпг у меня нету времени ебатсо с ними лучше еще раз запустить ебадор я запускаю ебадор по 5 раз в день каждый запуск занимает у меня ПЯТНАДЦАТЬ СРАНЫХ МИНУТ я живу активной и полноценной жизнью я успешен и поэтому целый день запускаю ебадор после вылетов а потом смотрю не пропускаемый ролик тупые школоло одержимы своим рейтингом в доте а я свободный от задротства человек аион танки дота контра  я лучше запущу ебадор еще раз патч не нужен я не вылетал из ебадора уже 4 часа пойду снесу мельницу и вылечу к куям а потом еще раз запущу ебадор в запуске ебадора все просто и понятно проблема нечего делать это же очевидно как ее решить пришло время запустить ебадор и тупо ЖДАТЬ

Непропускаемый ролик вроде исчез, спасибо, но серьезно эта игра действительно должна заного устанавливать/настраивать при каждом запуске по 5-15 минут .NET Framework?

author: {'steamid': '76561198017741506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3360, 'last_played': 1415238706}
review: A solid game that is packed full of content for fans of turnbased games in a classic fantasy setting. A must have!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970571810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 3992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3864, 'last_played': 1492984697}
review:
Fun for a while but unless you're willing to put in a serious amount of time (and I'm talking 100 hours plus here) and LOVE strategy games where you get dropped back to the start and have to build from scratch every level: don't bother. If you can stand a fair bit of repetition and are looking for a huge time sink then this is the game for you.

Oh and they seem to reset your achievements every so often as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997793567', 'num_games_owned': 1818, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 18341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12884, 'last_played': 1577750288}
review: Be prepared to put a hundred or so hours into mastering this game.  Is it worth it?  Yes, but be prepared to learn from your mistakes.  It does not hold your hand, nor does it teach you much in the very limited tutorial, oh and there is pretty much nothing online to help either as the game was developed in Russia.  Having said all that, this is one of the best strategy games I have ever played.  Liking this far more than HOMM, King's Bounty, or Fallen Enchantress!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971109813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1374455783}
review: É um TB Fantasy Strategy genérico que não contribui muito para o gênero. Interface e direção de arte confusa, e uma AI visivelmente não honesta, fazem o aprendizado do jogo ser bastante sofrível. Não ajuda também a campanha ser bastante dificíl e bloquear arbitrariamente a tech-tree, de forma que você precisa jogar umas 20h até começar a poder produzir unidades/mágicas minimamente impactantes. Não recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970719873', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1374669690}
review:
A hidden gem! This little TB-RPG is a wolf in sheep's clothing. It's packed with all the things that make role playing fun, and the turn-based combat element is rewarding and challenging.

It's also surprisingly big. The maps seem fairly small at first, but when exploring sectors, it soon becomes apparent that there's another level of depth and content lurking underneath, begging the player to dig deeper.

An absolute must for turn based RPG fans, at a price that is cheaper than a night on the town.

Recommended...

author: {'steamid': '76561197995213961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1373854294}
review:
I give it a 6.  I got about 15 hours out of it before I got bored.  It's a great concept and very ambitious.  The game gets bogged down in tedious combat, unbalanced units, and dumb AI.  Normal units require too much baby sitting to really level, but that's okay because high level heros dominate the field single-handed.  The strategic game lacks too: You're too busy conquering new areas (or re-conquering) to really explore or do quests except as side effect.  The meta-strategic is also neat, but you're so rarely there that it's more an aside than core gameplay.
Really, I enjoyed what they were trying to do here, but I'd rather go play something a little more complex, such as Elven Legacy.

review: This is a bad game. It tries desperately to be either Kings Bounty or Heroes of M&M but has none of the charm. author: {'steamid': '76561198004194619', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 23471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20800, 'last_played': 1563233232}
review:
Eador Master of the Broken World è il remake in 3D di Eador Genesis e come quest'ultimo è un tattico a turni di quelli che cominci con "un altro turno e poi stacco" e poi ti ritrovi l'alba. Nelle prime versioni è stato penalizzato dalla presenza di un sacco di bug fastidiosi, ma la sua formula resta comunque fottutamente addicted. Immaginate di mettere insieme un concept simil-god game in cui nei panni di una divinità dovrete ricostruire, pezzo dopo pezzo, un mondo frantumato, attraverso fasi strategiche e tattiche in pieno stile Heroes of M&M e Master of Magic (leggendario titolo a cui Eador si ispira palesemente). Ne viene fuori una vera e propria droga che vi terrà attaccati al monitor finché non sentirete suonare la vostra sveglia e vi renderete conto di aver completamente saltato ore di sonno che nessuno vi restituirà più. Il vostro ciclo circadiano vi ringrazierà un giorno.
Ho scritto una recensione più dettagliata su TheShelterNetwork.com:

http://theshelternetwork.com/eador-master-of-the-broken-world/

author: {'steamid': '76561198009383387', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 7493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5699, 'last_played': 1424746461}
review:
I certainly got my mony's worth from this game considering the amount of playtime I got vs the price paid.  

Having said that, while this is an entertaining game, the real problem, as with so many strategy games is that the AI poses no real challenge.  The other big problem is that the game-play is somewhat repetitive and you end up doing pretty much the same thing over and over on each shard.

One big complaint is that the AI ends up with some uber-guards to protect thier home city.  This ends up the case over and over and it is just a tiresome thing to deal with nearly every single shard you conqure.

While this is a fun game, it does have some major game-play problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054780409', 'num_games_owned': 1814, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1926, 'last_played': 1458064481}
review:
Eador -It is a mixture of various games such as Civilizations, King's Bounty, Disciples, Heroes. The hero, as in Disciples is power, pump it, he can compete with the most powerful units. Branched "pumping" of heroes and fighters get the experience and the heroes and units, on obtaining a new level they get ability.
The game features a variety of system events that enrich the gameplay, help to build a monument, burn the witch, and so on. The game has a good share of humor. By the way, right about the buildings are hundreds of them and all want to build. A huge variety of units, artifacts, everything. And by the way, yes, finally the hero can not just put the two rings, as much as much as 4!

PS
One of the downsides of the game in my opinion is the complexity, but with the same and this is a plus. But first it will be very difficult. 

Raiting 9 from 10!

Sorry for my English!
____________________________________________________________


Это смесь различных игр, таких как Civilizations, King’s Bounty, Disciples, Heroes. Герой, как и в Disciples это сила, прокачав его он может посоревноваться с самыми сильными юнитами. Разветвленная «прокачка» героев и бойцов, опыт получают и герои и юниты, по получению нового уровня новые способности.
В игре присутствует система различных событий, которая обогащает игровой процесс, помогите построить памятник, сожгите ведьму и т.д.. В игре присутствует хорошая доля юмора. Кстати, да насчет построек их сотни и все хочется построить. Огромное разнообразие юнитов, артефактов, всего. И кстати да, наконец то герой может одеть не всего два кольца, а аж целых 4!!!

П.С
Одним из минусов игры на мой взгляд является сложность, но с тем же это и плюс. Но поначалу будет очень трудно.

Оценка 9 из 10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010055383', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1435052035}
review:
VERY detailed, rich, interesting game. It LOOKS really good, and on paper it SOUNDS amazing: conquer floating shards and add them to your own floating world to create a massive continent and challenge other gods and take their land. Where each shard is it's own map and you fly on over to it using a Hero to command troops n' shit. It's basically like Civs. It's another Civs hexagon RTS game, okay?

Anyway, it's buggy as shit: A.I is dumb, game is unplayable if you've got more than 2 players, the combat is long and can take away from the rest of the game, and the "auto-fight" option to skip all that does NOT prioratize your hero (if your hero dies you have to Rez him or create an entire new party of troops to take control/fight for tiles)... so seriously, wtf. There's also no "free play mode" so if you want to do what the game advertises you have to play the campaign.

I dunno, it's alright, but It becomes more unplayable the longer you play it. The Games difficulty setting has no baring on how intelligent the Comp is as well.

review:
Довольно неплохая стратегия.
Из плюсов: большое количество юнитов и зданий, довольно неплохой геймплэй и длинная компания.
Из минусов: во-первых, компания довольно-таки однообразная и быстро надоедает. Во-вторых, мультиплеер. К моему большему сожалению, в него почти никто не играет, следовательно он бесполезен...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034340520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 16948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11384, 'last_played': 1705782623}
review:
**WARNING** - This is NOT for those of you that want to mindlessly click and play and have instant gratification for little or no work. Go play Great Big War Game for that. This game simply put is the best Turn Based Strategy title to come down the pike since Civ 5. It is hard, yes. Even on easy it is difficult to manage and balance all the things you need to manage and balance in these type games (Economy, happiness, army upkeep etc). There IS a way to accomplish it but it takes smarts and determination. The rewards are well worth he work. The Pros and Cons are as follows :

PROS :

1.) Easy to learn interface. If you cant master this interface in the first 10 minutes then you need to exit the game and delete it because you will be lost like a fart in a whirlwind. Go play solitare as it is more your speed.

2.) Tutorial brings you up to speed. Easy to learn, hard to master 

3.) Very challenging. This is not a simple fast gratification game. Hard core TBS gamers only.

4.) The Risk vs Reward system is well balanced unlike other games. 

5.) A Deep, rich game that has untold hours of replayability in it.

Cons :

1.) Poorly designed building tech tree. It has some good elements to it BUT the design of it makes it very difficult to know what to build to get the unit, spells, items you want. Could have been much better.

2.) The AI tends to take too long in making its moves on the overall map and in combat .... but at least in combat you can move your combat speed to max and that fixes the problem.

3.) The game sometimes will hang in combat and get stuck in the hourglass mode ... but you can hit ESC and then click "Quick Combat" and it will simulate the results for you ending the battle. They should patch that problem soon I hope. 

Well that about sums it up. If you are a hardcore TBS gamer ... this is for you .... if you are a casual TBS gamer ... move along .... back to RISK for you :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012699501', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1436987764}
review: Позор. Просто позор. Даже сетевая игра не стоит такого падения качества... да и учитывая, как сетевая реализована - нечем ей завлекать. У них была готовая игра, у них были ресурсы, надо было добавить самую малость - и даже в таких тепличных условиях они умудрились обгадиться буквально на каждом шаге. Скачайте "Эадор. Сотворение". Он правда гениален. И не покупайте это дерьмо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018403892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 2151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1682613471}
review: Eador shipped out with plenty of bugs and very little new content compared to the other Eador game... In fact it was just graphics and some campaign mechanics that were updated... So... for a turn based strategy/RPG for 20bucks that comes out of the soviet union, this is pretty good. The problem is I spent 40 hours on genesis, and since this is identical, it bores me much quicker than it should... Overall, if you are a fan of these turn based strategy games, this is a steal for the price it has on... Comparable to Fallen Enchantress, but way cheaper...

author: {'steamid': '76561198027998028', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 5080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4925, 'last_played': 1561231005}
review:
Eador ha arriesgado algunos cambios en el género (respecto a clásicos como la saga HoMM) y le ha salido bien. Las draconianas restricciones de construcción y reclutamiento, así como los constantes eventos del mapa estratégico, lo dotan de una dificultad más que considerable concediendo una importancia capital a cada decisión.

Como todos sus hermanos de género no se libra de resultar un poco lento en ocasiones. Aunque no es raro que una revuelta élfica o una invasión de arañas gigantes lo saquen del letargo.

Un arte típico pero adecuado y bonito, buen humor y un interfaz mejorable completan el juego. Si gustas del 4X, la alta fantasía y, especialmente, de ambos, resulta un título más que interesante. Muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970322928', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 34928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26784, 'last_played': 1532823061}
review:
So, I've had a chance to play this game for a couple hours now... or 300, I guess. I do like it a lot, so I feel like I owe the game and the developers my feedback, which might help some people decide that they should get this! (or not, I suppose).

Firstly, it's a turn based strategy game in a fantasy setting. Anyone who's a fan of that genre knows that it can be really difficult to tell a good one from a bad one by looking at screenshots on Steam. As a result, I own the complete collection of bad ones.

I classify this game as good. For me personally, it's probably one of my favorite games, and would be in the shortlist of titles that I might choose from if I were forced to play only one game forever. Other titles in this "shortlist" might be Dominions 3, and Heroes of Might and Magic III. Now that 75% of you have stopped reading this, I can speak specifically to the people who should be reading this.

Eador has a lot in common with those other two games I mentioned. Hiring heroes, outfitting them with gear and troops to roam the map conquering territory, building improvements in your castle, casting "adventure spells" and "combat spells" that you obtained from your buildings or looted scrolls. So many similarities, it captures all of the great things from the other games of this genre, so the decision whether to get this game hinges on what it does differently.

First of all, the scale of the game is enormous. The campaign is the primary game mode. You choose a "shard", which is a piece of a broken world, they are all just floating around in space, and each one has a unique set of properties that will alter the rules of the game on that shard. One shard might have magically infused crystals, making wizardry especially effective, or a desert shard makes it difficult for troops to move across a battlefield, etc. The shards also have a "size" (map size), and a reward for conquering the shard. The rewards are mostly centered around unlocking castle improvements, which will then be available to you in subsequent shards. With the exception of previous shard rewards, nothing carries over between shards, as your "character" is just the immortal calling the shots from above, and he can only pass on what he has learned. The shards all have their own inhabitants and a unique ecosystem. In addition, there will be other immortals, like yourself, on the shard trying to capture it. You capture the shard by conquering the castles of these other immortals. The winning immortal has the shard merge into his master shard, (a collection of all his previously captured shards). You can choose to attack these master shards, where it will be a 1v1 battle between you and the immortal who owns it. If an immortal loses a game on his master shard, he is eliminated from the campaign altogether, and all of his rewards go to the person who defeated him. This is true for you as well, some immortals will attack your master shard, and losing means game over. Also keep in mind that while you are attacking shards, the other immortals are going after them as well. Some shards might get snapped up while you are battling on a different one, so prioritize them if they contain technology that is part of your fundamental strategy.

All the while this is going on, there will be plenty of bantering, wheeling and dealing, smack talking, and good old fashioned back stabbing happening between the immortals. All of them want something from you, want you to hate the people they hate, or try to convert you to whatever their psychopathic vision might be for how the universe should operate. You can take them up on these things, and it can have a dramatic effect on the "storyline" of the game. You can kill them off if you choose, and they will do it to each other from time to time when the universe gets crowded. There are many of them, and more of them will keep springing up along the way, each with their own personality, back story, misguided morals, and gameplay strategies. The choices you make in game will affect their attitude toward you.

It's important to understand the whole shard and immortal concept of the game because this is a big turn off for some people. Conquering a single shard is like playing an entire game from start to finish in any other strategy title, something that can take 1 to 12 hours, depending on the map size. Then you move on to the next shard where all your heroes are level 1 again, and all your phat loot is gone, and your castle has no upgrades again. While 95% of your time will be spent battling on shards, the overall story arc and meaningful strategic decisions will happen outside of them. This is what makes the game feel like it has nearly infinite possibilities and replay value for me, but I've heard others comment that moving from shard to shard feels punishing as you have to keep "starting over". You definitely need to decide which camp you fall in.

The pace of the game is much slower and more nuanced than similar titles. You will be faced with MANY decisions in the game, and their impact is rarely immediate. These will come in the form of random events and encounters, where you will be making moral or monetary choices, which buildings you build will open other building possibilities while closing a bunch of others, and the troops you hire will have their own alignments and synergies. In a game like Heroes of Might and Magic, the outcome of the game might be decided on turn 9, by the guy who built his capital first, or captured the ultimate artifact, and the rest is just cleanup. In Eador, you build momentum. You pay 50 gold for +2 gold a turn, because in 30 turns, you're going to be glad you did. Your strategy is the culmination of all your decisions and how effectively you can align them with a particular end goal. Not to say that nothing significant happens, because it does, but for the most part you're playing from a macroeconomic perspective. This also frustrates some players because it can be hard to tell whether you are doing well, and there are so many choices to make without any clear indicator of what your priorities should be. It also doesn't help that the AI can be pretty brutal at times, so right when you are feeling way out of your element, someone is going to come along and crush you very unceremoniously, leaving you feeling pretty sour. I assure you that after a few shards, you will know what you are doing, and why you got crushed, and all that confusion and frustration will turn into excitement and possibilities.

Heroes and troops are the core of shard conquering, and the best ones require a robust economy to support. Heroes engage in combat just like troops. They also can become very formidable relatively quickly, making lower level troops more like obstacles in a battle between heroes. There are 4 ranks of troops, and it takes a lot of time and resources to obtain higher ranks. Consequently, the combat effectiveness between the ranks is very significant. A dragon, hydra, or phoenix would be a rank 4 unit. These are very powerful, and could easily clean up an entire army low rank troops like swordsmen or clerics. This huge disparity of power is another frequent complaint. Just know that while each troop will have his moment of glory, and play a pivotal role in your advancement, most of them are unlikely to be useful beyond that point in the shard.

The game has a ton of content. After 300 hours, I don't even have half of the achievements, and I'm constantly finding things I've never seen before. In combination with the stunning amount of replay value, this makes for a game that manages to stay fresh.

My only complaints are AI turn times in large maps with many opponents during the late game can be long. Patches have made it better, but it's still irritating sometimes.

It's had a history of bugs. The last patch introduced a pointer error that made it unplayable for me, but a reinstall seems to have alleviated it completely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028354069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 12017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12979, 'last_played': 1465258925}
review: While I can't recommend the campaign beyond its qualities as a tutorial, I do recommend the custom game and the entertaining mix of exploration, role-playing and tactical combat in Eador.  I've not played anything quite like it before and I look forward to future updates and fixes.   Recommended with reservations at full price and with gusto if you see it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008893239', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1377105928}
review: If you liked HoMM this is a must have :) At the moment there are still a lot of bugs and the game has a slow gameplay pace. There are tons of parameters, skills, attributes, build trees etc. in the game and it seems like maxing all campaigns is going to be well over 100 hours. So if you want a more complex and complicated version of HoMM this is for you. But it's going to suck a lot of your time ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970634020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1367737200}
review:
I like the idea of this game:  a 4x (like Civ) but with its own tweeks and interesting turns on the genre.  I would not call this a finished game.   It's not buggy... it's just not intuitive enough yet to make any fucking sense at higher difficulty than minimum because there is absolutely no tutorial and no "common sense" to the difficulty progression.

Unfortunately I can't read minds through the interwebs yet.  So, lord knows that if the developer thinks this is a finished product, then this is a terrible game.

Its interesting enough to play if it was free.  May be like $5... nah scratch that: free.
